1_Bulbasaur.name: Bulbasaur
1_Bulbasaur.description: For some time after its birth, it grows by taking nourishment from the seed on its back.

fields.Evolution: **Bulbasaur** evolves to **Ivysaur** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Venusaur** starting from level 32.

605_Elgyem.name: Elgyem
605_Elgyem.description: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.

fields.Evolution: **Elgyem** evolves to **Beheeyem** starting from level 42.

2_Ivysaur.name: Ivysaur
2_Ivysaur.description: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.

fields.Evolution: **Ivysaur** evolves from **Bulbasaur** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Venusaur** starting from level 32.

606_Beheeyem.name: Beheeyem
606_Beheeyem.description: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

fields.Evolution: **Beheeyem** evolves from **Elgyem** starting from level 42.

3_Venusaur.name: Venusaur
3_Venusaur.description: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Venusaur** evolves from **Ivysaur** starting from level 32, which evolves from **Bulbasaur** starting from level 16.

607_Litwick.name: Litwick
607_Litwick.description: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

fields.Evolution: **Litwick** evolves to **Lampent** starting from level 41, which evolves to **Chandelure** using a Dusk Stone.

3_Mega Venusaur.name: Mega Venusaur
3_Mega Venusaur.description: In order to support its flower, which has grown larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs have become stronger.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Venusaur** transforms from **Venusaur** when given a Mega Evolution.

608_Lampent.name: Lampent
608_Lampent.description: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

fields.Evolution: **Lampent** evolves from **Litwick** starting from level 41 and evolves to **Chandelure** using a Dusk Stone.

3_Gigantamax Venusaur.name: Gigantamax Venusaur
3_Gigantamax Venusaur.description: Huge amounts of pollen burst from it with the force of a volcanic eruption. Breathing in too much of the pollen can cause fainting.

609_Chandelure.name: Chandelure
609_Chandelure.description: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

fields.Evolution: **Chandelure** evolves from **Lampent** using a Dusk Stone, which evolves from **Litwick** starting from level 41.

4_Charmander.name: Charmander
4_Charmander.description: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If the Pokémon is healthy, its tail burns intensely.

fields.Evolution: **Charmander** evolves to **Charmeleon** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Charizard** starting from level 36.

610_Axew.name: Axew
610_Axew.description: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.

fields.Evolution: **Axew** evolves to **Fraxure** starting from level 38, which evolves to **Haxorus** starting from level 48.

611_Fraxure.name: Fraxure
611_Fraxure.description: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.

fields.Evolution: **Fraxure** evolves from **Axew** starting from level 38 and evolves to **Haxorus** starting from level 48.

5_Charmeleon.name: Charmeleon
5_Charmeleon.description: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

fields.Evolution: **Charmeleon** evolves from **Charmander** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Charizard** starting from level 36.

6_Charizard.name: Charizard
6_Charizard.description: It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

fields.Evolution: **Charizard** evolves from **Charmeleon** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Charmander** starting from level 16.

612_Haxorus.name: Haxorus
612_Haxorus.description: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.

fields.Evolution: **Haxorus** evolves from **Fraxure** starting from level 48, which evolves from **Axew** starting from level 38.

6_Mega Charizard X.name: Mega Charizard X
6_Mega Charizard X.description: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and create intense blue flames.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Charizard X** transforms from **Charizard** when given a X Mega Evolution.

613_Cubchoo.name: Cubchoo
613_Cubchoo.description: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, you’ll get frostbite.

fields.Evolution: **Cubchoo** evolves to **Beartic** starting from level 37.

6_Mega Charizard Y.name: Mega Charizard Y
6_Mega Charizard Y.description: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Charizard Y** transforms from **Charizard** when given a Y Mega Evolution.

614_Beartic.name: Beartic
614_Beartic.description: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.

fields.Evolution: **Beartic** evolves from **Cubchoo** starting from level 37.

6_Gigantamax Charizard.name: Gigantamax Charizard
6_Gigantamax Charizard.description: The flame inside its body burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit. When Charizard roars, that temperature climbs even higher.

615_Cryogonal.name: Cryogonal
615_Cryogonal.description: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.

7_Squirtle.name: Squirtle
7_Squirtle.description: It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

fields.Evolution: **Squirtle** evolves to **Wartortle** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Blastoise** starting from level 36.

616_Shelmet.name: Shelmet
616_Shelmet.description: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.

fields.Evolution: **Shelmet** evolves to **Accelgor** when traded.

8_Wartortle.name: Wartortle
8_Wartortle.description: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

fields.Evolution: **Wartortle** evolves from **Squirtle** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Blastoise** starting from level 36.

617_Accelgor.name: Accelgor
617_Accelgor.description: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

fields.Evolution: **Accelgor** evolves from **Shelmet** when traded.

9_Blastoise.name: Blastoise
9_Blastoise.description: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

fields.Evolution: **Blastoise** evolves from **Wartortle** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Squirtle** starting from level 16.

618_Stunfisk.name: Stunfisk
618_Stunfisk.description: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.

9_Mega Blastoise.name: Mega Blastoise
9_Mega Blastoise.description: The cannon on its back is as powerful as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Blastoise** transforms from **Blastoise** when given a Mega Evolution.

618_Galarian Stunfisk.name: Galarian Stunfisk
618_Galarian Stunfisk.description: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.

9_Gigantamax Blastoise.name: Gigantamax Blastoise
9_Gigantamax Blastoise.description: Water fired from this Pokémon's central main cannon has enough power to blast a hole into a mountain.

619_Mienfoo.name: Mienfoo
619_Mienfoo.description: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

fields.Evolution: **Mienfoo** evolves to **Mienshao** starting from level 50.

10_Caterpie.name: Caterpie
10_Caterpie.description: It releases a stench from its red antennae to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

fields.Evolution: **Caterpie** evolves to **Metapod** starting from level 7, which evolves to **Butterfree** starting from level 10.

620_Mienshao.name: Mienshao
620_Mienshao.description: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

fields.Evolution: **Mienshao** evolves from **Mienfoo** starting from level 50.

11_Metapod.name: Metapod
11_Metapod.description: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. The Pokémon quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

fields.Evolution: **Metapod** evolves from **Caterpie** starting from level 7 and evolves to **Butterfree** starting from level 10.

621_Druddigon.name: Druddigon
621_Druddigon.description: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

622_Golett.name: Golett
622_Golett.description: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

fields.Evolution: **Golett** evolves to **Golurk** starting from level 43.

12_Butterfree.name: Butterfree
12_Butterfree.description: It loves the nectar of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

fields.Evolution: **Butterfree** evolves from **Metapod** starting from level 10, which evolves from **Caterpie** starting from level 7.

12_Gigantamax Butterfree.name: Gigantamax Butterfree
12_Gigantamax Butterfree.description: Once it has opponents trapped in a tornado that could blow away a 10-ton truck, it finishes them off with its poisonous scales.

623_Golurk.name: Golurk
623_Golurk.description: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.

fields.Evolution: **Golurk** evolves from **Golett** starting from level 43.

13_Weedle.name: Weedle
13_Weedle.description: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

fields.Evolution: **Weedle** evolves to **Kakuna** starting from level 7, which evolves to **Beedrill** starting from level 10.

624_Pawniard.name: Pawniard
624_Pawniard.description: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.

fields.Evolution: **Pawniard** evolves to **Bisharp** starting from level 52, which evolves to **Kingambit** when leveled up while holding a Leader's Crest.

14_Kakuna.name: Kakuna
14_Kakuna.description: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

fields.Evolution: **Kakuna** evolves from **Weedle** starting from level 7 and evolves to **Beedrill** starting from level 10.

625_Bisharp.name: Bisharp
625_Bisharp.description: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.

fields.Evolution: **Bisharp** evolves from **Pawniard** starting from level 52 and evolves to **Kingambit** when leveled up while holding a Leader's Crest.

15_Beedrill.name: Beedrill
15_Beedrill.description: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

fields.Evolution: **Beedrill** evolves from **Kakuna** starting from level 10, which evolves from **Weedle** starting from level 7.

626_Bouffalant.name: Bouffalant
626_Bouffalant.description: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

627_Rufflet.name: Rufflet
627_Rufflet.description: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.

fields.Evolution: **Rufflet** evolves to **Braviary** starting from level 54.

15_Mega Beedrill.name: Mega Beedrill
15_Mega Beedrill.description: Its legs have become poison stingers. It stabs its prey repeatedly with the stingers on its limbs, dealing the final blow with the stinger on its rear.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Beedrill** transforms from **Beedrill** when given a Mega Evolution.

16_Pidgey.name: Pidgey
16_Pidgey.description: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

fields.Evolution: **Pidgey** evolves to **Pidgeotto** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Pidgeot** starting from level 36.

628_Braviary.name: Braviary
628_Braviary.description: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

fields.Evolution: **Braviary** evolves from **Rufflet** starting from level 54.

17_Pidgeotto.name: Pidgeotto
17_Pidgeotto.description: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

fields.Evolution: **Pidgeotto** evolves from **Pidgey** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Pidgeot** starting from level 36.

628_Hisuian Braviary.name: Hisuian Braviary
628_Hisuian Braviary.description: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.

629_Vullaby.name: Vullaby
629_Vullaby.description: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

fields.Evolution: **Vullaby** evolves to **Mandibuzz** starting from level 54.

18_Pidgeot.name: Pidgeot
18_Pidgeot.description: By flapping its wings with all its might, Pidgeot can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

fields.Evolution: **Pidgeot** evolves from **Pidgeotto** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Pidgey** starting from level 18.

630_Mandibuzz.name: Mandibuzz
630_Mandibuzz.description: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

fields.Evolution: **Mandibuzz** evolves from **Vullaby** starting from level 54.

18_Mega Pidgeot.name: Mega Pidgeot
18_Mega Pidgeot.description: With its muscular strength now greatly increased, it can fly continuously for two weeks without resting.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Pidgeot** transforms from **Pidgeot** when given a Mega Evolution.

631_Heatmor.name: Heatmor
631_Heatmor.description: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

19_Rattata.name: Rattata
19_Rattata.description: It’s cautious in the extreme, and its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

fields.Evolution: **Rattata** evolves to **Raticate** starting from level 20.

632_Durant.name: Durant
632_Durant.description: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

19_Alolan Rattata.name: Alolan Rattata
19_Alolan Rattata.description: Its whiskers provide it with a keen sense of smell, enabling it to pick up the scent of hidden food and locate it instantly.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Rattata** evolves to **Alolan Raticate** starting from level 20 in the nighttime.

633_Deino.name: Deino
633_Deino.description: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.

fields.Evolution: **Deino** evolves to **Zweilous** starting from level 50, which evolves to **Hydreigon** starting from level 64.

20_Raticate.name: Raticate
20_Raticate.description: It whittles down its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder block walls.

fields.Evolution: **Raticate** evolves from **Rattata** starting from level 20.

634_Zweilous.name: Zweilous
634_Zweilous.description: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.

fields.Evolution: **Zweilous** evolves from **Deino** starting from level 50 and evolves to **Hydreigon** starting from level 64.

20_Alolan Raticate.name: Alolan Raticate
20_Alolan Raticate.description: It makes its Rattata underlings gather food for it, dining solely on the most nutritious and delicious fare.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Raticate** evolves from **Alolan Rattata** starting from level 20 in the nighttime.

635_Hydreigon.name: Hydreigon
635_Hydreigon.description: It’s said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.

fields.Evolution: **Hydreigon** evolves from **Zweilous** starting from level 64, which evolves from **Deino** starting from level 50.

21_Spearow.name: Spearow
21_Spearow.description: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

fields.Evolution: **Spearow** evolves to **Fearow** starting from level 20.

636_Larvesta.name: Larvesta
636_Larvesta.description: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.

fields.Evolution: **Larvesta** evolves to **Volcarona** starting from level 59.

637_Volcarona.name: Volcarona
637_Volcarona.description: This Pokémon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heat—it’s in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.

fields.Evolution: **Volcarona** evolves from **Larvesta** starting from level 59.

23_Ekans.name: Ekans
23_Ekans.description: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

fields.Evolution: **Ekans** evolves to **Arbok** starting from level 22.

22_Fearow.name: Fearow
22_Fearow.description: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

fields.Evolution: **Fearow** evolves from **Spearow** starting from level 20.

638_Cobalion.name: Cobalion
638_Cobalion.description: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.

24_Arbok.name: Arbok
24_Arbok.description: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.

fields.Evolution: **Arbok** evolves from **Ekans** starting from level 22.

639_Terrakion.name: Terrakion
639_Terrakion.description: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.

25_Pikachu.name: Pikachu
25_Pikachu.description: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.

fields.Evolution: **Pikachu** evolves from **Pichu** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet and evolves to **Raichu** using a Thunder Stone.

640_Virizion.name: Virizion
640_Virizion.description: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.

25_Gigantamax Pikachu.name: Gigantamax Pikachu
25_Gigantamax Pikachu.description: When it smashes its opponents with its bolt- shaped tail, it delivers a surge of electricity equivalent to a lightning strike.

641_Tornadus.name: Tornadus
641_Tornadus.description: This storm-stirring Pokémon is said to cause the seasons to turn by whipping up the air. I suspect its humanlike form to be a false one.

25_Partner Pikachu.name: Partner Pikachu
25_Partner Pikachu.description: This Pikachu wears its partner’s cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed as the two overcame many hardships together.

641_Therian Tornadus.name: Therian Tornadus
641_Therian Tornadus.description: An example of what is known as a “form change,” though I suspect this strange avian guise to be Tornadus’s true form. Tornadus has been sighted crossing the ocean while in this form.

fields.Evolution: **Therian Tornadus** transforms from **Tornadus** when given a Reveal Glass.

26_Raichu.name: Raichu
26_Raichu.description: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.

fields.Evolution: **Raichu** evolves from **Pikachu** using a Thunder Stone, which evolves from **Pichu** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

642_Thundurus.name: Thundurus
642_Thundurus.description: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.

26_Alolan Raichu.name: Alolan Raichu
26_Alolan Raichu.description: This Pokémon rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.

642_Therian Thundurus.name: Therian Thundurus
642_Therian Thundurus.description: Quick as a flash, it materializes out of nowhere. It pulverizes foes into nothingness with showers of devastatingly powerful lightning bolts launched from the string of orbs on its tail.

fields.Evolution: **Therian Thundurus** transforms from **Thundurus** when given a Reveal Glass.

27_Sandshrew.name: Sandshrew
27_Sandshrew.description: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

fields.Evolution: **Sandshrew** evolves to **Sandslash** starting from level 22.

643_Reshiram.name: Reshiram
643_Reshiram.description: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.

27_Alolan Sandshrew.name: Alolan Sandshrew
27_Alolan Sandshrew.description: It lives in snowy mountains on southern islands. When a blizzard rolls in, this Pokémon hunkers down in the snow to avoid getting blown away.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Sandshrew** evolves to **Alolan Sandslash** using a Ice Stone.

28_Sandslash.name: Sandslash
28_Sandslash.description: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

fields.Evolution: **Sandslash** evolves from **Sandshrew** starting from level 22.

644_Zekrom.name: Zekrom
644_Zekrom.description: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.

645_Landorus.name: Landorus
645_Landorus.description: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.

28_Alolan Sandslash.name: Alolan Sandslash
28_Alolan Sandslash.description: Many people climb snowy mountains, hoping to see the icy spikes of these Pokémon glistening in the light of dawn.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Sandslash** evolves from **Alolan Sandshrew** using a Ice Stone.

645_Therian Landorus.name: Therian Landorus
645_Therian Landorus.description: Landorus soars through the sky in this form, bestowing plentiful harvests upon the land and earning the people’s reverence. It can traverse the whole of Hisui in a mere couple of hours.

fields.Evolution: **Therian Landorus** transforms from **Landorus** when given a Reveal Glass.

29_Nidoran♀️.name: Nidoran♀️
29_Nidoran♀️.description: While this Pokémon does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the venom it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.

fields.Evolution: **Nidoran♀️** evolves to **Nidorina** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Nidoqueen** using a Moon Stone.

646_Kyurem.name: Kyurem
646_Kyurem.description: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.

30_Nidorina.name: Nidorina
30_Nidorina.description: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow more slowly than Nidorino’s.

fields.Evolution: **Nidorina** evolves from **Nidoran♀️** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Nidoqueen** using a Moon Stone.

646_Black Kyurem.name: Black Kyurem
646_Black Kyurem.description: The sameness of Zekrom’s and Kyurem’s genes allowed Kyurem to absorb Zekrom. Kyurem can now use the power of both electricity and ice.

fields.Evolution: **Black Kyurem** transforms from **Kyurem** when given a DNA Splicers.

31_Nidoqueen.name: Nidoqueen
31_Nidoqueen.description: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

fields.Evolution: **Nidoqueen** evolves from **Nidorina** using a Moon Stone, which evolves from **Nidoran♀️** starting from level 16.

646_White Kyurem.name: White Kyurem
646_White Kyurem.description: It has foreseen that a world of truth will arrive for people and Pokémon. It strives to protect that future.

fields.Evolution: **White Kyurem** transforms from **Kyurem** when given a DNA Splicers.

32_Nidoran♂️.name: Nidoran♂️
32_Nidoran♂️.description: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

fields.Evolution: **Nidoran♂️** evolves to **Nidorino** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Nidoking** using a Moon Stone.

647_Keldeo.name: Keldeo
647_Keldeo.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

fields.Evolution: **Keldeo** transforms to **Resolute Keldeo** when leveled up while knowing Secret Sword.

33_Nidorino.name: Nidorino
33_Nidorino.description: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes venom upon impact.

fields.Evolution: **Nidorino** evolves from **Nidoran♂️** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Nidoking** using a Moon Stone.

647_Resolute Keldeo.name: Resolute Keldeo
647_Resolute Keldeo.description: The power that lay hidden in its body now covers its horn, turning it into a sword that can slice through anything.

fields.Evolution: **Resolute Keldeo** transforms from **Keldeo** when leveled up while knowing Secret Sword.

34_Nidoking.name: Nidoking
34_Nidoking.description: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

fields.Evolution: **Nidoking** evolves from **Nidorino** using a Moon Stone, which evolves from **Nidoran♂️** starting from level 16.

35_Clefairy.name: Clefairy
35_Clefairy.description: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon’s night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.

fields.Evolution: **Clefairy** evolves from **Cleffa** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet and evolves to **Clefable** using a Moon Stone.

648_Meloetta.name: Meloetta
648_Meloetta.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

fields.Evolution: **Meloetta** transforms to **Pirouette Meloetta** when leveled up while knowing Relic Song.
**Pirouette Meloetta** transforms from **Meloetta** when leveled up while knowing Relic Song.

36_Clefable.name: Clefable
36_Clefable.description: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland, so far away.

fields.Evolution: **Clefable** evolves from **Clefairy** using a Moon Stone, which evolves from **Cleffa** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

649_Genesect.name: Genesect
649_Genesect.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

37_Vulpix.name: Vulpix
37_Vulpix.description: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail. As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.

fields.Evolution: **Vulpix** evolves to **Ninetales** using a Fire Stone.
**High-speed Flight Configuration Genesect** transforms from **Genesect** when given a Transformation.

650_Chespin.name: Chespin
650_Chespin.description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

fields.Evolution: **Chespin** evolves to **Quilladin** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Chesnaught** starting from level 36.

37_Alolan Vulpix.name: Alolan Vulpix
37_Alolan Vulpix.description: These Pokémon live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath. I suspect this species changed its form to adapt to the frigid climate.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Vulpix** evolves to **Alolan Ninetales** using a Ice Stone.

38_Ninetales.name: Ninetales
38_Ninetales.description: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.

fields.Evolution: **Ninetales** evolves from **Vulpix** using a Fire Stone.

651_Quilladin.name: Quilladin
651_Quilladin.description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

fields.Evolution: **Quilladin** evolves from **Chespin** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Chesnaught** starting from level 36.

38_Alolan Ninetales.name: Alolan Ninetales
38_Alolan Ninetales.description: Dwells on sacred peaks perpetually covered in snow. Said to appear to virtuous people who have lost their way on mountain paths—it then guides them back down to the mountain’s base.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Ninetales** evolves from **Alolan Vulpix** using a Ice Stone.

652_Chesnaught.name: Chesnaught
652_Chesnaught.description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

fields.Evolution: **Chesnaught** evolves from **Quilladin** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Chespin** starting from level 16.

39_Jigglypuff.name: Jigglypuff
39_Jigglypuff.description: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.

fields.Evolution: **Jigglypuff** evolves from **Igglybuff** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet and evolves to **Wigglytuff** using a Moon Stone.

653_Fennekin.name: Fennekin
653_Fennekin.description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

fields.Evolution: **Fennekin** evolves to **Braixen** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Delphox** starting from level 36.

40_Wigglytuff.name: Wigglytuff
40_Wigglytuff.description: The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it can’t stop touching it.

fields.Evolution: **Wigglytuff** evolves from **Jigglypuff** using a Moon Stone, which evolves from **Igglybuff** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

654_Braixen.name: Braixen
654_Braixen.description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

fields.Evolution: **Braixen** evolves from **Fennekin** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Delphox** starting from level 36.

655_Delphox.name: Delphox
655_Delphox.description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

fields.Evolution: **Delphox** evolves from **Braixen** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Fennekin** starting from level 16.

41_Zubat.name: Zubat
41_Zubat.description: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.

fields.Evolution: **Zubat** evolves to **Golbat** starting from level 22, which evolves to **Crobat** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

42_Golbat.name: Golbat
42_Golbat.description: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.

fields.Evolution: **Golbat** evolves from **Zubat** starting from level 22 and evolves to **Crobat** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

656_Froakie.name: Froakie
656_Froakie.description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

fields.Evolution: **Froakie** evolves to **Frogadier** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Greninja** starting from level 36.

43_Oddish.name: Oddish
43_Oddish.description: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

fields.Evolution: **Oddish** evolves to **Gloom** starting from level 21, which evolves to **Vileplume** using a Leaf Stone and evolves to **Bellossom** using a Sun Stone.

657_Frogadier.name: Frogadier
657_Frogadier.description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

fields.Evolution: **Frogadier** evolves from **Froakie** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Greninja** starting from level 36.

44_Gloom.name: Gloom
44_Gloom.description: The nectar it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious that it can make noses curl from more than a mile away.

fields.Evolution: **Gloom** evolves from **Oddish** starting from level 21 and evolves to **Vileplume** using a Leaf Stone and evolves to **Bellossom** using a Sun Stone.

658_Greninja.name: Greninja
658_Greninja.description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

fields.Evolution: **Greninja** evolves from **Frogadier** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Froakie** starting from level 16.

45_Vileplume.name: Vileplume
45_Vileplume.description: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

fields.Evolution: **Vileplume** evolves from **Gloom** using a Leaf Stone, which evolves from **Oddish** starting from level 21.

659_Bunnelby.name: Bunnelby
659_Bunnelby.description: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

fields.Evolution: **Bunnelby** evolves to **Diggersby** starting from level 20.

46_Paras.name: Paras
46_Paras.description: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

fields.Evolution: **Paras** evolves to **Parasect** starting from level 24.

660_Diggersby.name: Diggersby
660_Diggersby.description: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Diggersby** evolves from **Bunnelby** starting from level 20.

47_Parasect.name: Parasect
47_Parasect.description: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect’s actions.

fields.Evolution: **Parasect** evolves from **Paras** starting from level 24.

661_Fletchling.name: Fletchling
661_Fletchling.description: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.

fields.Evolution: **Fletchling** evolves to **Fletchinder** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Talonflame** starting from level 35.

48_Venonat.name: Venonat
48_Venonat.description: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.

fields.Evolution: **Venonat** evolves to **Venomoth** starting from level 31.

662_Fletchinder.name: Fletchinder
662_Fletchinder.description: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokémon should enter, it will show them no mercy.

fields.Evolution: **Fletchinder** evolves from **Fletchling** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Talonflame** starting from level 35.

49_Venomoth.name: Venomoth
49_Venomoth.description: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.

fields.Evolution: **Venomoth** evolves from **Venonat** starting from level 31.

663_Talonflame.name: Talonflame
663_Talonflame.description: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.

fields.Evolution: **Talonflame** evolves from **Fletchinder** starting from level 35, which evolves from **Fletchling** starting from level 17.

664_Scatterbug.name: Scatterbug
664_Scatterbug.description: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.

fields.Evolution: **Scatterbug** evolves to **Spewpa** starting from level 9, which evolves to **Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Icy Snow Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Polar Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Tundra Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Continental Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Garden Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Elegant Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Modern Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Marine Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Archipelago Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **High Plain Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Sandstorm Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **River Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Monsoon Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Savanna Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Sun Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Ocean Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves [...]

50_Diglett.name: Diglett
50_Diglett.description: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.

fields.Evolution: **Diglett** evolves to **Dugtrio** starting from level 26.

665_Spewpa.name: Spewpa
665_Spewpa.description: Spewpa doesn’t live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.

fields.Evolution: **Spewpa** evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9 and evolves to **Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Icy Snow Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Polar Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Tundra Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Continental Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Garden Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Elegant Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Modern Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Marine Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Archipelago Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **High Plain Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Sandstorm Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **River Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Monsoon Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Savanna Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Sun Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves to **Ocean Vivillon** starting from level 12, evolves [...]

50_Alolan Diglett.name: Alolan Diglett
50_Alolan Diglett.description: Its three hairs change shape depending on Diglett’s mood. They’re a useful communication tool among these Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Diglett** evolves to **Alolan Dugtrio** starting from level 26.

51_Dugtrio.name: Dugtrio
51_Dugtrio.description: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

fields.Evolution: **Dugtrio** evolves from **Diglett** starting from level 26.

666_Vivillon.name: Vivillon
666_Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

666_Icy Snow Vivillon.name: Icy Snow Vivillon
666_Icy Snow Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in frigid lands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Icy Snow Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

51_Alolan Dugtrio.name: Alolan Dugtrio
51_Alolan Dugtrio.description: The three of them get along very well. Through their formidable teamwork, they defeat powerful opponents.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Dugtrio** evolves from **Alolan Diglett** starting from level 26.

666_Polar Vivillon.name: Polar Vivillon
666_Polar Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a snowy land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Polar Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

52_Meowth.name: Meowth
52_Meowth.description: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.

fields.Evolution: **Meowth** evolves to **Persian** starting from level 28.

666_Tundra Vivillon.name: Tundra Vivillon
666_Tundra Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land of severe cold. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Tundra Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

52_Alolan Meowth.name: Alolan Meowth
52_Alolan Meowth.description: Deeply proud and keenly smart, this Pokémon moves with cunning during battle and relentlessly attacks enemies’ weak points.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Meowth** evolves to **Alolan Persian** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

666_Continental Vivillon.name: Continental Vivillon
666_Continental Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land of vast space. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Continental Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

52_Galarian Meowth.name: Galarian Meowth
52_Galarian Meowth.description: These daring Pokémon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect among Meowth.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Meowth** evolves to **Perrserker** starting from level 28.

666_Garden Vivillon.name: Garden Vivillon
666_Garden Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a verdant land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Garden Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

52_Gigantamax Meowth.name: Gigantamax Meowth
52_Gigantamax Meowth.description: Its body has grown incredibly long and the coin on its forehead has grown incredibly large—all thanks to Gigantamax power.

666_Elegant Vivillon.name: Elegant Vivillon
666_Elegant Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land with distinct seasons. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Elegant Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

53_Persian.name: Persian
53_Persian.description: It has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. This is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.

fields.Evolution: **Persian** evolves from **Meowth** starting from level 28.

666_Modern Vivillon.name: Modern Vivillon
666_Modern Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a sun-drenched land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Modern Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

53_Alolan Persian.name: Alolan Persian
53_Alolan Persian.description: This Pokémon is one tough opponent. Not only does it have formidable physical abilities, but it’s also not above fighting dirty.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Persian** evolves from **Alolan Meowth** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

666_Marine Vivillon.name: Marine Vivillon
666_Marine Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land with ocean breezes. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Marine Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

54_Psyduck.name: Psyduck
54_Psyduck.description: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.

fields.Evolution: **Psyduck** evolves to **Golduck** starting from level 33.

666_Archipelago Vivillon.name: Archipelago Vivillon
666_Archipelago Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a place with many islands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Archipelago Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

55_Golduck.name: Golduck
55_Golduck.description: It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow-moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.

fields.Evolution: **Golduck** evolves from **Psyduck** starting from level 33.

666_High Plain Vivillon.name: High Plain Vivillon
666_High Plain Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land with little rain. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **High Plain Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

56_Mankey.name: Mankey
56_Mankey.description: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

fields.Evolution: **Mankey** evolves to **Primeape** starting from level 28.

666_Sandstorm Vivillon.name: Sandstorm Vivillon
666_Sandstorm Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a parched land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Sandstorm Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

57_Primeape.name: Primeape
57_Primeape.description: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

fields.Evolution: **Primeape** evolves from **Mankey** starting from level 28.

666_River Vivillon.name: River Vivillon
666_River Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land where large rivers flow. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **River Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

58_Growlithe.name: Growlithe
58_Growlithe.description: It’s very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.

fields.Evolution: **Growlithe** evolves to **Arcanine** using a Fire Stone.

666_Monsoon Vivillon.name: Monsoon Vivillon
666_Monsoon Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land with intense rainfall. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Monsoon Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

58_Hisuian Growlithe.name: Hisuian Growlithe
58_Hisuian Growlithe.description: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Growlithe** evolves to **Hisuian Arcanine** using a Fire Stone.

666_Savanna Vivillon.name: Savanna Vivillon
666_Savanna Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land with a tropical climate. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Savanna Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

59_Arcanine.name: Arcanine
59_Arcanine.description: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can’t help but grovel before it.

fields.Evolution: **Arcanine** evolves from **Growlithe** using a Fire Stone.

666_Sun Vivillon.name: Sun Vivillon
666_Sun Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land bathed in light. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Sun Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

59_Hisuian Arcanine.name: Hisuian Arcanine
59_Hisuian Arcanine.description: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Arcanine** evolves from **Hisuian Growlithe** using a Fire Stone.

666_Ocean Vivillon.name: Ocean Vivillon
666_Ocean Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land of perpetual summer. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Ocean Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

60_Poliwag.name: Poliwag
60_Poliwag.description: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

fields.Evolution: **Poliwag** evolves to **Poliwhirl** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Poliwrath** using a Water Stone and evolves to **Politoed** when traded while holding a King's Rock.

666_Jungle Vivillon.name: Jungle Vivillon
666_Jungle Vivillon.description: This Pokémon was born in a land of tropical rain forests. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

fields.Evolution: **Jungle Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

61_Poliwhirl.name: Poliwhirl
61_Poliwhirl.description: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

fields.Evolution: **Poliwhirl** evolves from **Poliwag** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Poliwrath** using a Water Stone and evolves to **Politoed** when traded while holding a King's Rock.
**Fancy Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

62_Poliwrath.name: Poliwrath
62_Poliwrath.description: With its extremely tough muscles, it could keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

fields.Evolution: **Poliwrath** evolves from **Poliwhirl** using a Water Stone, which evolves from **Poliwag** starting from level 25.
**Poké Ball Vivillon** evolves from **Spewpa** starting from level 12, which evolves from **Scatterbug** starting from level 9.

63_Abra.name: Abra
63_Abra.description: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.

fields.Evolution: **Abra** evolves to **Kadabra** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Alakazam** when traded.

667_Litleo.name: Litleo
667_Litleo.description: The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.

fields.Evolution: **Litleo** evolves to **Pyroar** starting from level 35.

64_Kadabra.name: Kadabra
64_Kadabra.description: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.

fields.Evolution: **Kadabra** evolves from **Abra** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Alakazam** when traded.

668_Pyroar.name: Pyroar
668_Pyroar.description: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.

fields.Evolution: **Pyroar** evolves from **Litleo** starting from level 35.

65_Alakazam.name: Alakazam
65_Alakazam.description: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.

fields.Evolution: **Alakazam** evolves from **Kadabra** when traded, which evolves from **Abra** starting from level 16.

669_Flabébé.name: Flabébé
669_Flabébé.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

fields.Evolution: **Flabébé** evolves to **Floette** starting from level 19, which evolves to **Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

65_Mega Alakazam.name: Mega Alakazam
65_Mega Alakazam.description: It’s adept at precognition. When attacks completely miss Alakazam, that’s because it’s seeing the future.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Alakazam** transforms from **Alakazam** when given a Mega Evolution.

669_Yellow Flower Flabébé.name: Yellow Flower Flabébé
669_Yellow Flower Flabébé.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

fields.Evolution: **Yellow Flower Flabébé** evolves to **Yellow Flower Floette** starting from level 19, which evolves to **Yellow Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

66_Machop.name: Machop
66_Machop.description: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.

fields.Evolution: **Machop** evolves to **Machoke** starting from level 28, which evolves to **Machamp** when traded.

669_Orange Flower Flabébé.name: Orange Flower Flabébé
669_Orange Flower Flabébé.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

fields.Evolution: **Orange Flower Flabébé** evolves to **Orange Flower Floette** starting from level 19, which evolves to **Orange Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

67_Machoke.name: Machoke
67_Machoke.description: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.

fields.Evolution: **Machoke** evolves from **Machop** starting from level 28 and evolves to **Machamp** when traded.

669_Blue Flower Flabébé.name: Blue Flower Flabébé
669_Blue Flower Flabébé.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

fields.Evolution: **Blue Flower Flabébé** evolves to **Blue Flower Floette** starting from level 19, which evolves to **Blue Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

68_Machamp.name: Machamp
68_Machamp.description: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.

fields.Evolution: **Machamp** evolves from **Machoke** when traded, which evolves from **Machop** starting from level 28.

669_White Flower Flabébé.name: White Flower Flabébé
669_White Flower Flabébé.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

fields.Evolution: **White Flower Flabébé** evolves to **White Flower Floette** starting from level 19, which evolves to **White Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

68_Gigantamax Machamp.name: Gigantamax Machamp
68_Gigantamax Machamp.description: One of these Pokémon once used its immeasurable strength to lift a large ship that was in trouble. It then carried the ship to port.

670_Floette.name: Floette
670_Floette.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

fields.Evolution: **Floette** evolves from **Flabébé** starting from level 19 and evolves to **Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

670_Yellow Flower Floette.name: Yellow Flower Floette
670_Yellow Flower Floette.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

fields.Evolution: **Yellow Flower Floette** evolves from **Yellow Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19 and evolves to **Yellow Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

69_Bellsprout.name: Bellsprout
69_Bellsprout.description: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

fields.Evolution: **Bellsprout** evolves to **Weepinbell** starting from level 21, which evolves to **Victreebel** using a Leaf Stone.

670_Orange Flower Floette.name: Orange Flower Floette
670_Orange Flower Floette.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

fields.Evolution: **Orange Flower Floette** evolves from **Orange Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19 and evolves to **Orange Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

70_Weepinbell.name: Weepinbell
70_Weepinbell.description: This Pokémon has the appearance of a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

fields.Evolution: **Weepinbell** evolves from **Bellsprout** starting from level 21 and evolves to **Victreebel** using a Leaf Stone.

71_Victreebel.name: Victreebel
71_Victreebel.description: In its mouth, it pools a fragrant nectar-like fluid. The fluid is really an acid that dissolves anything.

fields.Evolution: **Victreebel** evolves from **Weepinbell** using a Leaf Stone, which evolves from **Bellsprout** starting from level 21.

670_Blue Flower Floette.name: Blue Flower Floette
670_Blue Flower Floette.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

fields.Evolution: **Blue Flower Floette** evolves from **Blue Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19 and evolves to **Blue Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

670_White Flower Floette.name: White Flower Floette
670_White Flower Floette.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

fields.Evolution: **White Flower Floette** evolves from **White Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19 and evolves to **White Flower Florges** using a Shiny Stone.

72_Tentacool.name: Tentacool
72_Tentacool.description: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.

fields.Evolution: **Tentacool** evolves to **Tentacruel** starting from level 30.

671_Florges.name: Florges
671_Florges.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

fields.Evolution: **Florges** evolves from **Floette** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **Flabébé** starting from level 19.

73_Tentacruel.name: Tentacruel
73_Tentacruel.description: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.

fields.Evolution: **Tentacruel** evolves from **Tentacool** starting from level 30.

671_Yellow Flower Florges.name: Yellow Flower Florges
671_Yellow Flower Florges.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

fields.Evolution: **Yellow Flower Florges** evolves from **Yellow Flower Floette** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **Yellow Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19.

74_Geodude.name: Geodude
74_Geodude.description: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.

fields.Evolution: **Geodude** evolves to **Graveler** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Golem** when traded.

671_Orange Flower Florges.name: Orange Flower Florges
671_Orange Flower Florges.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

fields.Evolution: **Orange Flower Florges** evolves from **Orange Flower Floette** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **Orange Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19.

74_Alolan Geodude.name: Alolan Geodude
74_Alolan Geodude.description: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you’ll be in for a painful shock.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Geodude** evolves to **Alolan Graveler** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Alolan Golem** when traded.

671_Blue Flower Florges.name: Blue Flower Florges
671_Blue Flower Florges.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

fields.Evolution: **Blue Flower Florges** evolves from **Blue Flower Floette** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **Blue Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19.

75_Graveler.name: Graveler
75_Graveler.description: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.

fields.Evolution: **Graveler** evolves from **Geodude** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Golem** when traded.

671_White Flower Florges.name: White Flower Florges
671_White Flower Florges.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

fields.Evolution: **White Flower Florges** evolves from **White Flower Floette** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **White Flower Flabébé** starting from level 19.

75_Alolan Graveler.name: Alolan Graveler
75_Alolan Graveler.description: When it comes rolling down a mountain path, anything in its way gets zapped by electricity and sent flying.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Graveler** evolves from **Alolan Geodude** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Alolan Golem** when traded.

672_Skiddo.name: Skiddo
672_Skiddo.description: As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.

fields.Evolution: **Skiddo** evolves to **Gogoat** starting from level 32.

76_Golem.name: Golem
76_Golem.description: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.

fields.Evolution: **Golem** evolves from **Graveler** when traded, which evolves from **Geodude** starting from level 25.

673_Gogoat.name: Gogoat
673_Gogoat.description: These Pokémon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.

fields.Evolution: **Gogoat** evolves from **Skiddo** starting from level 32.

76_Alolan Golem.name: Alolan Golem
76_Alolan Golem.description: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn’t score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Golem** evolves from **Alolan Graveler** when traded, which evolves from **Alolan Geodude** starting from level 25.

674_Pancham.name: Pancham
674_Pancham.description: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

fields.Evolution: **Pancham** evolves to **Pangoro** starting from level 32.

77_Ponyta.name: Ponyta
77_Ponyta.description: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.

fields.Evolution: **Ponyta** evolves to **Rapidash** starting from level 40.

675_Pangoro.name: Pangoro
675_Pangoro.description: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

fields.Evolution: **Pangoro** evolves from **Pancham** starting from level 32.

77_Galarian Ponyta.name: Galarian Ponyta
77_Galarian Ponyta.description: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Ponyta** evolves to **Galarian Rapidash** starting from level 40.

676_Furfrou.name: Furfrou
676_Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

78_Rapidash.name: Rapidash
78_Rapidash.description: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.

fields.Evolution: **Rapidash** evolves from **Ponyta** starting from level 40.

676_Heart Trim Furfrou.name: Heart Trim Furfrou
676_Heart Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Heart Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

78_Galarian Rapidash.name: Galarian Rapidash
78_Galarian Rapidash.description: Brave and prideful, this Pokémon dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by the psychic power stored in the fur on its fetlocks.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Rapidash** evolves from **Galarian Ponyta** starting from level 40.

676_Star Trim Furfrou.name: Star Trim Furfrou
676_Star Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Star Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

79_Slowpoke.name: Slowpoke
79_Slowpoke.description: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.

fields.Evolution: **Slowpoke** evolves to **Slowbro** starting from level 37 and evolves to **Slowking** when traded while holding a King's Rock.

676_Diamond Trim Furfrou.name: Diamond Trim Furfrou
676_Diamond Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Diamond Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

79_Galarian Slowpoke.name: Galarian Slowpoke
79_Galarian Slowpoke.description: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Slowpoke** evolves to **Galarian Slowbro** using a Galarica Cuff and evolves to **Galarian Slowking** using a Galarica Wreath.

676_Debutante Trim Furfrou.name: Debutante Trim Furfrou
676_Debutante Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Debutante Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

80_Slowbro.name: Slowbro
80_Slowbro.description: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokémon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.

fields.Evolution: **Slowbro** evolves from **Slowpoke** starting from level 37.

676_Matron Trim Furfrou.name: Matron Trim Furfrou
676_Matron Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Matron Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

80_Mega Slowbro.name: Mega Slowbro
80_Mega Slowbro.description: Under the influence of Shellder’s digestive fluids, Slowpoke has awakened, gaining a great deal of power—and a little motivation to boot.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Slowbro** transforms from **Slowbro** when given a Mega Evolution.

676_Dandy Trim Furfrou.name: Dandy Trim Furfrou
676_Dandy Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Dandy Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

676_La Reine Trim Furfrou.name: La Reine Trim Furfrou
676_La Reine Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **La Reine Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

80_Galarian Slowbro.name: Galarian Slowbro
80_Galarian Slowbro.description: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Slowbro** evolves from **Galarian Slowpoke** using a Galarica Cuff.

81_Magnemite.name: Magnemite
81_Magnemite.description: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.

fields.Evolution: **Magnemite** evolves to **Magneton** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Magnezone** using a Thunder Stone.

676_Kabuki Trim Furfrou.name: Kabuki Trim Furfrou
676_Kabuki Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Kabuki Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

82_Magneton.name: Magneton
82_Magneton.description: They’re formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

fields.Evolution: **Magneton** evolves from **Magnemite** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Magnezone** using a Thunder Stone.

676_Pharaoh Trim Furfrou.name: Pharaoh Trim Furfrou
676_Pharaoh Trim Furfrou.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

fields.Evolution: **Pharaoh Trim Furfrou** transforms from **Furfrou** when given a Shears.

83_Farfetch'd.name: Farfetch'd
83_Farfetch'd.description: It can’t live without the stalk it holds. That’s why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

677_Espurr.name: Espurr
677_Espurr.description: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

fields.Evolution: **Espurr** evolves to **Meowstic** starting from level 25.

83_Galarian Farfetch'd.name: Galarian Farfetch'd
83_Galarian Farfetch'd.description: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetch’d that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Farfetch'd** evolves to **Sirfetch'd** somehow.

678_Meowstic.name: Meowstic
678_Meowstic.description: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

fields.Evolution: **Meowstic** evolves from **Espurr** starting from level 25.

679_Honedge.name: Honedge
679_Honedge.description: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.

fields.Evolution: **Honedge** evolves to **Doublade** starting from level 35, which evolves to **Aegislash** using a Dusk Stone.

84_Doduo.name: Doduo
84_Doduo.description: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

fields.Evolution: **Doduo** evolves to **Dodrio** starting from level 31.

85_Dodrio.name: Dodrio
85_Dodrio.description: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémon runs at nearly 40 mph.

fields.Evolution: **Dodrio** evolves from **Doduo** starting from level 31.

680_Doublade.name: Doublade
680_Doublade.description: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

fields.Evolution: **Doublade** evolves from **Honedge** starting from level 35 and evolves to **Aegislash** using a Dusk Stone.

86_Seel.name: Seel
86_Seel.description: This Pokémon lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.

fields.Evolution: **Seel** evolves to **Dewgong** starting from level 34.

681_Aegislash.name: Aegislash
681_Aegislash.description: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

fields.Evolution: **Aegislash** evolves from **Doublade** using a Dusk Stone, which evolves from **Honedge** starting from level 35.

681_Blade Aegislash.name: Blade Aegislash
681_Blade Aegislash.description: Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

fields.Evolution: **Blade Aegislash** transforms from **Aegislash** when given a Transformation.

87_Dewgong.name: Dewgong
87_Dewgong.description: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

fields.Evolution: **Dewgong** evolves from **Seel** starting from level 34.

88_Grimer.name: Grimer
88_Grimer.description: When two of these Pokémon’s bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.

fields.Evolution: **Grimer** evolves to **Muk** starting from level 38.

682_Spritzee.name: Spritzee
682_Spritzee.description: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.

fields.Evolution: **Spritzee** evolves to **Aromatisse** when traded while holding a Sachet.

88_Alolan Grimer.name: Alolan Grimer
88_Alolan Grimer.description: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Grimer** evolves to **Alolan Muk** starting from level 38.

683_Aromatisse.name: Aromatisse
683_Aromatisse.description: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

fields.Evolution: **Aromatisse** evolves from **Spritzee** when traded while holding a Sachet.

89_Muk.name: Muk
89_Muk.description: It’s so stinky! Muk’s body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.

fields.Evolution: **Muk** evolves from **Grimer** starting from level 38.

684_Swirlix.name: Swirlix
684_Swirlix.description: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

fields.Evolution: **Swirlix** evolves to **Slurpuff** when traded while holding a Whipped Dream.

89_Alolan Muk.name: Alolan Muk
89_Alolan Muk.description: Muk’s coloration becomes increasingly vivid the more it feasts on its favorite dish—trash.

fields.Evolution: **Alolan Muk** evolves from **Alolan Grimer** starting from level 38.

685_Slurpuff.name: Slurpuff
685_Slurpuff.description: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

fields.Evolution: **Slurpuff** evolves from **Swirlix** when traded while holding a Whipped Dream.

686_Inkay.name: Inkay
686_Inkay.description: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

fields.Evolution: **Inkay** evolves to **Malamar** starting from level 30.

90_Shellder.name: Shellder
90_Shellder.description: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.

fields.Evolution: **Shellder** evolves to **Cloyster** using a Water Stone.

687_Malamar.name: Malamar
687_Malamar.description: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

fields.Evolution: **Malamar** evolves from **Inkay** starting from level 30.

91_Cloyster.name: Cloyster
91_Cloyster.description: When attacked, it launches its spikes in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

fields.Evolution: **Cloyster** evolves from **Shellder** using a Water Stone.

688_Binacle.name: Binacle
688_Binacle.description: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

fields.Evolution: **Binacle** evolves to **Barbaracle** starting from level 39.

92_Gastly.name: Gastly
92_Gastly.description: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.

fields.Evolution: **Gastly** evolves to **Haunter** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Gengar** when traded.

689_Barbaracle.name: Barbaracle
689_Barbaracle.description: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

fields.Evolution: **Barbaracle** evolves from **Binacle** starting from level 39.

93_Haunter.name: Haunter
93_Haunter.description: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.

fields.Evolution: **Haunter** evolves from **Gastly** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Gengar** when traded.

690_Skrelp.name: Skrelp
690_Skrelp.description: This Pokémon is a poor swimmer. If it’s caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.

fields.Evolution: **Skrelp** evolves to **Dragalge** starting from level 48.

94_Gengar.name: Gengar
94_Gengar.description: Hiding in people’s shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.

fields.Evolution: **Gengar** evolves from **Haunter** when traded, which evolves from **Gastly** starting from level 25.

691_Dragalge.name: Dragalge
691_Dragalge.description: Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.

fields.Evolution: **Dragalge** evolves from **Skrelp** starting from level 48.

94_Mega Gengar.name: Mega Gengar
94_Mega Gengar.description: It can pass through other dimensions and can appear anywhere. It caused a stir one time when it stuck just one leg out of a wall.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Gengar** transforms from **Gengar** when given a Mega Evolution.

94_Gigantamax Gengar.name: Gigantamax Gengar
94_Gigantamax Gengar.description: It lays traps, hoping to steal the lives of those it catches. If you stand in front of its mouth, you’ll hear your loved ones’ voices calling out to you.

692_Clauncher.name: Clauncher
692_Clauncher.description: Clauncher’s claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesn’t appeal to all tastes.

fields.Evolution: **Clauncher** evolves to **Clawitzer** starting from level 37.

95_Onix.name: Onix
95_Onix.description: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.

fields.Evolution: **Onix** evolves to **Steelix** when traded while holding a Metal Coat.

693_Clawitzer.name: Clawitzer
693_Clawitzer.description: The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.

fields.Evolution: **Clawitzer** evolves from **Clauncher** starting from level 37.

694_Helioptile.name: Helioptile
694_Helioptile.description: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

fields.Evolution: **Helioptile** evolves to **Heliolisk** using a Sun Stone.

96_Drowzee.name: Drowzee
96_Drowzee.description: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
