fields.Evolution: **Drowzee** evolves to **Hypno** starting from level 26.

695_Heliolisk.name: Heliolisk
695_Heliolisk.description: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

fields.Evolution: **Heliolisk** evolves from **Helioptile** using a Sun Stone.

97_Hypno.name: Hypno
97_Hypno.description: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.

fields.Evolution: **Hypno** evolves from **Drowzee** starting from level 26.

696_Tyrunt.name: Tyrunt
696_Tyrunt.description: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.

fields.Evolution: **Tyrunt** evolves to **Tyrantrum** starting from level 39 in the daytime.

98_Krabby.name: Krabby
98_Krabby.description: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are lost in battle.

fields.Evolution: **Krabby** evolves to **Kingler** starting from level 28.

697_Tyrantrum.name: Tyrantrum
697_Tyrantrum.description: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.

fields.Evolution: **Tyrantrum** evolves from **Tyrunt** starting from level 39 in the daytime.

99_Kingler.name: Kingler
99_Kingler.description: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

fields.Evolution: **Kingler** evolves from **Krabby** starting from level 28.

698_Amaura.name: Amaura
698_Amaura.description: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.

fields.Evolution: **Amaura** evolves to **Aurorus** starting from level 39 in the nighttime.

99_Gigantamax Kingler.name: Gigantamax Kingler
99_Gigantamax Kingler.description: The bubbles it spews out are strongly alkaline. Any opponents hit by them will have their bodies quickly melted away.

699_Aurorus.name: Aurorus
699_Aurorus.description: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

fields.Evolution: **Aurorus** evolves from **Amaura** starting from level 39 in the nighttime.

100_Voltorb.name: Voltorb
100_Voltorb.description: It’s usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

fields.Evolution: **Voltorb** evolves to **Electrode** starting from level 30.

700_Sylveon.name: Sylveon
700_Sylveon.description: Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents’ weak spots.

fields.Evolution: **Sylveon** evolves from **Eevee** when leveled up while knowing a Fairy-type move.

100_Hisuian Voltorb.name: Hisuian Voltorb
100_Hisuian Voltorb.description: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Voltorb** evolves to **Hisuian Electrode** using a Leaf Stone.

701_Hawlucha.name: Hawlucha
701_Hawlucha.description: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.

101_Electrode.name: Electrode
101_Electrode.description: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of the Bomb Ball.

fields.Evolution: **Electrode** evolves from **Voltorb** starting from level 30.

702_Dedenne.name: Dedenne
702_Dedenne.description: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.

101_Hisuian Electrode.name: Hisuian Electrode
101_Hisuian Electrode.description: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Electrode** evolves from **Hisuian Voltorb** using a Leaf Stone.

703_Carbink.name: Carbink
703_Carbink.description: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

102_Exeggcute.name: Exeggcute
102_Exeggcute.description: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

fields.Evolution: **Exeggcute** evolves to **Exeggutor** using a Leaf Stone.

704_Goomy.name: Goomy
704_Goomy.description: Goomy’s horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomy’s senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.

fields.Evolution: **Goomy** evolves to **Sliggoo** starting from level 40, which evolves to **Goodra** starting from level 50.

103_Exeggutor.name: Exeggutor
103_Exeggutor.description: It is called the Walking Jungle. If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

fields.Evolution: **Exeggutor** evolves from **Exeggcute** using a Leaf Stone.

705_Sliggoo.name: Sliggoo
705_Sliggoo.description: When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated—it’ll dissolve anything.

fields.Evolution: **Sliggoo** evolves from **Goomy** starting from level 40 and evolves to **Goodra** starting from level 50.

103_Alolan Exeggutor.name: Alolan Exeggutor
103_Alolan Exeggutor.description: This Pokémon’s psychic powers aren’t as strong as they once were. The head on this Exeggutor’s tail scans surrounding areas with weak telepathy.

705_Hisuian Sliggoo.name: Hisuian Sliggoo
705_Hisuian Sliggoo.description: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui’s water.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Sliggoo** evolves to **Hisuian Goodra** starting from level 50.

104_Cubone.name: Cubone
104_Cubone.description: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

fields.Evolution: **Cubone** evolves to **Marowak** starting from level 28 in the nighttime.

706_Goodra.name: Goodra
706_Goodra.description: This Pokémon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.

fields.Evolution: **Goodra** evolves from **Sliggoo** starting from level 50, which evolves from **Goomy** starting from level 40.

105_Marowak.name: Marowak
105_Marowak.description: The bones it uses have been in its possession since it was born. It has a ferocious nature.

fields.Evolution: **Marowak** evolves from **Cubone** starting from level 28 in the nighttime.

706_Hisuian Goodra.name: Hisuian Goodra
706_Hisuian Goodra.description: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Goodra** evolves from **Hisuian Sliggoo** starting from level 50.

105_Alolan Marowak.name: Alolan Marowak
105_Alolan Marowak.description: The cursed flames that light up the bone carried by this Pokémon are said to cause both mental and physical pain that will never fade.

707_Klefki.name: Klefki
707_Klefki.description: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

106_Hitmonlee.name: Hitmonlee
106_Hitmonlee.description: Its legs can stretch to double their length. First-time foes are startled by Hitmonlee’s extensible reach.

fields.Evolution: **Hitmonlee** evolves from **Tyrogue** starting from level 20 when its Attack is higher than its Defense.

708_Phantump.name: Phantump
708_Phantump.description: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

fields.Evolution: **Phantump** evolves to **Trevenant** when traded.

107_Hitmonchan.name: Hitmonchan
107_Hitmonchan.description: When Hitmonchan twists its arm while throwing a punch, the blow will pulverize even concrete. The Pokémon rests after three minutes of fighting.

fields.Evolution: **Hitmonchan** evolves from **Tyrogue** starting from level 20 when its Defense is higher than its Attack.

709_Trevenant.name: Trevenant
709_Trevenant.description: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

fields.Evolution: **Trevenant** evolves from **Phantump** when traded.

108_Lickitung.name: Lickitung
108_Lickitung.description: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon’s viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.

fields.Evolution: **Lickitung** evolves to **Lickilicky** when leveled up while knowing Rollout.

710_Pumpkaboo.name: Pumpkaboo
710_Pumpkaboo.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

fields.Evolution: **Pumpkaboo** evolves to **Gourgeist** when traded.

711_Gourgeist.name: Gourgeist
711_Gourgeist.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

fields.Evolution: **Gourgeist** evolves from **Pumpkaboo** when traded.

109_Koffing.name: Koffing
109_Koffing.description: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell; they are also explosive.

fields.Evolution: **Koffing** evolves to **Weezing** starting from level 35.

110_Weezing.name: Weezing
110_Weezing.description: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

fields.Evolution: **Weezing** evolves from **Koffing** starting from level 35.

712_Bergmite.name: Bergmite
712_Bergmite.description: Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of −148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.

fields.Evolution: **Bergmite** evolves to **Avalugg** starting from level 37.

110_Galarian Weezing.name: Galarian Weezing
110_Galarian Weezing.description: Long ago, during a time when droves of factories fouled the air with pollution, Weezing changed into this form for some reason.

713_Avalugg.name: Avalugg
713_Avalugg.description: This Pokémon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When it’s floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.

fields.Evolution: **Avalugg** evolves from **Bergmite** starting from level 37.

111_Rhyhorn.name: Rhyhorn
111_Rhyhorn.description: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.

fields.Evolution: **Rhyhorn** evolves to **Rhydon** starting from level 42, which evolves to **Rhyperior** when traded while holding a Protector.

713_Hisuian Avalugg.name: Hisuian Avalugg
713_Hisuian Avalugg.description: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

112_Rhydon.name: Rhydon
112_Rhydon.description: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava’s heat by its tough, armorlike hide.

fields.Evolution: **Rhydon** evolves from **Rhyhorn** starting from level 42 and evolves to **Rhyperior** when traded while holding a Protector.

714_Noibat.name: Noibat
714_Noibat.description: Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.

fields.Evolution: **Noibat** evolves to **Noivern** starting from level 48.

113_Chansey.name: Chansey
113_Chansey.description: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

fields.Evolution: **Chansey** evolves from **Happiny** when leveled up while holding a Oval Stone in the daytime and evolves to **Blissey** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

715_Noivern.name: Noivern
715_Noivern.description: In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokémon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.

fields.Evolution: **Noivern** evolves from **Noibat** starting from level 48.

114_Tangela.name: Tangela
114_Tangela.description: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they’re useful as a spice.

fields.Evolution: **Tangela** evolves to **Tangrowth** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power.

716_Xerneas.name: Xerneas
716_Xerneas.description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

115_Kangaskhan.name: Kangaskhan
115_Kangaskhan.description: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets its baby out to play only when it feels safe to do so.

fields.Evolution: **Neutral Xerneas** transforms from **Xerneas** when given a Transformation.

115_Mega Kangaskhan.name: Mega Kangaskhan
115_Mega Kangaskhan.description: Its child has grown rapidly, thanks to the energy of Mega Evolution. Mother and child show their harmonious teamwork in battle.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Kangaskhan** transforms from **Kangaskhan** when given a Mega Evolution.

717_Yveltal.name: Yveltal
717_Yveltal.description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

116_Horsea.name: Horsea
116_Horsea.description: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits black ink and flees.

fields.Evolution: **Horsea** evolves to **Seadra** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Kingdra** when traded while holding a Dragon Scale.

718_Zygarde.name: Zygarde
718_Zygarde.description: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

117_Seadra.name: Seadra
117_Seadra.description: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

fields.Evolution: **Seadra** evolves from **Horsea** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Kingdra** when traded while holding a Dragon Scale.

718_10% Zygarde.name: 10% Zygarde
718_10% Zygarde.description: Born when around 10% of Zygarde’s cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.

118_Goldeen.name: Goldeen
118_Goldeen.description: It swims at a steady five knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.

fields.Evolution: **Goldeen** evolves to **Seaking** starting from level 33.

718_Complete Zygarde.name: Complete Zygarde
718_Complete Zygarde.description: Born when all of Zygarde’s cells have been gathered together, it uses force to neutralize those who harm the ecosystem.

ja: パーフェクトフォルム

119_Seaking.name: Seaking
119_Seaking.description: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.

fields.Evolution: **Seaking** evolves from **Goldeen** starting from level 33.

718_Zygarde Cell.name: Zygarde Cell
718_Zygarde Cell.description: The Zygarde Cells form the rest of Zygarde's body and are only able to act on the Core's orders. The Zygarde Cells allows the Zygarde Core to observe the ecosystem, allowing them to see through their eyes.

120_Staryu.name: Staryu
120_Staryu.description: If Staryu’s body is damaged, it will regenerate as long as the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

fields.Evolution: **Staryu** evolves to **Starmie** using a Water Stone.

718_Zygarde Core.name: Zygarde Core
718_Zygarde Core.description: The Zygarde Core remains in watch of the region, usually living in caves. The Cores have their own will and are sometimes able to act on their own. The Zygarde Core can order Zygarde Cells, commanding them to fly towards it to form Zygarde's body in order to protect the ecosystem.

121_Starmie.name: Starmie
121_Starmie.description: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

fields.Evolution: **Starmie** evolves from **Staryu** using a Water Stone.

719_Diancie.name: Diancie
719_Diancie.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

122_Mr. Mime.name: Mr. Mime
122_Mr. Mime.description: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.

fields.Evolution: **Mr. Mime** evolves from **Mime Jr.** when leveled up while knowing Mimic.
**Mega Diancie** transforms from **Diancie** when given a Mega Evolution.

122_Galarian Mr. Mime.name: Galarian Mr. Mime
122_Galarian Mr. Mime.description: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It’ll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Mr. Mime** evolves to **Mr. Rime** starting from level 42.

720_Hoopa.name: Hoopa
720_Hoopa.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

123_Scyther.name: Scyther
123_Scyther.description: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

fields.Evolution: **Scyther** evolves to **Scizor** when traded while holding a Metal Coat and evolves to **Kleavor** using a Black Augurite.
**Hoopa Unbound** transforms from **Hoopa** when given a Prison Bottle.

ja: ときはなたれしフーパ

124_Jynx.name: Jynx
124_Jynx.description: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

fields.Evolution: **Jynx** evolves from **Smoochum** starting from level 30.

721_Volcanion.name: Volcanion
721_Volcanion.description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

722_Rowlet.name: Rowlet
722_Rowlet.description: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

fields.Evolution: **Rowlet** evolves to **Dartrix** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Decidueye** starting from level 34.

125_Electabuzz.name: Electabuzz
125_Electabuzz.description: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

fields.Evolution: **Electabuzz** evolves from **Elekid** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Electivire** when traded while holding a Electirizer.

126_Magmar.name: Magmar
126_Magmar.description: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.

fields.Evolution: **Magmar** evolves from **Magby** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Magmortar** when traded while holding a Magmarizer.

723_Dartrix.name: Dartrix
723_Dartrix.description: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

fields.Evolution: **Dartrix** evolves from **Rowlet** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Decidueye** starting from level 34.

127_Pinsir.name: Pinsir
127_Pinsir.description: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn apart. What it can’t tear, it tosses far away.

724_Decidueye.name: Decidueye
724_Decidueye.description: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point before they notice what’s happening.

fields.Evolution: **Decidueye** evolves from **Dartrix** starting from level 34, which evolves from **Rowlet** starting from level 17.

127_Mega Pinsir.name: Mega Pinsir
127_Mega Pinsir.description: With its vaunted horns, it can lift an opponent 10 times heavier than itself and fly about with ease.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Pinsir** transforms from **Pinsir** when given a Mega Evolution.

724_Hisuian Decidueye.name: Hisuian Decidueye
724_Hisuian Decidueye.description: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

128_Tauros.name: Tauros
128_Tauros.description: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.

725_Litten.name: Litten
725_Litten.description: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.

fields.Evolution: **Litten** evolves to **Torracat** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Incineroar** starting from level 34.

128_Combat Breed Tauros.name: Combat Breed Tauros
128_Combat Breed Tauros.description: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.

726_Torracat.name: Torracat
726_Torracat.description: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.

fields.Evolution: **Torracat** evolves from **Litten** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Incineroar** starting from level 34.

128_Blaze Breed Tauros.name: Blaze Breed Tauros
128_Blaze Breed Tauros.description: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.

727_Incineroar.name: Incineroar
727_Incineroar.description: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

fields.Evolution: **Incineroar** evolves from **Torracat** starting from level 34, which evolves from **Litten** starting from level 17.

128_Aqua Breed Tauros.name: Aqua Breed Tauros
128_Aqua Breed Tauros.description: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.

728_Popplio.name: Popplio
728_Popplio.description: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.

fields.Evolution: **Popplio** evolves to **Brionne** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Primarina** starting from level 34.

129_Magikarp.name: Magikarp
129_Magikarp.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

fields.Evolution: **Magikarp** evolves to **Gyarados** starting from level 20.

729_Brionne.name: Brionne
729_Brionne.description: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.

fields.Evolution: **Brionne** evolves from **Popplio** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Primarina** starting from level 34.

130_Gyarados.name: Gyarados
130_Gyarados.description: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.

fields.Evolution: **Gyarados** evolves from **Magikarp** starting from level 20.

730_Primarina.name: Primarina
730_Primarina.description: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.

fields.Evolution: **Primarina** evolves from **Brionne** starting from level 34, which evolves from **Popplio** starting from level 17.

130_Mega Gyarados.name: Mega Gyarados
130_Mega Gyarados.description: Although it obeys its instinctive drive to destroy everything within its reach, it will respond to orders from a Trainer it truly trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Gyarados** transforms from **Gyarados** when given a Mega Evolution.

731_Pikipek.name: Pikipek
731_Pikipek.description: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

fields.Evolution: **Pikipek** evolves to **Trumbeak** starting from level 14, which evolves to **Toucannon** starting from level 28.

131_Lapras.name: Lapras
131_Lapras.description: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

732_Trumbeak.name: Trumbeak
732_Trumbeak.description: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

fields.Evolution: **Trumbeak** evolves from **Pikipek** starting from level 14 and evolves to **Toucannon** starting from level 28.

131_Gigantamax Lapras.name: Gigantamax Lapras
131_Gigantamax Lapras.description: It surrounds itself with a huge ring of gathered ice particles. It uses the ring to smash any icebergs that might impede its graceful swimming.

733_Toucannon.name: Toucannon
733_Toucannon.description: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

fields.Evolution: **Toucannon** evolves from **Trumbeak** starting from level 28, which evolves from **Pikipek** starting from level 14.

132_Ditto.name: Ditto
132_Ditto.description: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.

734_Yungoos.name: Yungoos
734_Yungoos.description: It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.

fields.Evolution: **Yungoos** evolves to **Gumshoos** starting from level 20 in the daytime.

133_Eevee.name: Eevee
133_Eevee.description: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.

fields.Evolution: **Eevee** evolves to **Vaporeon** using a Water Stone, evolves to **Jolteon** using a Thunder Stone, evolves to **Flareon** using a Fire Stone, evolves to **Espeon** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime, evolves to **Umbreon** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the nighttime, evolves to **Leafeon** using a Leaf Stone, evolves to **Glaceon** using a Ice Stone and evolves to **Sylveon** when leveled up while knowing a Fairy-type move.

735_Gumshoos.name: Gumshoos
735_Gumshoos.description: Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesn’t seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.

fields.Evolution: **Gumshoos** evolves from **Yungoos** starting from level 20 in the daytime.

133_Gigantamax Eevee.name: Gigantamax Eevee
133_Gigantamax Eevee.description: Having gotten even friendlier and more innocent, Eevee tries to play with anyone around, only to end up crushing them with its immense body.

736_Grubbin.name: Grubbin
736_Grubbin.description: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

fields.Evolution: **Grubbin** evolves to **Charjabug** starting from level 20, which evolves to **Vikavolt** when leveled up.

133_Partner Eevee.name: Partner Eevee
133_Partner Eevee.description: It can evolve into a variety of forms. Eevee's genes are the key to solving the mysteries of Pokémon evolution.

737_Charjabug.name: Charjabug
737_Charjabug.description: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

fields.Evolution: **Charjabug** evolves from **Grubbin** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Vikavolt** when leveled up.

134_Vaporeon.name: Vaporeon
134_Vaporeon.description: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can’t be seen when it melts away into water.

fields.Evolution: **Vaporeon** evolves from **Eevee** using a Water Stone.

738_Vikavolt.name: Vikavolt
738_Vikavolt.description: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

fields.Evolution: **Vikavolt** evolves from **Charjabug** when leveled up, which evolves from **Grubbin** starting from level 20.

135_Jolteon.name: Jolteon
135_Jolteon.description: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.

fields.Evolution: **Jolteon** evolves from **Eevee** using a Thunder Stone.

739_Crabrawler.name: Crabrawler
739_Crabrawler.description: If it loses its pincers, they’ll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.

fields.Evolution: **Crabrawler** evolves to **Crabominable** using a Ice Stone.

136_Flareon.name: Flareon
136_Flareon.description: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.

fields.Evolution: **Flareon** evolves from **Eevee** using a Fire Stone.

740_Crabominable.name: Crabominable
740_Crabominable.description: Though its punches are powerful, this Pokémon’s movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.

fields.Evolution: **Crabominable** evolves from **Crabrawler** using a Ice Stone.

137_Porygon.name: Porygon
137_Porygon.description: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.

fields.Evolution: **Porygon** evolves to **Porygon2** when traded while holding a Upgrade, which evolves to **Porygon-Z** when traded while holding a Dubious Disc.

741_Oricorio.name: Oricorio
741_Oricorio.description: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.

138_Omanyte.name: Omanyte
138_Omanyte.description: It’s a Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

fields.Evolution: **Omanyte** evolves to **Omastar** starting from level 40.

741_Pom-pom Oricorio.name: Pom-pom Oricorio
741_Pom-pom Oricorio.description: The energetic, cheerful dance of these Oricorio is popular with children, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.

fields.Evolution: **Pom-pom Oricorio** transforms from **Oricorio** when given a Yellow Nectar.

139_Omastar.name: Omastar
139_Omastar.description: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

fields.Evolution: **Omastar** evolves from **Omanyte** starting from level 40.

741_Pa'u Oricorio.name: Pa'u Oricorio
741_Pa'u Oricorio.description: This Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It gets so caught up in its dancing that it sometimes doesn’t hear its Trainer’s orders.

fields.Evolution: **Pa'u Oricorio** transforms from **Oricorio** when given a Pink Nectar.

741_Sensu Oricorio.name: Sensu Oricorio
741_Sensu Oricorio.description: The elegant, attractive dance of these Oricorio is popular with adults, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.

fields.Evolution: **Sensu Oricorio** transforms from **Oricorio** when given a Purple Nectar.

140_Kabuto.name: Kabuto
140_Kabuto.description: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a sturdy shell.

fields.Evolution: **Kabuto** evolves to **Kabutops** starting from level 40.

742_Cutiefly.name: Cutiefly
742_Cutiefly.description: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

fields.Evolution: **Cutiefly** evolves to **Ribombee** starting from level 25.

141_Kabutops.name: Kabutops
141_Kabutops.description: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

fields.Evolution: **Kabutops** evolves from **Kabuto** starting from level 40.

743_Ribombee.name: Ribombee
743_Ribombee.description: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

fields.Evolution: **Ribombee** evolves from **Cutiefly** starting from level 25.

142_Aerodactyl.name: Aerodactyl
142_Aerodactyl.description: It’s a Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

142_Mega Aerodactyl.name: Mega Aerodactyl
142_Mega Aerodactyl.description: The power of Mega Evolution has completely restored its genes. The rocks on its body are harder than diamond.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Aerodactyl** transforms from **Aerodactyl** when given a Mega Evolution.

744_Rockruff.name: Rockruff
744_Rockruff.description: This Pokémon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.

fields.Evolution: **Rockruff** evolves to **Lycanroc** starting from level 25 in the daytime, evolves to **Midnight Lycanroc** starting from level 25 in the nighttime and evolves to **Dusk Lycanroc** starting from level 25 in the dusktime.

143_Snorlax.name: Snorlax
143_Snorlax.description: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.

fields.Evolution: **Snorlax** evolves from **Munchlax** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

745_Lycanroc.name: Lycanroc
745_Lycanroc.description: It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.

fields.Evolution: **Lycanroc** evolves from **Rockruff** starting from level 25 in the daytime.

143_Gigantamax Snorlax.name: Gigantamax Snorlax
143_Gigantamax Snorlax.description: Terrifyingly strong, this Pokémon is the size of a mountain—and moves about as much as one as well.

745_Midnight Lycanroc.name: Midnight Lycanroc
745_Midnight Lycanroc.description: This Lycanroc has an extremely vicious temperament. It will happily sustain injuries for the sake of taking down its opponent.

fields.Evolution: **Midnight Lycanroc** evolves from **Rockruff** starting from level 25 in the nighttime.

144_Articuno.name: Articuno
144_Articuno.description: This legendary bird Pokémon can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

745_Dusk Lycanroc.name: Dusk Lycanroc
745_Dusk Lycanroc.description: These Pokémon have both calm and ferocious qualities. It’s said that this form of Lycanroc is the most troublesome to raise.

fields.Evolution: **Dusk Lycanroc** evolves from **Rockruff** starting from level 25 in the dusktime.

144_Galarian Articuno.name: Galarian Articuno
144_Galarian Articuno.description: Known as Articuno, this Pokémon fires beams that can immobilize opponents as if they had been frozen solid.

746_Wishiwashi.name: Wishiwashi
746_Wishiwashi.description: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.

fields.Evolution: **Wishiwashi** transforms to **School Wishiwashi** starting from level 20.

145_Zapdos.name: Zapdos
145_Zapdos.description: This legendary Pokémon is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

746_School Wishiwashi.name: School Wishiwashi
746_School Wishiwashi.description: When facing tough opponents, they get into formation. But if they get wounded in battle, they’ll scatter and become solitary again.

fields.Evolution: **School Wishiwashi** transforms from **Wishiwashi** starting from level 20.

145_Galarian Zapdos.name: Galarian Zapdos
145_Galarian Zapdos.description: One kick from its powerful legs will pulverize a dump truck. Supposedly, this Pokémon runs through the mountains at over 180 mph.

747_Mareanie.name: Mareanie
747_Mareanie.description: It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavor—they’re not suitable as food.

fields.Evolution: **Mareanie** evolves to **Toxapex** starting from level 38.

748_Toxapex.name: Toxapex
748_Toxapex.description: Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.

fields.Evolution: **Toxapex** evolves from **Mareanie** starting from level 38.

146_Moltres.name: Moltres
146_Moltres.description: It is one of the legendary bird Pokémon. Its appearance is said to indicate the coming of spring.

749_Mudbray.name: Mudbray
749_Mudbray.description: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesn’t change even when it’s loaded with 50 times its own body weight.

fields.Evolution: **Mudbray** evolves to **Mudsdale** starting from level 30.

146_Galarian Moltres.name: Galarian Moltres
146_Galarian Moltres.description: The sinister aura that blazes like molten fire around this Pokémon is what inspired the name Moltres.

750_Mudsdale.name: Mudsdale
750_Mudsdale.description: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.

fields.Evolution: **Mudsdale** evolves from **Mudbray** starting from level 30.

147_Dratini.name: Dratini
147_Dratini.description: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.

fields.Evolution: **Dratini** evolves to **Dragonair** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Dragonite** starting from level 55.

148_Dragonair.name: Dragonair
148_Dragonair.description: It is called the divine Pokémon. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.

fields.Evolution: **Dragonair** evolves from **Dratini** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Dragonite** starting from level 55.

751_Dewpider.name: Dewpider
751_Dewpider.description: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

fields.Evolution: **Dewpider** evolves to **Araquanid** starting from level 22.

752_Araquanid.name: Araquanid
752_Araquanid.description: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

fields.Evolution: **Araquanid** evolves from **Dewpider** starting from level 22.

149_Dragonite.name: Dragonite
149_Dragonite.description: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.

fields.Evolution: **Dragonite** evolves from **Dragonair** starting from level 55, which evolves from **Dratini** starting from level 30.

753_Fomantis.name: Fomantis
753_Fomantis.description: Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.

fields.Evolution: **Fomantis** evolves to **Lurantis** starting from level 34 in the daytime.

150_Mewtwo.name: Mewtwo
150_Mewtwo.description: Mewtwo was created by recombining Mew’s genes. It’s said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

754_Lurantis.name: Lurantis
754_Lurantis.description: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokémon puts its Trainer’s attentiveness to the test.

fields.Evolution: **Lurantis** evolves from **Fomantis** starting from level 34 in the daytime.

150_Mega Mewtwo X.name: Mega Mewtwo X
150_Mega Mewtwo X.description: Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint a hundred meters in two seconds flat!

fields.Evolution: **Mega Mewtwo X** transforms from **Mewtwo** when given a X Mega Evolution.

755_Morelull.name: Morelull
755_Morelull.description: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

fields.Evolution: **Morelull** evolves to **Shiinotic** starting from level 24.

150_Mega Mewtwo Y.name: Mega Mewtwo Y
150_Mega Mewtwo Y.description: Despite its diminished size, its mental power has grown phenomenally. With a mere thought, it can smash a skyscraper to smithereens.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Mewtwo Y** transforms from **Mewtwo** when given a Y Mega Evolution.

756_Shiinotic.name: Shiinotic
756_Shiinotic.description: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.

fields.Evolution: **Shiinotic** evolves from **Morelull** starting from level 24.

151_Mew.name: Mew
151_Mew.description: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

152_Chikorita.name: Chikorita
152_Chikorita.description: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the air’s temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

fields.Evolution: **Chikorita** evolves to **Bayleef** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Meganium** starting from level 32.

757_Salandit.name: Salandit
757_Salandit.description: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.

fields.Evolution: **Salandit** evolves to **Salazzle** starting from level 33 as Female.

758_Salazzle.name: Salazzle
758_Salazzle.description: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other’s group.

fields.Evolution: **Salazzle** evolves from **Salandit** starting from level 33 as Female.

153_Bayleef.name: Bayleef
153_Bayleef.description: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

fields.Evolution: **Bayleef** evolves from **Chikorita** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Meganium** starting from level 32.

759_Stufful.name: Stufful
759_Stufful.description: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

fields.Evolution: **Stufful** evolves to **Bewear** starting from level 27.

154_Meganium.name: Meganium
154_Meganium.description: Its breath has the fantastic ability to revive dead plants and flowers.

fields.Evolution: **Meganium** evolves from **Bayleef** starting from level 32, which evolves from **Chikorita** starting from level 16.

760_Bewear.name: Bewear
760_Bewear.description: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

fields.Evolution: **Bewear** evolves from **Stufful** starting from level 27.

155_Cyndaquil.name: Cyndaquil
155_Cyndaquil.description: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.

fields.Evolution: **Cyndaquil** evolves to **Quilava** starting from level 14, which evolves to **Typhlosion** starting from level 36.

761_Bounsweet.name: Bounsweet
761_Bounsweet.description: A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokémon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.

fields.Evolution: **Bounsweet** evolves to **Steenee** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Tsareena** when leveled up while knowing Stomp.

156_Quilava.name: Quilava
156_Quilava.description: This creature’s fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.

fields.Evolution: **Quilava** evolves from **Cyndaquil** starting from level 14 and evolves to **Typhlosion** starting from level 36.

762_Steenee.name: Steenee
762_Steenee.description: Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.

fields.Evolution: **Steenee** evolves from **Bounsweet** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Tsareena** when leveled up while knowing Stomp.

157_Typhlosion.name: Typhlosion
157_Typhlosion.description: It attacks using blasts of fire. It creates heat shimmers with intense fire to hide itself.

fields.Evolution: **Typhlosion** evolves from **Quilava** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Cyndaquil** starting from level 14.

763_Tsareena.name: Tsareena
763_Tsareena.description: This Pokémon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.

fields.Evolution: **Tsareena** evolves from **Steenee** when leveled up while knowing Stomp, which evolves from **Bounsweet** starting from level 18.

157_Hisuian Typhlosion.name: Hisuian Typhlosion
157_Hisuian Typhlosion.description: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui’s center.

764_Comfey.name: Comfey
764_Comfey.description: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

158_Totodile.name: Totodile
158_Totodile.description: It has a habit of biting everything with its well-developed jaws. Even its Trainer needs to be careful.

fields.Evolution: **Totodile** evolves to **Croconaw** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Feraligatr** starting from level 30.

765_Oranguru.name: Oranguru
765_Oranguru.description: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.

159_Croconaw.name: Croconaw
159_Croconaw.description: Once it bites down, it won’t let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.

fields.Evolution: **Croconaw** evolves from **Totodile** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Feraligatr** starting from level 30.

766_Passimian.name: Passimian
766_Passimian.description: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.

160_Feraligatr.name: Feraligatr
160_Feraligatr.description: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

fields.Evolution: **Feraligatr** evolves from **Croconaw** starting from level 30, which evolves from **Totodile** starting from level 18.

767_Wimpod.name: Wimpod
767_Wimpod.description: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

fields.Evolution: **Wimpod** evolves to **Golisopod** starting from level 30.

161_Sentret.name: Sentret
161_Sentret.description: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

fields.Evolution: **Sentret** evolves to **Furret** starting from level 15.

768_Golisopod.name: Golisopod
768_Golisopod.description: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

fields.Evolution: **Golisopod** evolves from **Wimpod** starting from level 30.

162_Furret.name: Furret
162_Furret.description: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

fields.Evolution: **Furret** evolves from **Sentret** starting from level 15.

769_Sandygast.name: Sandygast
769_Sandygast.description: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they’re blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.

fields.Evolution: **Sandygast** evolves to **Palossand** starting from level 42.

163_Hoothoot.name: Hoothoot
163_Hoothoot.description: It switches its standing foot so quickly that the switch can’t be seen. It cries at the same time every day.

fields.Evolution: **Hoothoot** evolves to **Noctowl** starting from level 20.

770_Palossand.name: Palossand
770_Palossand.description: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.

fields.Evolution: **Palossand** evolves from **Sandygast** starting from level 42.

164_Noctowl.name: Noctowl
164_Noctowl.description: If it flips its head upside down, it’s a sign that it is engaged in very complex thinking.

fields.Evolution: **Noctowl** evolves from **Hoothoot** starting from level 20.

771_Pyukumuku.name: Pyukumuku
771_Pyukumuku.description: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

772_Type: Null.name: Type: Null
772_Type: Null.description: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

fields.Evolution: **Type: Null** evolves to **Silvally** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

166_Ledian.name: Ledian
166_Ledian.description: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.

fields.Evolution: **Ledian** evolves from **Ledyba** starting from level 18.

165_Ledyba.name: Ledyba
165_Ledyba.description: It’s so timid that it can’t move unless it’s with a swarm. It conveys its feelings through scent.

fields.Evolution: **Ledyba** evolves to **Ledian** starting from level 18.

773_Silvally.name: Silvally
773_Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Silvally** evolves from **Type: Null** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

167_Spinarak.name: Spinarak
167_Spinarak.description: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong thread. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.

fields.Evolution: **Spinarak** evolves to **Ariados** starting from level 22.

773_Bug Silvally.name: Bug Silvally
773_Bug Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Bug Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

168_Ariados.name: Ariados
168_Ariados.description: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.

fields.Evolution: **Ariados** evolves from **Spinarak** starting from level 22.

169_Crobat.name: Crobat
169_Crobat.description: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.

fields.Evolution: **Crobat** evolves from **Golbat** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves from **Zubat** starting from level 22.

773_Dark Silvally.name: Dark Silvally
773_Dark Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Dark Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

773_Dragon Silvally.name: Dragon Silvally
773_Dragon Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Dragon Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

170_Chinchou.name: Chinchou
170_Chinchou.description: It discharges positive and negative electricity from the tips of its antennae to shock its foes.

fields.Evolution: **Chinchou** evolves to **Lanturn** starting from level 27.

773_Electric Silvally.name: Electric Silvally
773_Electric Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Electric Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

171_Lanturn.name: Lanturn
171_Lanturn.description: Lanturn’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed the Deep-Sea Star.

fields.Evolution: **Lanturn** evolves from **Chinchou** starting from level 27.

773_Fighting Silvally.name: Fighting Silvally
773_Fighting Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Fighting Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

172_Pichu.name: Pichu
172_Pichu.description: Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.

fields.Evolution: **Pichu** evolves to **Pikachu** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves to **Raichu** using a Thunder Stone.

773_Fire Silvally.name: Fire Silvally
773_Fire Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Fire Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

773_Flying Silvally.name: Flying Silvally
773_Flying Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Flying Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

173_Cleffa.name: Cleffa
173_Cleffa.description: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

fields.Evolution: **Cleffa** evolves to **Clefairy** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves to **Clefable** using a Moon Stone.

773_Ghost Silvally.name: Ghost Silvally
773_Ghost Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Ghost Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

174_Igglybuff.name: Igglybuff
174_Igglybuff.description: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.

fields.Evolution: **Igglybuff** evolves to **Jigglypuff** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves to **Wigglytuff** using a Moon Stone.

773_Grass Silvally.name: Grass Silvally
773_Grass Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Grass Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

175_Togepi.name: Togepi
175_Togepi.description: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

fields.Evolution: **Togepi** evolves to **Togetic** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves to **Togekiss** using a Shiny Stone.

773_Ground Silvally.name: Ground Silvally
773_Ground Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Ground Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

176_Togetic.name: Togetic
176_Togetic.description: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.

fields.Evolution: **Togetic** evolves from **Togepi** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet and evolves to **Togekiss** using a Shiny Stone.

773_Ice Silvally.name: Ice Silvally
773_Ice Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Ice Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

177_Natu.name: Natu
177_Natu.description: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

fields.Evolution: **Natu** evolves to **Xatu** starting from level 25.

773_Poison Silvally.name: Poison Silvally
773_Poison Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Poison Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

178_Xatu.name: Xatu
178_Xatu.description: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

fields.Evolution: **Xatu** evolves from **Natu** starting from level 25.

773_Psychic Silvally.name: Psychic Silvally
773_Psychic Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Psychic Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

179_Mareep.name: Mareep
179_Mareep.description: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.

fields.Evolution: **Mareep** evolves to **Flaaffy** starting from level 15, which evolves to **Ampharos** starting from level 30.

773_Rock Silvally.name: Rock Silvally
773_Rock Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Rock Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

180_Flaaffy.name: Flaaffy
180_Flaaffy.description: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.

fields.Evolution: **Flaaffy** evolves from **Mareep** starting from level 15 and evolves to **Ampharos** starting from level 30.

773_Steel Silvally.name: Steel Silvally
773_Steel Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Steel Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

181_Ampharos.name: Ampharos
181_Ampharos.description: When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the ocean’s surface.

fields.Evolution: **Ampharos** evolves from **Flaaffy** starting from level 30, which evolves from **Mareep** starting from level 15.

773_Water Silvally.name: Water Silvally
773_Water Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Water Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

181_Mega Ampharos.name: Mega Ampharos
181_Mega Ampharos.description: Massive amounts of energy intensely stimulated Ampharos’s cells, apparently awakening its long-sleeping dragon’s blood.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Ampharos** transforms from **Ampharos** when given a Mega Evolution.

773_Fairy Silvally.name: Fairy Silvally
773_Fairy Silvally.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

fields.Evolution: **Fairy Silvally** transforms from **Silvally** when given a Memory.

182_Bellossom.name: Bellossom
182_Bellossom.description: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

fields.Evolution: **Bellossom** evolves from **Gloom** using a Sun Stone, which evolves from **Oddish** starting from level 21.

774_Minior.name: Minior
774_Minior.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

183_Marill.name: Marill
183_Marill.description: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.

fields.Evolution: **Marill** evolves from **Azurill** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet and evolves to **Azumarill** starting from level 18.

774_Red Meteor Minior.name: Red Meteor Minior
774_Red Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Red Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

184_Azumarill.name: Azumarill
184_Azumarill.description: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.

fields.Evolution: **Azumarill** evolves from **Marill** starting from level 18, which evolves from **Azurill** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

774_Orange Meteor Minior.name: Orange Meteor Minior
774_Orange Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Orange Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

185_Sudowoodo.name: Sudowoodo
185_Sudowoodo.description: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.

fields.Evolution: **Sudowoodo** evolves from **Bonsly** when leveled up while knowing Mimic.

774_Yellow Meteor Minior.name: Yellow Meteor Minior
774_Yellow Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Yellow Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

186_Politoed.name: Politoed
186_Politoed.description: A group of Poliwag and Poliwhirl will form with a Politoed as the leader. Politoed’s cries make the Pokémon of the group obey.

fields.Evolution: **Politoed** evolves from **Poliwhirl** when traded while holding a King's Rock, which evolves from **Poliwag** starting from level 25.

774_Green Meteor Minior.name: Green Meteor Minior
774_Green Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Green Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

187_Hoppip.name: Hoppip
187_Hoppip.description: Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found practically everywhere. This is because the wind carries this species all over the world.

fields.Evolution: **Hoppip** evolves to **Skiploom** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Jumpluff** starting from level 27.

774_Blue Meteor Minior.name: Blue Meteor Minior
774_Blue Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Blue Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

188_Skiploom.name: Skiploom
188_Skiploom.description: When the weather grows cold, Skiploom’s flower closes and the Pokémon cannot photosynthesize, so it flies away to warmer regions.

fields.Evolution: **Skiploom** evolves from **Hoppip** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Jumpluff** starting from level 27.

774_Indigo Meteor Minior.name: Indigo Meteor Minior
774_Indigo Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Indigo Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

189_Jumpluff.name: Jumpluff
189_Jumpluff.description: Beware its cotton spores. If you accidentally breathe them in, you’ll be racked with coughs and itchiness.

fields.Evolution: **Jumpluff** evolves from **Skiploom** starting from level 27, which evolves from **Hoppip** starting from level 18.

774_Violet Meteor Minior.name: Violet Meteor Minior
774_Violet Meteor Minior.description: It will react when touched or called to, but it’s unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.

fields.Evolution: **Violet Meteor Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

190_Aipom.name: Aipom
190_Aipom.description: This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand. Ancient writings describe this Pokémon as a one-armed oddity.

fields.Evolution: **Aipom** evolves to **Ambipom** when leveled up while knowing Double Hit.

191_Sunkern.name: Sunkern
191_Sunkern.description: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.

fields.Evolution: **Sunkern** evolves to **Sunflora** using a Sun Stone.

774_Red Core Minior.name: Red Core Minior
774_Red Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Red Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

774_Orange Core Minior.name: Orange Core Minior
774_Orange Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Orange Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

192_Sunflora.name: Sunflora
192_Sunflora.description: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.

fields.Evolution: **Sunflora** evolves from **Sunkern** using a Sun Stone.

774_Yellow Core Minior.name: Yellow Core Minior
774_Yellow Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Yellow Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

193_Yanma.name: Yanma
193_Yanma.description: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

fields.Evolution: **Yanma** evolves to **Yanmega** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power.

774_Green Core Minior.name: Green Core Minior
774_Green Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Green Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

194_Wooper.name: Wooper
194_Wooper.description: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

fields.Evolution: **Wooper** evolves to **Quagsire** starting from level 20.

774_Blue Core Minior.name: Blue Core Minior
774_Blue Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Blue Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

194_Paldean Wooper.name: Paldean Wooper
194_Paldean Wooper.description: It’s dangerous for Wooper to travel alone. They line up in groups of three or four and help each other as they walk around the wetlands.

fields.Evolution: **Paldean Wooper** evolves to **Clodsire** starting from level 20.

774_Indigo Core Minior.name: Indigo Core Minior
774_Indigo Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Indigo Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

195_Quagsire.name: Quagsire
195_Quagsire.description: A dim-witted Pokémon. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head into boats or rocks while swimming.

fields.Evolution: **Quagsire** evolves from **Wooper** starting from level 20.

774_Violet Core Minior.name: Violet Core Minior
774_Violet Core Minior.description: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.

fields.Evolution: **Violet Core Minior** transforms from **Minior** when given a Chisel.

196_Espeon.name: Espeon
196_Espeon.description: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.

fields.Evolution: **Espeon** evolves from **Eevee** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime.

775_Komala.name: Komala
775_Komala.description: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komala’s drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.

197_Umbreon.name: Umbreon
197_Umbreon.description: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.

fields.Evolution: **Umbreon** evolves from **Eevee** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the nighttime.

776_Turtonator.name: Turtonator
776_Turtonator.description: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

198_Murkrow.name: Murkrow
198_Murkrow.description: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.

fields.Evolution: **Murkrow** evolves to **Honchkrow** using a Dusk Stone.

777_Togedemaru.name: Togedemaru
777_Togedemaru.description: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

199_Slowking.name: Slowking
199_Slowking.description: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

fields.Evolution: **Slowking** evolves from **Slowpoke** when traded while holding a King's Rock.

778_Mimikyu.name: Mimikyu
778_Mimikyu.description: Mimikyu was only recently identified as a Pokémon. Previously, people thought it was just a ghost wearing a cloth.

199_Galarian Slowking.name: Galarian Slowking
199_Galarian Slowking.description: While chanting strange spells, this Pokémon combines its internal toxins with what it’s eaten, creating strange potions.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Slowking** evolves from **Galarian Slowpoke** using a Galarica Wreath.

779_Bruxish.name: Bruxish
779_Bruxish.description: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.

200_Misdreavus.name: Misdreavus
200_Misdreavus.description: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

fields.Evolution: **Misdreavus** evolves to **Mismagius** using a Dusk Stone.

780_Drampa.name: Drampa
780_Drampa.description: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

201_Unown.name: Unown
201_Unown.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

781_Dhelmise.name: Dhelmise
781_Dhelmise.description: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

201_Unown A.name: Unown A
201_Unown A.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

782_Jangmo-o.name: Jangmo-o
782_Jangmo-o.description: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

fields.Evolution: **Jangmo-o** evolves to **Hakamo-o** starting from level 35, which evolves to **Kommo-o** starting from level 45.

201_Unown B.name: Unown B
201_Unown B.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

783_Hakamo-o.name: Hakamo-o
783_Hakamo-o.description: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

fields.Evolution: **Hakamo-o** evolves from **Jangmo-o** starting from level 35 and evolves to **Kommo-o** starting from level 45.

201_Unown C.name: Unown C
201_Unown C.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

784_Kommo-o.name: Kommo-o
784_Kommo-o.description: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

fields.Evolution: **Kommo-o** evolves from **Hakamo-o** starting from level 45, which evolves from **Jangmo-o** starting from level 35.

201_Unown D.name: Unown D
201_Unown D.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

785_Tapu Koko.name: Tapu Koko
785_Tapu Koko.description: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

201_Unown E.name: Unown E
201_Unown E.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

786_Tapu Lele.name: Tapu Lele
786_Tapu Lele.description: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

201_Unown G.name: Unown G
201_Unown G.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

787_Tapu Bulu.name: Tapu Bulu
787_Tapu Bulu.description: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

201_Unown H.name: Unown H
201_Unown H.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

788_Tapu Fini.name: Tapu Fini
788_Tapu Fini.description: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

201_Unown I.name: Unown I
201_Unown I.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

789_Cosmog.name: Cosmog
789_Cosmog.description: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.

fields.Evolution: **Cosmog** evolves to **Cosmoem** starting from level 43, which evolves to **Solgaleo** starting from level 53 in the daytime and evolves to **Lunala** starting from level 53 in the nighttime.

201_Unown J.name: Unown J
201_Unown J.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

790_Cosmoem.name: Cosmoem
790_Cosmoem.description: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.

fields.Evolution: **Cosmoem** evolves from **Cosmog** starting from level 43 and evolves to **Solgaleo** starting from level 53 in the daytime and evolves to **Lunala** starting from level 53 in the nighttime.

201_Unown K.name: Unown K
201_Unown K.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

791_Solgaleo.name: Solgaleo
791_Solgaleo.description: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.

fields.Evolution: **Solgaleo** evolves from **Cosmoem** starting from level 53 in the daytime, which evolves from **Cosmog** starting from level 43.

201_Unown L.name: Unown L
201_Unown L.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

792_Lunala.name: Lunala
792_Lunala.description: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.

fields.Evolution: **Lunala** evolves from **Cosmoem** starting from level 53 in the nighttime, which evolves from **Cosmog** starting from level 43.

201_Unown M.name: Unown M
201_Unown M.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

793_Nihilego.name: Nihilego
793_Nihilego.description: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

201_Unown N.name: Unown N
201_Unown N.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

794_Buzzwole.name: Buzzwole
794_Buzzwole.description: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

201_Unown O.name: Unown O
201_Unown O.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

795_Pheromosa.name: Pheromosa
795_Pheromosa.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

201_Unown P.name: Unown P
201_Unown P.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

796_Xurkitree.name: Xurkitree
796_Xurkitree.description: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

201_Unown Q.name: Unown Q
201_Unown Q.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

797_Celesteela.name: Celesteela
797_Celesteela.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

201_Unown R.name: Unown R
201_Unown R.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

798_Kartana.name: Kartana
798_Kartana.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

201_Unown S.name: Unown S
201_Unown S.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

799_Guzzlord.name: Guzzlord
799_Guzzlord.description: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

201_Unown T.name: Unown T
201_Unown T.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

800_Necrozma.name: Necrozma
800_Necrozma.description: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.

201_Unown U.name: Unown U
201_Unown U.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

800_Dusk Mane Necrozma.name: Dusk Mane Necrozma
800_Dusk Mane Necrozma.description: Necrozma has attached itself to Solgaleo. It siphons away its host’s limitless energy, exploiting that energy to fuel a rampage.

fields.Evolution: **Dusk Mane Necrozma** transforms from **Necrozma** when given a N-Solarizer.

201_Unown V.name: Unown V
201_Unown V.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

800_Dawn Wings Necrozma.name: Dawn Wings Necrozma
800_Dawn Wings Necrozma.description: When Necrozma latches on to Lunala, it becomes vicious, seeing enemies everywhere it looks. It will burn the world with lasers.

fields.Evolution: **Dawn Wings Necrozma** transforms from **Necrozma** when given a N-Lunarizer.

201_Unown W.name: Unown W
201_Unown W.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

800_Ultra Necrozma.name: Ultra Necrozma
