800_Ultra Necrozma.description: The light pouring out from all over its body affects living things and nature, impacting them in various ways.

fields.Evolution: **Ultra Necrozma** transforms from **Necrozma** when given a Ultranecrozium Z.

201_Unown X.name: Unown X
201_Unown X.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

801_Magearna.name: Magearna
801_Magearna.description: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

201_Unown Y.name: Unown Y
201_Unown Y.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

801_Original Magearna.name: Original Magearna
801_Original Magearna.description: It functions thanks to its artificial soul. The vivid decoration is proof that it was presented as a gift to royalty.

201_Unown Z.name: Unown Z
201_Unown Z.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

802_Marshadow.name: Marshadow
802_Marshadow.description: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.

201_Unown Exclamation.name: Unown Exclamation
201_Unown Exclamation.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

802_Zenith Marshadow.name: Zenith Marshadow
802_Zenith Marshadow.description: When angered or attacking, Marshadow's fighting spirit will begin to burn, causing it to become Zenith Marshadow. In this state, its headgear, wrist bumps, and collar flare up and resemble green and yellow flames. Marshadow's eyes also flare up when in this state, but do not change in color.

fields.Evolution: **Zenith Marshadow** transforms from **Marshadow** when given a Transformation.

803_Poipole.name: Poipole
803_Poipole.description: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

fields.Evolution: **Poipole** evolves to **Naganadel** when leveled up while knowing Dragon Pulse.

201_Unown Question.name: Unown Question
201_Unown Question.description: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

202_Wobbuffet.name: Wobbuffet
202_Wobbuffet.description: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. This behavior is said to be proof that its tail hides a secret.

fields.Evolution: **Wobbuffet** evolves from **Wynaut** starting from level 15.

804_Naganadel.name: Naganadel
804_Naganadel.description: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

fields.Evolution: **Naganadel** evolves from **Poipole** when leveled up while knowing Dragon Pulse.

203_Girafarig.name: Girafarig
203_Girafarig.description: Girafarig’s tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon from behind.

fields.Evolution: **Girafarig** evolves to **Farigiraf** starting from level 32.

805_Stakataka.name: Stakataka
805_Stakataka.description: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

204_Pineco.name: Pineco
204_Pineco.description: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.

fields.Evolution: **Pineco** evolves to **Forretress** starting from level 31.

806_Blacephalon.name: Blacephalon
806_Blacephalon.description: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

205_Forretress.name: Forretress
205_Forretress.description: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.

fields.Evolution: **Forretress** evolves from **Pineco** starting from level 31.

807_Zeraora.name: Zeraora
807_Zeraora.description: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.

206_Dunsparce.name: Dunsparce
206_Dunsparce.description: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.

fields.Evolution: **Dunsparce** evolves to **Dudunsparce** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Three-Segment Dudunsparce** starting from level 32.

808_Meltan.name: Meltan
808_Meltan.description: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

fields.Evolution: **Meltan** evolves to **Melmetal** using a Meltan Candy.

207_Gligar.name: Gligar
207_Gligar.description: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.

fields.Evolution: **Gligar** evolves to **Gliscor** when leveled up while holding a Razor Fang in the nighttime.

809_Melmetal.name: Melmetal
809_Melmetal.description: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Melmetal** evolves from **Meltan** using a Meltan Candy.

208_Steelix.name: Steelix
208_Steelix.description: This Pokémon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.

fields.Evolution: **Steelix** evolves from **Onix** when traded while holding a Metal Coat.

809_Gigantamax Melmetal.name: Gigantamax Melmetal
809_Gigantamax Melmetal.description: It can send electric beams streaking out from the hole in its belly. The beams’ tremendous energy can vaporize an opponent in one shot.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Steelix** transforms from **Steelix** when given a Mega Evolution.

810_Grookey.name: Grookey
810_Grookey.description: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

fields.Evolution: **Grookey** evolves to **Thwackey** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Rillaboom** starting from level 35.

209_Snubbull.name: Snubbull
209_Snubbull.description: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by many people to be cute.

fields.Evolution: **Snubbull** evolves to **Granbull** starting from level 23.

811_Thwackey.name: Thwackey
811_Thwackey.description: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

fields.Evolution: **Thwackey** evolves from **Grookey** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Rillaboom** starting from level 35.

210_Granbull.name: Granbull
210_Granbull.description: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

fields.Evolution: **Granbull** evolves from **Snubbull** starting from level 23.

812_Rillaboom.name: Rillaboom
812_Rillaboom.description: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

fields.Evolution: **Rillaboom** evolves from **Thwackey** starting from level 35, which evolves from **Grookey** starting from level 16.

211_Qwilfish.name: Qwilfish
211_Qwilfish.description: Experienced fishers say they try to catch Qwilfish in the brief moment that these Pokémon become defenseless just after launching poisonous spikes.

812_Gigantamax Rillaboom.name: Gigantamax Rillaboom
812_Gigantamax Rillaboom.description: Rillaboom has become one with its forest of drums and continues to lay down beats that shake all of Galar.

211_Hisuian Qwilfish.name: Hisuian Qwilfish
211_Hisuian Qwilfish.description: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Qwilfish** evolves to **Overqwil** when leveled up.

813_Scorbunny.name: Scorbunny
813_Scorbunny.description: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

fields.Evolution: **Scorbunny** evolves to **Raboot** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Cinderace** starting from level 35.

212_Scizor.name: Scizor
212_Scizor.description: It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.

fields.Evolution: **Scizor** evolves from **Scyther** when traded while holding a Metal Coat.

814_Raboot.name: Raboot
814_Raboot.description: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

fields.Evolution: **Raboot** evolves from **Scorbunny** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Cinderace** starting from level 35.

212_Mega Scizor.name: Mega Scizor
212_Mega Scizor.description: It’s better at beating things than grasping them. When it battles for a long time, the weight of its pincers becomes too much to bear.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Scizor** transforms from **Scizor** when given a Mega Evolution.

815_Cinderace.name: Cinderace
815_Cinderace.description: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

fields.Evolution: **Cinderace** evolves from **Raboot** starting from level 35, which evolves from **Scorbunny** starting from level 16.

815_Gigantamax Cinderace.name: Gigantamax Cinderace
815_Gigantamax Cinderace.description: Gigantamax energy can sometimes cause the diameter of this Pokémon’s fireball to exceed 300 feet.

213_Shuckle.name: Shuckle
213_Shuckle.description: It stores berries in its shell. The berries mix with its body fluids to become delicious juices.

214_Heracross.name: Heracross
214_Heracross.description: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.

816_Sobble.name: Sobble
816_Sobble.description: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

fields.Evolution: **Sobble** evolves to **Drizzile** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Inteleon** starting from level 35.

214_Mega Heracross.name: Mega Heracross
214_Mega Heracross.description: A tremendous influx of energy builds it up, but when Mega Evolution ends, Heracross is bothered by terrible soreness in its muscles.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Heracross** transforms from **Heracross** when given a Mega Evolution.

817_Drizzile.name: Drizzile
817_Drizzile.description: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

fields.Evolution: **Drizzile** evolves from **Sobble** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Inteleon** starting from level 35.

215_Sneasel.name: Sneasel
215_Sneasel.description: This is a smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.

fields.Evolution: **Sneasel** evolves to **Weavile** when leveled up while holding a Razor Claw in the nighttime.

818_Inteleon.name: Inteleon
818_Inteleon.description: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

fields.Evolution: **Inteleon** evolves from **Drizzile** starting from level 35, which evolves from **Sobble** starting from level 16.

215_Hisuian Sneasel.name: Hisuian Sneasel
215_Hisuian Sneasel.description: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel’s grasp.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Sneasel** evolves to **Sneasler** when leveled up while holding a Razor Claw in the daytime.

818_Gigantamax Inteleon.name: Gigantamax Inteleon
818_Gigantamax Inteleon.description: It has excellent sniping skills. Shooting a berry rolling along over nine miles away is a piece of cake for this Pokémon.

216_Teddiursa.name: Teddiursa
216_Teddiursa.description: Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon have a smile back on its face.

fields.Evolution: **Teddiursa** evolves to **Ursaring** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Ursaluna** using a Peat Block.

819_Skwovet.name: Skwovet
819_Skwovet.description: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.

fields.Evolution: **Skwovet** evolves to **Greedent** starting from level 24.

217_Ursaring.name: Ursaring
217_Ursaring.description: It is quite skilled at climbing trees. If it comes across a Primeape while searching for berries in the treetops, trouble will surely ensue.

fields.Evolution: **Ursaring** evolves from **Teddiursa** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Ursaluna** using a Peat Block.

820_Greedent.name: Greedent
820_Greedent.description: This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.

fields.Evolution: **Greedent** evolves from **Skwovet** starting from level 24.

218_Slugma.name: Slugma
218_Slugma.description: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

fields.Evolution: **Slugma** evolves to **Magcargo** starting from level 38.

821_Rookidee.name: Rookidee
821_Rookidee.description: The females are fussier than the males. If another creature dirties a female Rookidee’s wings, it’ll peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.

fields.Evolution: **Rookidee** evolves to **Corvisquire** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Corviknight** starting from level 38.

219_Magcargo.name: Magcargo
219_Magcargo.description: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Flames burst from gaps in its shell made of hardened magma.

fields.Evolution: **Magcargo** evolves from **Slugma** starting from level 38.

822_Corvisquire.name: Corvisquire
822_Corvisquire.description: This intelligent Pokémon will quickly learn how to use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.

fields.Evolution: **Corvisquire** evolves from **Rookidee** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Corviknight** starting from level 38.

220_Swinub.name: Swinub
220_Swinub.description: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.

fields.Evolution: **Swinub** evolves to **Piloswine** starting from level 33, which evolves to **Mamoswine** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power.

823_Corviknight.name: Corviknight
823_Corviknight.description: Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokémon flies through the skies with ease.

fields.Evolution: **Corviknight** evolves from **Corvisquire** starting from level 38, which evolves from **Rookidee** starting from level 18.

221_Piloswine.name: Piloswine
221_Piloswine.description: The long fur of this Pokémon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokémon’s white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.

fields.Evolution: **Piloswine** evolves from **Swinub** starting from level 33 and evolves to **Mamoswine** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power.

823_Gigantamax Corviknight.name: Gigantamax Corviknight
823_Gigantamax Corviknight.description: The eight feathers on its back are called blade birds, and they can launch off its body to attack foes independently.

222_Corsola.name: Corsola
222_Corsola.description: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.

824_Blipbug.name: Blipbug
824_Blipbug.description: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

fields.Evolution: **Blipbug** evolves to **Dottler** starting from level 10, which evolves to **Orbeetle** starting from level 30.

825_Dottler.name: Dottler
825_Dottler.description: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

fields.Evolution: **Dottler** evolves from **Blipbug** starting from level 10 and evolves to **Orbeetle** starting from level 30.

222_Galarian Corsola.name: Galarian Corsola
222_Galarian Corsola.description: Sudden climate change wiped out this ancient kind of Corsola. This Pokémon absorbs others’ life-force through its branches.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Corsola** evolves to **Cursola** starting from level 38.

223_Remoraid.name: Remoraid
223_Remoraid.description: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.

fields.Evolution: **Remoraid** evolves to **Octillery** starting from level 25.

826_Orbeetle.name: Orbeetle
826_Orbeetle.description: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

fields.Evolution: **Orbeetle** evolves from **Dottler** starting from level 30, which evolves from **Blipbug** starting from level 10.

224_Octillery.name: Octillery
224_Octillery.description: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.

fields.Evolution: **Octillery** evolves from **Remoraid** starting from level 25.

826_Gigantamax Orbeetle.name: Gigantamax Orbeetle
826_Gigantamax Orbeetle.description: If it were to utilize every last bit of its power, it could control the minds of every living being in its vicinity.

827_Nickit.name: Nickit
827_Nickit.description: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

fields.Evolution: **Nickit** evolves to **Thievul** starting from level 18.

225_Delibird.name: Delibird
225_Delibird.description: It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.

226_Mantine.name: Mantine
226_Mantine.description: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

fields.Evolution: **Mantine** evolves from **Mantyke** when leveled up.

828_Thievul.name: Thievul
828_Thievul.description: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

fields.Evolution: **Thievul** evolves from **Nickit** starting from level 18.

829_Gossifleur.name: Gossifleur
829_Gossifleur.description: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Gossifleur** evolves to **Eldegoss** starting from level 20.

227_Skarmory.name: Skarmory
227_Skarmory.description: Skarmory is clad entirely in ironhard armor. It flies at speeds over 180 mph.

830_Eldegoss.name: Eldegoss
830_Eldegoss.description: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

fields.Evolution: **Eldegoss** evolves from **Gossifleur** starting from level 20.

228_Houndour.name: Houndour
228_Houndour.description: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

fields.Evolution: **Houndour** evolves to **Houndoom** starting from level 24.

831_Wooloo.name: Wooloo
831_Wooloo.description: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

fields.Evolution: **Wooloo** evolves to **Dubwool** starting from level 24.

229_Houndoom.name: Houndoom
229_Houndoom.description: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.

fields.Evolution: **Houndoom** evolves from **Houndour** starting from level 24.

832_Dubwool.name: Dubwool
832_Dubwool.description: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

fields.Evolution: **Dubwool** evolves from **Wooloo** starting from level 24.

229_Mega Houndoom.name: Mega Houndoom
229_Mega Houndoom.description: Houndoom’s entire body generates heat when it Mega Evolves. Its fearsome fiery breath turns its opponents to ash.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Houndoom** transforms from **Houndoom** when given a Mega Evolution.

833_Chewtle.name: Chewtle
833_Chewtle.description: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.

fields.Evolution: **Chewtle** evolves to **Drednaw** starting from level 22.

230_Kingdra.name: Kingdra
230_Kingdra.description: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

fields.Evolution: **Kingdra** evolves from **Seadra** when traded while holding a Dragon Scale, which evolves from **Horsea** starting from level 32.

834_Drednaw.name: Drednaw
834_Drednaw.description: Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.

fields.Evolution: **Drednaw** evolves from **Chewtle** starting from level 22.

231_Phanpy.name: Phanpy
231_Phanpy.description: It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.

fields.Evolution: **Phanpy** evolves to **Donphan** starting from level 25.

834_Gigantamax Drednaw.name: Gigantamax Drednaw
834_Gigantamax Drednaw.description: In the Galar region, there’s a tale about this Pokémon chewing up a mountain and using the rubble to stop a flood.

232_Donphan.name: Donphan
232_Donphan.description: Donphan is normally a calm Pokémon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.

fields.Evolution: **Donphan** evolves from **Phanpy** starting from level 25.

835_Yamper.name: Yamper
835_Yamper.description: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

fields.Evolution: **Yamper** evolves to **Boltund** starting from level 25.

233_Porygon2.name: Porygon2
233_Porygon2.description: A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.

fields.Evolution: **Porygon2** evolves from **Porygon** when traded while holding a Upgrade and evolves to **Porygon-Z** when traded while holding a Dubious Disc.

836_Boltund.name: Boltund
836_Boltund.description: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

fields.Evolution: **Boltund** evolves from **Yamper** starting from level 25.

234_Stantler.name: Stantler
234_Stantler.description: It’s said that this Pokémon used to be stronger long ago when it had many enemies, and that it was even able to evolve under its own power.

fields.Evolution: **Stantler** evolves to **Wyrdeer** when leveled up.

837_Rolycoly.name: Rolycoly
837_Rolycoly.description: Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon’s body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.

fields.Evolution: **Rolycoly** evolves to **Carkol** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Coalossal** starting from level 34.

235_Smeargle.name: Smeargle
235_Smeargle.description: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.

838_Carkol.name: Carkol
838_Carkol.description: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkol’s back never falls apart, even when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.

fields.Evolution: **Carkol** evolves from **Rolycoly** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Coalossal** starting from level 34.

236_Tyrogue.name: Tyrogue
236_Tyrogue.description: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.

fields.Evolution: **Tyrogue** evolves to **Hitmonlee** starting from level 20 when its Attack is higher than its Defense, evolves to **Hitmonchan** starting from level 20 when its Defense is higher than its Attack and evolves to **Hitmontop** starting from level 20 when its Attack is equal to its Defense.

839_Coalossal.name: Coalossal
839_Coalossal.description: It’s gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.

fields.Evolution: **Coalossal** evolves from **Carkol** starting from level 34, which evolves from **Rolycoly** starting from level 18.

237_Hitmontop.name: Hitmontop
237_Hitmontop.description: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by a factor of 10.

fields.Evolution: **Hitmontop** evolves from **Tyrogue** starting from level 20 when its Attack is equal to its Defense.

839_Gigantamax Coalossal.name: Gigantamax Coalossal
839_Gigantamax Coalossal.description: When Galar was hit by a harsh cold wave, this Pokémon served as a giant heating stove and saved many lives.

238_Smoochum.name: Smoochum
238_Smoochum.description: It tests everything by touching with its lips, which remember what it likes and dislikes.

fields.Evolution: **Smoochum** evolves to **Jynx** starting from level 30.

840_Applin.name: Applin
840_Applin.description: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.

fields.Evolution: **Applin** evolves to **Flapple** using a Tart Apple, evolves to **Appletun** using a Sweet Apple and evolves to **Dipplin** using a Syrupy Apple, which evolves to **Hydrapple** when leveled up.

239_Elekid.name: Elekid
239_Elekid.description: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.

fields.Evolution: **Elekid** evolves to **Electabuzz** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Electivire** when traded while holding a Electirizer.

841_Flapple.name: Flapple
841_Flapple.description: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.

fields.Evolution: **Flapple** evolves from **Applin** using a Tart Apple.

240_Magby.name: Magby
240_Magby.description: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.

fields.Evolution: **Magby** evolves to **Magmar** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Magmortar** when traded while holding a Magmarizer.

841_Gigantamax Flapple.name: Gigantamax Flapple
841_Gigantamax Flapple.description: If it stretches its neck, the strong aroma of its nectar pours out. The scent is so sickeningly sweet that one whiff makes other Pokémon faint.

241_Miltank.name: Miltank
241_Miltank.description: It is said that kids who drink Miltank’s milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

842_Appletun.name: Appletun
842_Appletun.description: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun’s back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.

fields.Evolution: **Appletun** evolves from **Applin** using a Sweet Apple.

242_Blissey.name: Blissey
242_Blissey.description: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

fields.Evolution: **Blissey** evolves from **Chansey** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves from **Happiny** when leveled up while holding a Oval Stone in the daytime.

842_Gigantamax Appletun.name: Gigantamax Appletun
842_Gigantamax Appletun.description: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s nectar has thickened. The increased viscosity lets the nectar absorb more damage than before.

243_Raikou.name: Raikou
243_Raikou.description: It is said to have fallen with lightning. It can fire thunderbolts from the rain clouds on its back.

843_Silicobra.name: Silicobra
843_Silicobra.description: Silicobra’s large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokémon is not very good at telling apart different smells.

fields.Evolution: **Silicobra** evolves to **Sandaconda** starting from level 36.

244_Entei.name: Entei
244_Entei.description: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

844_Sandaconda.name: Sandaconda
844_Sandaconda.description: The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandaconda’s saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.

fields.Evolution: **Sandaconda** evolves from **Silicobra** starting from level 36.

245_Suicune.name: Suicune
245_Suicune.description: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

844_Gigantamax Sandaconda.name: Gigantamax Sandaconda
844_Gigantamax Sandaconda.description: Sand swirls around its body with such speed and power that it could pulverize a skyscraper.

246_Larvitar.name: Larvitar
246_Larvitar.description: It is born deep underground. It can’t emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.

fields.Evolution: **Larvitar** evolves to **Pupitar** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Tyranitar** starting from level 55.

845_Cramorant.name: Cramorant
845_Cramorant.description: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

247_Pupitar.name: Pupitar
247_Pupitar.description: Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

fields.Evolution: **Pupitar** evolves from **Larvitar** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Tyranitar** starting from level 55.

845_Gulping Cramorant.name: Gulping Cramorant
845_Gulping Cramorant.description: The slightest shock is sometimes enough to get this Pokémon to spit out the Arrokuda lodged in its throat.

248_Tyranitar.name: Tyranitar
248_Tyranitar.description: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.

fields.Evolution: **Tyranitar** evolves from **Pupitar** starting from level 55, which evolves from **Larvitar** starting from level 30.

845_Gorging Cramorant.name: Gorging Cramorant
845_Gorging Cramorant.description: The half-swallowed Pikachu is so startled that it isn’t struggling yet, but it’s still looking for a chance to strike back.

248_Mega Tyranitar.name: Mega Tyranitar
248_Mega Tyranitar.description: The effects of Mega Evolution make it more ferocious than ever. It’s unclear whether it can even hear its Trainer’s orders.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Tyranitar** transforms from **Tyranitar** when given a Mega Evolution.

846_Arrokuda.name: Arrokuda
846_Arrokuda.description: It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokuda’s eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.

fields.Evolution: **Arrokuda** evolves to **Barraskewda** starting from level 26.

249_Lugia.name: Lugia
249_Lugia.description: It sleeps in a deep-sea trench. If it flaps its wings, it is said to cause a 40-day storm.

847_Barraskewda.name: Barraskewda
847_Barraskewda.description: It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.

fields.Evolution: **Barraskewda** evolves from **Arrokuda** starting from level 26.

250_Ho-Oh.name: Ho-Oh
250_Ho-Oh.description: Its feathers are in seven colors. It is said that anyone seeing it is promised eternal happiness.

848_Toxel.name: Toxel
848_Toxel.description: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.

fields.Evolution: **Toxel** evolves to **Amped Toxtricity** starting from level 30 with a Nature of Hardy, Brave, Adamant, Naughty, Docile, Impish, Lax, Hasty, Jolly, Naive, Rash, Sassy or Quirky and evolves to **Low Key Toxtricity** starting from level 30 with a Nature of Lonely, Bold, Relaxed, Timid, Serious, Modest, Mild, Quiet, Bashful, Calm, Gentle or Careful.

251_Celebi.name: Celebi
251_Celebi.description: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

849_Amped Toxtricity.name: Amped Toxtricity
849_Amped Toxtricity.description: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.

fields.Evolution: **Amped Toxtricity** evolves from **Toxel** starting from level 30 with a Nature of Hardy, Brave, Adamant, Naughty, Docile, Impish, Lax, Hasty, Jolly, Naive, Rash, Sassy or Quirky.

252_Treecko.name: Treecko
252_Treecko.description: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny hooks, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

fields.Evolution: **Treecko** evolves to **Grovyle** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Sceptile** starting from level 36.

849_Low Key Toxtricity.name: Low Key Toxtricity
849_Low Key Toxtricity.description: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.

fields.Evolution: **Low Key Toxtricity** evolves from **Toxel** starting from level 30 with a Nature of Lonely, Bold, Relaxed, Timid, Serious, Modest, Mild, Quiet, Bashful, Calm, Gentle or Careful.

253_Grovyle.name: Grovyle
253_Grovyle.description: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

fields.Evolution: **Grovyle** evolves from **Treecko** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Sceptile** starting from level 36.

849_Gigantamax Amped Toxtricity.name: Gigantamax Amped Toxtricity
849_Gigantamax Amped Toxtricity.description: Out of control after its own poison penetrated its brain, it tears across the land in a rampage, contaminating the earth with toxic sweat.

254_Sceptile.name: Sceptile
254_Sceptile.description: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.

fields.Evolution: **Sceptile** evolves from **Grovyle** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Treecko** starting from level 16.

849_Gigantamax Low Key Toxtricity.name: Gigantamax Low Key Toxtricity
849_Gigantamax Low Key Toxtricity.description: Out of control after its own poison penetrated its brain, it tears across the land in a rampage, contaminating the earth with toxic sweat.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Sceptile** transforms from **Sceptile** when given a Mega Evolution.

850_Sizzlipede.name: Sizzlipede
850_Sizzlipede.description: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

fields.Evolution: **Sizzlipede** evolves to **Centiskorch** starting from level 28.

255_Torchic.name: Torchic
255_Torchic.description: A fire burns inside it, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

fields.Evolution: **Torchic** evolves to **Combusken** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Blaziken** starting from level 36.

851_Centiskorch.name: Centiskorch
851_Centiskorch.description: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

fields.Evolution: **Centiskorch** evolves from **Sizzlipede** starting from level 28.

256_Combusken.name: Combusken
256_Combusken.description: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

fields.Evolution: **Combusken** evolves from **Torchic** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Blaziken** starting from level 36.

851_Gigantamax Centiskorch.name: Gigantamax Centiskorch
851_Gigantamax Centiskorch.description: The heat that comes off a Gigantamax Centiskorch may destabilize air currents. Sometimes it can even cause storms.

257_Blaziken.name: Blaziken
257_Blaziken.description: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.

fields.Evolution: **Blaziken** evolves from **Combusken** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Torchic** starting from level 16.

852_Clobbopus.name: Clobbopus
852_Clobbopus.description: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

fields.Evolution: **Clobbopus** evolves to **Grapploct** when leveled up while knowing Taunt.
**Mega Blaziken** transforms from **Blaziken** when given a Mega Evolution.

853_Grapploct.name: Grapploct
853_Grapploct.description: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

fields.Evolution: **Grapploct** evolves from **Clobbopus** when leveled up while knowing Taunt.

258_Mudkip.name: Mudkip
258_Mudkip.description: Using the fin on its head, Mudkip senses the flow of water to keep track of what’s going on around it. Mudkip has the strength to heft boulders.

fields.Evolution: **Mudkip** evolves to **Marshtomp** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Swampert** starting from level 36.

854_Sinistea.name: Sinistea
854_Sinistea.description: Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.

fields.Evolution: **Sinistea** evolves to **Polteageist** using a Cracked Pot.

259_Marshtomp.name: Marshtomp
259_Marshtomp.description: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.

fields.Evolution: **Marshtomp** evolves from **Mudkip** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Swampert** starting from level 36.

855_Polteageist.name: Polteageist
855_Polteageist.description: Though risky to drink, this Pokémon’s tea tastes delicious. Gourmets who have no fear of danger drink Polteageist tea day after day.

fields.Evolution: **Polteageist** evolves from **Sinistea** using a Cracked Pot.

260_Swampert.name: Swampert
260_Swampert.description: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

fields.Evolution: **Swampert** evolves from **Marshtomp** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Mudkip** starting from level 16.

856_Hatenna.name: Hatenna
856_Hatenna.description: It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.

fields.Evolution: **Hatenna** evolves to **Hattrem** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Hatterene** starting from level 42.
**Mega Swampert** transforms from **Swampert** when given a Mega Evolution.

857_Hattrem.name: Hattrem
857_Hattrem.description: The moment this Pokémon finds someone who’s emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.

fields.Evolution: **Hattrem** evolves from **Hatenna** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Hatterene** starting from level 42.

261_Poochyena.name: Poochyena
261_Poochyena.description: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

fields.Evolution: **Poochyena** evolves to **Mightyena** starting from level 18.

858_Hatterene.name: Hatterene
858_Hatterene.description: Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterene’s territory.

fields.Evolution: **Hatterene** evolves from **Hattrem** starting from level 42, which evolves from **Hatenna** starting from level 32.

262_Mightyena.name: Mightyena
262_Mightyena.description: It chases down prey in a pack. It will never disobey the commands of a skilled Trainer.

fields.Evolution: **Mightyena** evolves from **Poochyena** starting from level 18.

263_Zigzagoon.name: Zigzagoon
263_Zigzagoon.description: It walks in zigzag fashion. It’s good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.

fields.Evolution: **Zigzagoon** evolves to **Linoone** starting from level 20.

858_Gigantamax Hatterene.name: Gigantamax Hatterene
858_Gigantamax Hatterene.description: Beams like lightning shoot down from its tentacles. It’s known to some as the Raging Goddess.

859_Impidimp.name: Impidimp
859_Impidimp.description: They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.

fields.Evolution: **Impidimp** evolves to **Morgrem** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Grimmsnarl** starting from level 42.

263_Galarian Zigzagoon.name: Galarian Zigzagoon
263_Galarian Zigzagoon.description: Thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon, it moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Zigzagoon** evolves to **Galarian Linoone** starting from level 20, which evolves to **Obstagoon** starting from level 35 in the nighttime.

860_Morgrem.name: Morgrem
860_Morgrem.description: This Pokémon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. It’s popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.

fields.Evolution: **Morgrem** evolves from **Impidimp** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Grimmsnarl** starting from level 42.

264_Linoone.name: Linoone
264_Linoone.description: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

fields.Evolution: **Linoone** evolves from **Zigzagoon** starting from level 20.

861_Grimmsnarl.name: Grimmsnarl
861_Grimmsnarl.description: It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasn’t given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.

fields.Evolution: **Grimmsnarl** evolves from **Morgrem** starting from level 42, which evolves from **Impidimp** starting from level 32.

264_Galarian Linoone.name: Galarian Linoone
264_Galarian Linoone.description: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Linoone** evolves from **Galarian Zigzagoon** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Obstagoon** starting from level 35 in the nighttime.

861_Gigantamax Grimmsnarl.name: Gigantamax Grimmsnarl
861_Gigantamax Grimmsnarl.description: Gigantamax energy has caused more hair to sprout all over its body. With the added strength, it can jump over the world’s tallest building.

265_Wurmple.name: Wurmple
265_Wurmple.description: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple’s appearance which form it will take when it evolves.

fields.Evolution: **Wurmple** evolves to **Silcoon** starting from level 7, which evolves to **Beautifly** starting from level 10 and evolves to **Cascoon** starting from level 7, which evolves to **Dustox** starting from level 10.

266_Silcoon.name: Silcoon
266_Silcoon.description: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can’t extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.

fields.Evolution: **Silcoon** evolves from **Wurmple** starting from level 7 and evolves to **Beautifly** starting from level 10.

862_Obstagoon.name: Obstagoon
862_Obstagoon.description: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

fields.Evolution: **Obstagoon** evolves from **Galarian Linoone** starting from level 35 in the nighttime, which evolves from **Galarian Zigzagoon** starting from level 20.

863_Perrserker.name: Perrserker
863_Perrserker.description: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

fields.Evolution: **Perrserker** evolves from **Galarian Meowth** starting from level 28.

267_Beautifly.name: Beautifly
267_Beautifly.description: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.

fields.Evolution: **Beautifly** evolves from **Silcoon** starting from level 10, which evolves from **Wurmple** starting from level 7.

864_Cursola.name: Cursola
864_Cursola.description: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

fields.Evolution: **Cursola** evolves from **Galarian Corsola** starting from level 38.

268_Cascoon.name: Cascoon
268_Cascoon.description: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon’s silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon’s, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.

fields.Evolution: **Cascoon** evolves from **Wurmple** starting from level 7 and evolves to **Dustox** starting from level 10.

865_Sirfetch'd.name: Sirfetch'd
865_Sirfetch'd.description: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

fields.Evolution: **Sirfetch'd** evolves from **Galarian Farfetch'd** somehow.

269_Dustox.name: Dustox
269_Dustox.description: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.

fields.Evolution: **Dustox** evolves from **Cascoon** starting from level 10, which evolves from **Wurmple** starting from level 7.

270_Lotad.name: Lotad
270_Lotad.description: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry for Pokémon that can’t swim.

fields.Evolution: **Lotad** evolves to **Lombre** starting from level 14, which evolves to **Ludicolo** using a Water Stone.

866_Mr. Rime.name: Mr. Rime
866_Mr. Rime.description: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

fields.Evolution: **Mr. Rime** evolves from **Galarian Mr. Mime** starting from level 42.

867_Runerigus.name: Runerigus
867_Runerigus.description: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

fields.Evolution: **Runerigus** evolves from **Galarian Yamask** somehow.

271_Lombre.name: Lombre
271_Lombre.description: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

fields.Evolution: **Lombre** evolves from **Lotad** starting from level 14 and evolves to **Ludicolo** using a Water Stone.

868_Milcery.name: Milcery
868_Milcery.description: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.

fields.Evolution: **Milcery** evolves to **Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Strawberry Sweet in the daytime, evolves to **Vanilla Cream Berry Sweet Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Berry Sweet in the daytime, evolves to **Vanilla Cream Love Sweet Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Love Sweet in the daytime, evolves to **Vanilla Cream Star Sweet Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Star Sweet in the daytime, evolves to **Vanilla Cream Clover Sweet Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Clover Sweet in the daytime, evolves to **Vanilla Cream Flower Sweet Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Flower Sweet in the daytime and evolves to **Vanilla Cream Ribbon Sweet Alcremie** when leveled up while holding a Ribbon Sweet in the daytime.

272_Ludicolo.name: Ludicolo
272_Ludicolo.description: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.

fields.Evolution: **Ludicolo** evolves from **Lombre** using a Water Stone, which evolves from **Lotad** starting from level 14.

869_Alcremie.name: Alcremie
869_Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Strawberry Sweet in the daytime.

273_Seedot.name: Seedot
273_Seedot.description: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon that try to peck at it.

fields.Evolution: **Seedot** evolves to **Nuzleaf** starting from level 14, which evolves to **Shiftry** using a Leaf Stone.

869_Gigantamax Alcremie.name: Gigantamax Alcremie
869_Gigantamax Alcremie.description: It launches swarms of missiles, each made of cream and loaded with 100,000 kilocalories. Get hit by one of these, and your head will swim.

274_Nuzleaf.name: Nuzleaf
274_Nuzleaf.description: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in the forest.

fields.Evolution: **Nuzleaf** evolves from **Seedot** starting from level 14 and evolves to **Shiftry** using a Leaf Stone.

869_Vanilla Cream Berry Sweet Alcremie.name: Vanilla Cream Berry Sweet Alcremie
869_Vanilla Cream Berry Sweet Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilla Cream Berry Sweet Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Berry Sweet in the daytime.

275_Shiftry.name: Shiftry
275_Shiftry.description: By flapping its leafy fans, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.

fields.Evolution: **Shiftry** evolves from **Nuzleaf** using a Leaf Stone, which evolves from **Seedot** starting from level 14.

276_Taillow.name: Taillow
276_Taillow.description: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

fields.Evolution: **Taillow** evolves to **Swellow** starting from level 22.

869_Vanilla Cream Love Sweet Alcremie.name: Vanilla Cream Love Sweet Alcremie
869_Vanilla Cream Love Sweet Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilla Cream Love Sweet Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Love Sweet in the daytime.

277_Swellow.name: Swellow
277_Swellow.description: It circles the sky in search of prey and dives sharply to catch its target.

fields.Evolution: **Swellow** evolves from **Taillow** starting from level 22.

869_Vanilla Cream Star Sweet Alcremie.name: Vanilla Cream Star Sweet Alcremie
869_Vanilla Cream Star Sweet Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilla Cream Star Sweet Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Star Sweet in the daytime.

869_Vanilla Cream Clover Sweet Alcremie.name: Vanilla Cream Clover Sweet Alcremie
869_Vanilla Cream Clover Sweet Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilla Cream Clover Sweet Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Clover Sweet in the daytime.

278_Wingull.name: Wingull
278_Wingull.description: It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.

fields.Evolution: **Wingull** evolves to **Pelipper** starting from level 25.

279_Pelipper.name: Pelipper
279_Pelipper.description: It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.

fields.Evolution: **Pelipper** evolves from **Wingull** starting from level 25.

869_Vanilla Cream Flower Sweet Alcremie.name: Vanilla Cream Flower Sweet Alcremie
869_Vanilla Cream Flower Sweet Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilla Cream Flower Sweet Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Flower Sweet in the daytime.

869_Vanilla Cream Ribbon Sweet Alcremie.name: Vanilla Cream Ribbon Sweet Alcremie
869_Vanilla Cream Ribbon Sweet Alcremie.description: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilla Cream Ribbon Sweet Alcremie** evolves from **Milcery** when leveled up while holding a Ribbon Sweet in the daytime.

280_Ralts.name: Ralts
280_Ralts.description: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

fields.Evolution: **Ralts** evolves to **Kirlia** starting from level 20, which evolves to **Gardevoir** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Gallade** using a Dawn Stone.

870_Falinks.name: Falinks
870_Falinks.description: The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when it’s time to change formation.

281_Kirlia.name: Kirlia
281_Kirlia.description: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

fields.Evolution: **Kirlia** evolves from **Ralts** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Gardevoir** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Gallade** using a Dawn Stone.

871_Pincurchin.name: Pincurchin
871_Pincurchin.description: This Pokémon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.

282_Gardevoir.name: Gardevoir
282_Gardevoir.description: It unleashes psychokinetic energy at full power when protecting a Trainer it has bonded closely with.

fields.Evolution: **Gardevoir** evolves from **Kirlia** starting from level 30, which evolves from **Ralts** starting from level 20.

872_Snom.name: Snom
872_Snom.description: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.

fields.Evolution: **Snom** evolves to **Frosmoth** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the nighttime.
**Mega Gardevoir** transforms from **Gardevoir** when given a Mega Evolution.

873_Frosmoth.name: Frosmoth
873_Frosmoth.description: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.

fields.Evolution: **Frosmoth** evolves from **Snom** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the nighttime.

283_Surskit.name: Surskit
283_Surskit.description: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.

fields.Evolution: **Surskit** evolves to **Masquerain** starting from level 22.

874_Stonjourner.name: Stonjourner
874_Stonjourner.description: This Pokémon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.

284_Masquerain.name: Masquerain
284_Masquerain.description: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.

fields.Evolution: **Masquerain** evolves from **Surskit** starting from level 22.

875_Eiscue.name: Eiscue
875_Eiscue.description: If you lick the ice covering its face, you’ll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.

285_Shroomish.name: Shroomish
285_Shroomish.description: If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.

fields.Evolution: **Shroomish** evolves to **Breloom** starting from level 23.

875_Noice Face Eiscue.name: Noice Face Eiscue
875_Noice Face Eiscue.description: If you lick the ice covering its face, you’ll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.

fields.Evolution: **Noice Face Eiscue** transforms from **Eiscue** when given a Transformation.

286_Breloom.name: Breloom
286_Breloom.description: The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.

fields.Evolution: **Breloom** evolves from **Shroomish** starting from level 23.

876_Indeedee.name: Indeedee
876_Indeedee.description: This Pokémon never leaves its Trainer’s side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.

287_Slakoth.name: Slakoth
287_Slakoth.description: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

fields.Evolution: **Slakoth** evolves to **Vigoroth** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Slaking** starting from level 36.

877_Morpeko.name: Morpeko
877_Morpeko.description: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

288_Vigoroth.name: Vigoroth
288_Vigoroth.description: It is always hungry because it won’t stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it can’t keep still.

fields.Evolution: **Vigoroth** evolves from **Slakoth** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Slaking** starting from level 36.

877_Hangry Morpeko.name: Hangry Morpeko
877_Hangry Morpeko.description: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

fields.Evolution: **Hangry Morpeko** transforms from **Morpeko** when given a Transformation.

289_Slaking.name: Slaking
289_Slaking.description: This Pokémon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.

fields.Evolution: **Slaking** evolves from **Vigoroth** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Slakoth** starting from level 18.

878_Cufant.name: Cufant
878_Cufant.description: Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokémon feed.

fields.Evolution: **Cufant** evolves to **Copperajah** starting from level 34.

290_Nincada.name: Nincada
290_Nincada.description: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

fields.Evolution: **Nincada** evolves to **Ninjask** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Shedinja** somehow.

879_Copperajah.name: Copperajah
879_Copperajah.description: Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokémon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.

fields.Evolution: **Copperajah** evolves from **Cufant** starting from level 34.

291_Ninjask.name: Ninjask
291_Ninjask.description: Because they move so quickly, they sometimes become unseeable. They congregate around tree sap.

fields.Evolution: **Ninjask** evolves from **Nincada** starting from level 20.

879_Gigantamax Copperajah.name: Gigantamax Copperajah
879_Gigantamax Copperajah.description: After this Pokémon has Gigantamaxed, its massive nose can utterly demolish large structures with a single smashing blow.

292_Shedinja.name: Shedinja
292_Shedinja.description: It is a discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.

fields.Evolution: **Shedinja** evolves from **Nincada** somehow.

881_Arctozolt.name: Arctozolt
881_Arctozolt.description: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

293_Whismur.name: Whismur
293_Whismur.description: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

fields.Evolution: **Whismur** evolves to **Loudred** starting from level 20, which evolves to **Exploud** starting from level 40.

880_Dracozolt.name: Dracozolt
880_Dracozolt.description: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

294_Loudred.name: Loudred
294_Loudred.description: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

fields.Evolution: **Loudred** evolves from **Whismur** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Exploud** starting from level 40.

882_Dracovish.name: Dracovish
882_Dracovish.description: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

295_Exploud.name: Exploud
295_Exploud.description: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

fields.Evolution: **Exploud** evolves from **Loudred** starting from level 40, which evolves from **Whismur** starting from level 20.

883_Arctovish.name: Arctovish
883_Arctovish.description: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

296_Makuhita.name: Makuhita
296_Makuhita.description: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.

fields.Evolution: **Makuhita** evolves to **Hariyama** starting from level 24.

884_Duraludon.name: Duraludon
884_Duraludon.description: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

fields.Evolution: **Duraludon** evolves to **Archaludon** using a Metal Alloy.

297_Hariyama.name: Hariyama
297_Hariyama.description: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.

fields.Evolution: **Hariyama** evolves from **Makuhita** starting from level 24.

884_Gigantamax Duraludon.name: Gigantamax Duraludon
884_Gigantamax Duraludon.description: The hardness of its cells is exceptional, even among Steel types. It also has a body structure that’s resistant to earthquakes.

298_Azurill.name: Azurill
298_Azurill.description: Its tail is packed full of the nutrients it needs to grow.

fields.Evolution: **Azurill** evolves to **Marill** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves to **Azumarill** starting from level 18.

885_Dreepy.name: Dreepy
885_Dreepy.description: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn’t feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

fields.Evolution: **Dreepy** evolves to **Drakloak** starting from level 50, which evolves to **Dragapult** starting from level 60.

299_Nosepass.name: Nosepass
299_Nosepass.description: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.

fields.Evolution: **Nosepass** evolves to **Probopass** using a Thunder Stone.

300_Skitty.name: Skitty
300_Skitty.description: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in circles, chasing its own tail.

fields.Evolution: **Skitty** evolves to **Delcatty** using a Moon Stone.

886_Drakloak.name: Drakloak
886_Drakloak.description: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they’re all grown up.

fields.Evolution: **Drakloak** evolves from **Dreepy** starting from level 50 and evolves to **Dragapult** starting from level 60.

887_Dragapult.name: Dragapult
887_Dragapult.description: The fastest Dragapult of the group is always surrounded by Dreepy that want to fly at sonic speed.

fields.Evolution: **Dragapult** evolves from **Drakloak** starting from level 60, which evolves from **Dreepy** starting from level 50.

301_Delcatty.name: Delcatty
301_Delcatty.description: It is highly popular among Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

fields.Evolution: **Delcatty** evolves from **Skitty** using a Moon Stone.

302_Sableye.name: Sableye
302_Sableye.description: Materials from gems it has eaten float to the surface of its body and can form an infinite number of patterns among individuals.

888_Zacian.name: Zacian
888_Zacian.description: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.

302_Mega Sableye.name: Mega Sableye
302_Mega Sableye.description: It blocks any and all attacks with its giant-sized gemstone. However, the stone’s a heavy burden, and it limits Mega Sableye’s movements.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Sableye** transforms from **Sableye** when given a Mega Evolution.

888_Crowned Zacian.name: Crowned Zacian
888_Crowned Zacian.description: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King’s Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.

fields.Evolution: **Crowned Zacian** transforms from **Zacian** when given a Rusted Sword.

889_Zamazenta.name: Zamazenta
889_Zamazenta.description: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.

303_Mawile.name: Mawile
303_Mawile.description: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

889_Crowned Zamazenta.name: Crowned Zamazenta
889_Crowned Zamazenta.description: Now that it’s equipped with its shield, it can shrug off impressive blows, including the attacks of Dynamax Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Crowned Zamazenta** transforms from **Zamazenta** when given a Rusted Shield.

303_Mega Mawile.name: Mega Mawile
303_Mega Mawile.description: Its two sets of jaws thrash about violently as if they each had a will of their own. One gnash from them can turn a boulder to dust.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Mawile** transforms from **Mawile** when given a Mega Evolution.

890_Eternatus.name: Eternatus
890_Eternatus.description: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

304_Aron.name: Aron
304_Aron.description: It usually lives deep in mountains. But when it’s hungry, it shows up at the foot of the mountains and eats railroad tracks and cars.

fields.Evolution: **Aron** evolves to **Lairon** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Aggron** starting from level 42.

305_Lairon.name: Lairon
305_Lairon.description: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.

fields.Evolution: **Lairon** evolves from **Aron** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Aggron** starting from level 42.

890_Eternamax Eternatus.name: Eternamax Eternatus
890_Eternamax Eternatus.description: Infinite amounts of energy pour from this Pokémon’s enlarged core, warping the surrounding space-time.

306_Aggron.name: Aggron
306_Aggron.description: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

fields.Evolution: **Aggron** evolves from **Lairon** starting from level 42, which evolves from **Aron** starting from level 32.

891_Kubfu.name: Kubfu
891_Kubfu.description: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

fields.Evolution: **Kubfu** evolves to **Urshifu** using a Scroll of Darkness and evolves to **Rapid Strike Urshifu** using a Scroll of Waters.

892_Urshifu.name: Urshifu
892_Urshifu.description: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.

fields.Evolution: **Urshifu** evolves from **Kubfu** using a Scroll of Darkness.
**Mega Aggron** transforms from **Aggron** when given a Mega Evolution.

307_Meditite.name: Meditite
307_Meditite.description: It meditates to heighten its inner energy and to float in the air. It eats one berry a day.

fields.Evolution: **Meditite** evolves to **Medicham** starting from level 37.

892_Rapid Strike Urshifu.name: Rapid Strike Urshifu
892_Rapid Strike Urshifu.description: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.

fields.Evolution: **Rapid Strike Urshifu** evolves from **Kubfu** using a Scroll of Waters.

892_Gigantamax Single Strike Urshifu.name: Gigantamax Single Strike Urshifu
892_Gigantamax Single Strike Urshifu.description: The energy released by this Pokémon’s fists forms shock waves that can blow away Dynamax Pokémon in just one hit.

308_Medicham.name: Medicham
308_Medicham.description: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.

fields.Evolution: **Medicham** evolves from **Meditite** starting from level 37.
**Mega Medicham** transforms from **Medicham** when given a Mega Evolution.

892_Gigantamax Rapid Strike Urshifu.name: Gigantamax Rapid Strike Urshifu
892_Gigantamax Rapid Strike Urshifu.description: All it takes is a glare from this Pokémon to take the lives of those with evil in their hearts—or so they say.

893_Zarude.name: Zarude
893_Zarude.description: Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

309_Electrike.name: Electrike
309_Electrike.description: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

fields.Evolution: **Electrike** evolves to **Manectric** starting from level 26.

893_Dada Zarude.name: Dada Zarude
893_Dada Zarude.description: This Zarude’s special strength stems from its love and care for an orphaned human child that the Pokémon has raised since the child’s infancy.

310_Manectric.name: Manectric
310_Manectric.description: It discharges electricity from its mane. The Pokémon creates a thundercloud overhead from which to drop lightning bolts.

fields.Evolution: **Manectric** evolves from **Electrike** starting from level 26.

894_Regieleki.name: Regieleki
894_Regieleki.description: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.

310_Mega Manectric.name: Mega Manectric
310_Mega Manectric.description: Too much electricity has built up in its body, irritating Manectric. Its explosive speed is equal to that of a lightning bolt.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Manectric** transforms from **Manectric** when given a Mega Evolution.

895_Regidrago.name: Regidrago
895_Regidrago.description: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

311_Plusle.name: Plusle
311_Plusle.description: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

896_Glastrier.name: Glastrier
896_Glastrier.description: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

312_Minun.name: Minun
312_Minun.description: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

897_Spectrier.name: Spectrier
897_Spectrier.description: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

313_Volbeat.name: Volbeat
313_Volbeat.description: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.

898_Calyrex.name: Calyrex
898_Calyrex.description: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.

314_Illumise.name: Illumise
314_Illumise.description: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

898_Ice Rider Calyrex.name: Ice Rider Calyrex
898_Ice Rider Calyrex.description: It’s said that this Pokémon once moved a large forest—and all the Pokémon living there—to a new location overnight.

fields.Evolution: **Ice Rider Calyrex** transforms from **Calyrex** when given a Reins of Unity.

315_Roselia.name: Roselia
315_Roselia.description: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.

fields.Evolution: **Roselia** evolves from **Budew** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime and evolves to **Roserade** using a Shiny Stone.

898_Shadow Rider Calyrex.name: Shadow Rider Calyrex
898_Shadow Rider Calyrex.description: Legend says that by using its power to see all events from past to future, this Pokémon saved the creatures of a forest from a meteorite strike.

fields.Evolution: **Shadow Rider Calyrex** transforms from **Calyrex** when given a Reins of Unity.

316_Gulpin.name: Gulpin
316_Gulpin.description: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.

fields.Evolution: **Gulpin** evolves to **Swalot** starting from level 26.

899_Wyrdeer.name: Wyrdeer
899_Wyrdeer.description: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

fields.Evolution: **Wyrdeer** evolves from **Stantler** when leveled up.

317_Swalot.name: Swalot
317_Swalot.description: It can swallow a tire whole in one gulp. It secretes a horribly toxic fluid from the pores on its body.

fields.Evolution: **Swalot** evolves from **Gulpin** starting from level 26.

900_Kleavor.name: Kleavor
900_Kleavor.description: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.

fields.Evolution: **Kleavor** evolves from **Scyther** using a Black Augurite.

318_Carvanha.name: Carvanha
318_Carvanha.description: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

fields.Evolution: **Carvanha** evolves to **Sharpedo** starting from level 30.

901_Ursaluna.name: Ursaluna
901_Ursaluna.description: I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

fields.Evolution: **Ursaluna** evolves from **Ursaring** using a Peat Block, which evolves from **Teddiursa** starting from level 30.

901_Bloodmoon Ursaluna.name: Bloodmoon Ursaluna
901_Bloodmoon Ursaluna.description: This special Ursaluna can see in the dark with its left eye and protects itself with mud that is as hard as iron.

319_Sharpedo.name: Sharpedo
319_Sharpedo.description: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as the Bully of the Sea.

fields.Evolution: **Sharpedo** evolves from **Carvanha** starting from level 30.

319_Mega Sharpedo.name: Mega Sharpedo
319_Mega Sharpedo.description: The moment it charges into its opponent, sharp spikes pop out of Sharpedo’s head, leaving its opponent with deep wounds.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Sharpedo** transforms from **Sharpedo** when given a Mega Evolution.

902_Basculegion.name: Basculegion
902_Basculegion.description: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.

fields.Evolution: **Basculegion** evolves from **White-Striped Basculin** starting from level 29.

903_Sneasler.name: Sneasler
903_Sneasler.description: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

fields.Evolution: **Sneasler** evolves from **Hisuian Sneasel** when leveled up while holding a Razor Claw in the daytime.

320_Wailmer.name: Wailmer
320_Wailmer.description: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nostrils.

fields.Evolution: **Wailmer** evolves to **Wailord** starting from level 40.

904_Overqwil.name: Overqwil
904_Overqwil.description: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

fields.Evolution: **Overqwil** evolves from **Hisuian Qwilfish** when leveled up.

321_Wailord.name: Wailord
321_Wailord.description: It’s the biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

fields.Evolution: **Wailord** evolves from **Wailmer** starting from level 40.

905_Enamorus.name: Enamorus
905_Enamorus.description: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

322_Numel.name: Numel
322_Numel.description: The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.

fields.Evolution: **Numel** evolves to **Camerupt** starting from level 33.

905_Therian Enamorus.name: Therian Enamorus
905_Therian Enamorus.description: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.

fields.Evolution: **Therian Enamorus** transforms from **Enamorus** when given a Reveal Glass.

323_Camerupt.name: Camerupt
323_Camerupt.description: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.

fields.Evolution: **Camerupt** evolves from **Numel** starting from level 33.
**Mega Camerupt** transforms from **Camerupt** when given a Mega Evolution.

907_Floragato.name: Floragato
907_Floragato.description: The hardness of Floragato’s fur depends on the Pokémon’s mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.

fields.Evolution: **Floragato** evolves from **Sprigatito** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Meowscarada** starting from level 36.

906_Sprigatito.name: Sprigatito
906_Sprigatito.description: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokémon is in the sun.

fields.Evolution: **Sprigatito** evolves to **Floragato** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Meowscarada** starting from level 36.

324_Torkoal.name: Torkoal
324_Torkoal.description: Coal is the source of Torkoal’s energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.

908_Meowscarada.name: Meowscarada
908_Meowscarada.description: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize what’s going on.

fields.Evolution: **Meowscarada** evolves from **Floragato** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Sprigatito** starting from level 16.

325_Spoink.name: Spoink
325_Spoink.description: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.

fields.Evolution: **Spoink** evolves to **Grumpig** starting from level 32.

909_Fuecoco.name: Fuecoco
909_Fuecoco.description: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.

fields.Evolution: **Fuecoco** evolves to **Crocalor** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Skeledirge** starting from level 36.

326_Grumpig.name: Grumpig
326_Grumpig.description: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes’ minds.

fields.Evolution: **Grumpig** evolves from **Spoink** starting from level 32.

910_Crocalor.name: Crocalor
910_Crocalor.description: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.
