fields.Evolution: **Crocalor** evolves from **Fuecoco** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Skeledirge** starting from level 36.

327_Spinda.name: Spinda
327_Spinda.description: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Their tottering steps hinder the aim of foes.

911_Skeledirge.name: Skeledirge
911_Skeledirge.description: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

fields.Evolution: **Skeledirge** evolves from **Crocalor** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Fuecoco** starting from level 16.

328_Trapinch.name: Trapinch
328_Trapinch.description: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

fields.Evolution: **Trapinch** evolves to **Vibrava** starting from level 35, which evolves to **Flygon** starting from level 45.

912_Quaxly.name: Quaxly
912_Quaxly.description: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.

fields.Evolution: **Quaxly** evolves to **Quaxwell** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Quaquaval** starting from level 36.

329_Vibrava.name: Vibrava
329_Vibrava.description: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.

fields.Evolution: **Vibrava** evolves from **Trapinch** starting from level 35 and evolves to **Flygon** starting from level 45.

913_Quaxwell.name: Quaxwell
913_Quaxwell.description: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokémon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.

fields.Evolution: **Quaxwell** evolves from **Quaxly** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Quaquaval** starting from level 36.

330_Flygon.name: Flygon
330_Flygon.description: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as the Desert Spirit.

fields.Evolution: **Flygon** evolves from **Vibrava** starting from level 45, which evolves from **Trapinch** starting from level 35.

914_Quaquaval.name: Quaquaval
914_Quaquaval.description: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.

fields.Evolution: **Quaquaval** evolves from **Quaxwell** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Quaxly** starting from level 16.

331_Cacnea.name: Cacnea
331_Cacnea.description: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.

fields.Evolution: **Cacnea** evolves to **Cacturne** starting from level 32.

915_Lechonk.name: Lechonk
915_Lechonk.description: This Pokémon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokémon detest.

fields.Evolution: **Lechonk** evolves to **Oinkologne** starting from level 18.

332_Cacturne.name: Cacturne
332_Cacturne.description: It lives in deserts. It becomes active at night when it hunts for prey exhausted from the desert’s heat.

fields.Evolution: **Cacturne** evolves from **Cacnea** starting from level 32.

916_Oinkologne.name: Oinkologne
916_Oinkologne.description: It entrances female Pokémon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.

fields.Evolution: **Oinkologne** evolves from **Lechonk** starting from level 18.

333_Swablu.name: Swablu
333_Swablu.description: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

fields.Evolution: **Swablu** evolves to **Altaria** starting from level 35.

917_Tarountula.name: Tarountula
917_Tarountula.description: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread’s strength is the topic of ongoing research.

fields.Evolution: **Tarountula** evolves to **Spidops** starting from level 15.

918_Spidops.name: Spidops
918_Spidops.description: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.

fields.Evolution: **Spidops** evolves from **Tarountula** starting from level 15.

334_Altaria.name: Altaria
334_Altaria.description: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

fields.Evolution: **Altaria** evolves from **Swablu** starting from level 35.
**Mega Altaria** transforms from **Altaria** when given a Mega Evolution.

919_Nymble.name: Nymble
919_Nymble.description: It’s highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.

fields.Evolution: **Nymble** evolves to **Lokix** starting from level 24.

335_Zangoose.name: Zangoose
335_Zangoose.description: If it comes across a Seviper, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.

920_Lokix.name: Lokix
920_Lokix.description: It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it can’t stay in this mode for long.

fields.Evolution: **Lokix** evolves from **Nymble** starting from level 24.

336_Seviper.name: Seviper
336_Seviper.description: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It’s Zangoose’s archrival.

921_Pawmi.name: Pawmi
921_Pawmi.description: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

fields.Evolution: **Pawmi** evolves to **Pawmo** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Pawmot** somehow.

337_Lunatone.name: Lunatone
337_Lunatone.description: It becomes active on nights with a full moon, so it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

922_Pawmo.name: Pawmo
922_Pawmo.description: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.

fields.Evolution: **Pawmo** evolves from **Pawmi** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Pawmot** somehow.

338_Solrock.name: Solrock
338_Solrock.description: This new Pokémon species is rumored to be an avatar of the sun. The Pokémon gives off light while spinning.

923_Pawmot.name: Pawmot
923_Pawmot.description: Pawmot’s fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.

fields.Evolution: **Pawmot** evolves from **Pawmo** somehow, which evolves from **Pawmi** starting from level 18.

339_Barboach.name: Barboach
339_Barboach.description: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.

fields.Evolution: **Barboach** evolves to **Whiscash** starting from level 30.

924_Tandemaus.name: Tandemaus
924_Tandemaus.description: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.

fields.Evolution: **Tandemaus** evolves to **Maushold** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Family of Three Maushold** starting from level 25.

340_Whiscash.name: Whiscash
340_Whiscash.description: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.

fields.Evolution: **Whiscash** evolves from **Barboach** starting from level 30.

925_Maushold.name: Maushold
925_Maushold.description: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

fields.Evolution: **Maushold** evolves from **Tandemaus** starting from level 25.

341_Corphish.name: Corphish
341_Corphish.description: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.

fields.Evolution: **Corphish** evolves to **Crawdaunt** starting from level 30.

925_Family of Three Maushold.name: Family of Three Maushold
925_Family of Three Maushold.description: The little one just appeared one day. They all live together like a family, but the relationship between the three is still unclear.

fields.Evolution: **Family of Three Maushold** evolves from **Tandemaus** starting from level 25.

342_Crawdaunt.name: Crawdaunt
342_Crawdaunt.description: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

fields.Evolution: **Crawdaunt** evolves from **Corphish** starting from level 30.

926_Fidough.name: Fidough
926_Fidough.description: The yeast in Fidough’s breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokémon has been protected by people since long ago.

fields.Evolution: **Fidough** evolves to **Dachsbun** starting from level 26.

343_Baltoy.name: Baltoy
343_Baltoy.description: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

fields.Evolution: **Baltoy** evolves to **Claydol** starting from level 36.

927_Dachsbun.name: Dachsbun
927_Dachsbun.description: The surface of this Pokémon’s skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.

fields.Evolution: **Dachsbun** evolves from **Fidough** starting from level 26.

344_Claydol.name: Claydol
344_Claydol.description: An ancient clay figurine was exposed to a mysterious ray of light, and it came to life as a Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Claydol** evolves from **Baltoy** starting from level 36.

928_Smoliv.name: Smoliv
928_Smoliv.description: This Pokémon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.

fields.Evolution: **Smoliv** evolves to **Dolliv** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Arboliva** starting from level 35.

345_Lileep.name: Lileep
345_Lileep.description: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.

fields.Evolution: **Lileep** evolves to **Cradily** starting from level 40.

929_Dolliv.name: Dolliv
929_Dolliv.description: It basks in the sun to its heart’s content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.

fields.Evolution: **Dolliv** evolves from **Smoliv** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Arboliva** starting from level 35.

346_Cradily.name: Cradily
346_Cradily.description: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.

fields.Evolution: **Cradily** evolves from **Lileep** starting from level 40.

930_Arboliva.name: Arboliva
930_Arboliva.description: This Pokémon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.

fields.Evolution: **Arboliva** evolves from **Dolliv** starting from level 35, which evolves from **Smoliv** starting from level 25.

347_Anorith.name: Anorith
347_Anorith.description: This Pokémon ancestor was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with its claws.

fields.Evolution: **Anorith** evolves to **Armaldo** starting from level 40.

931_Squawkabilly.name: Squawkabilly
931_Squawkabilly.description: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they’re out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.

931_Blue Plumage Squawkabilly.name: Blue Plumage Squawkabilly
931_Blue Plumage Squawkabilly.description: Blue-feathered Squawkabilly view their green-feathered counterparts as rivals, since the latter make up the largest, most powerful groups.

348_Armaldo.name: Armaldo
348_Armaldo.description: It went ashore after evolving. Its entire body is clad in a sturdy armor.

fields.Evolution: **Armaldo** evolves from **Anorith** starting from level 40.

931_Yellow Plumage Squawkabilly.name: Yellow Plumage Squawkabilly
931_Yellow Plumage Squawkabilly.description: The yellow Squawkabilly are especially fierce. They’ve even been known to drive other bird Pokémon out of town.

349_Feebas.name: Feebas
349_Feebas.description: It eats anything, so it can even live in polluted streams and lakes. No one pays any attention to it.

fields.Evolution: **Feebas** evolves to **Milotic** when leveled up while holding a Prism Scale.

931_White Plumage Squawkabilly.name: White Plumage Squawkabilly
931_White Plumage Squawkabilly.description: Though these Squawkabilly are the fewest in number, they have no trouble living in towns since they blend in with the white buildings.

350_Milotic.name: Milotic
350_Milotic.description: It is the world’s most beautiful Pokémon. There are many works of art featuring Milotic.

fields.Evolution: **Milotic** evolves from **Feebas** when leveled up while holding a Prism Scale.

932_Nacli.name: Nacli
932_Nacli.description: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Nacli’s body.

fields.Evolution: **Nacli** evolves to **Naclstack** starting from level 24, which evolves to **Garganacl** starting from level 38.

351_Castform.name: Castform
351_Castform.description: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

933_Naclstack.name: Naclstack
933_Naclstack.description: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.

fields.Evolution: **Naclstack** evolves from **Nacli** starting from level 24 and evolves to **Garganacl** starting from level 38.

351_Sunny Castform.name: Sunny Castform
351_Sunny Castform.description: Castform changes to this form when it basks in bright sunlight. When you touch its glowing skin, it feels all dried out!

934_Garganacl.name: Garganacl
934_Garganacl.description: Many Pokémon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.

fields.Evolution: **Garganacl** evolves from **Naclstack** starting from level 38, which evolves from **Nacli** starting from level 24.

351_Rainy Castform.name: Rainy Castform
351_Rainy Castform.description: This is Castform’s form when pelted by rain. In an experiment where it was placed in a shower, this Pokémon didn’t change to this form.

935_Charcadet.name: Charcadet
935_Charcadet.description: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.

fields.Evolution: **Charcadet** evolves to **Armarouge** using a Auspicious Armor and evolves to **Ceruledge** using a Malicious Armor.

351_Snowy Castform.name: Snowy Castform
351_Snowy Castform.description: This is Castform’s form when caught in a hailstorm. Its whole body is chilled, and its skin is partially frozen!

936_Armarouge.name: Armarouge
936_Armarouge.description: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.

fields.Evolution: **Armarouge** evolves from **Charcadet** using a Auspicious Armor.

352_Kecleon.name: Kecleon
352_Kecleon.description: It can freely change its body’s color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn’t change, however.

937_Ceruledge.name: Ceruledge
937_Ceruledge.description: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.

fields.Evolution: **Ceruledge** evolves from **Charcadet** using a Malicious Armor.

353_Shuppet.name: Shuppet
353_Shuppet.description: It feeds on the dark emotions of sadness and hatred, which make it grow steadily stronger.

fields.Evolution: **Shuppet** evolves to **Banette** starting from level 37.

938_Tadbulb.name: Tadbulb
938_Tadbulb.description: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.

fields.Evolution: **Tadbulb** evolves to **Bellibolt** using a Thunder Stone.

354_Banette.name: Banette
354_Banette.description: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.

fields.Evolution: **Banette** evolves from **Shuppet** starting from level 37.

939_Bellibolt.name: Bellibolt
939_Bellibolt.description: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt’s belly-button dynamo.

fields.Evolution: **Bellibolt** evolves from **Tadbulb** using a Thunder Stone.

354_Mega Banette.name: Mega Banette
354_Mega Banette.description: Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Banette** transforms from **Banette** when given a Mega Evolution.

940_Wattrel.name: Wattrel
940_Wattrel.description: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.

fields.Evolution: **Wattrel** evolves to **Kilowattrel** starting from level 25.

355_Duskull.name: Duskull
355_Duskull.description: I’ve heard that the children of Hisui all begin to behave once they’ve been told the story of how this Pokémon roams about before the witching hour to spirit away misbehaving children.

fields.Evolution: **Duskull** evolves to **Dusclops** starting from level 37, which evolves to **Dusknoir** when traded while holding a Reaper Cloth.

941_Kilowattrel.name: Kilowattrel
941_Kilowattrel.description: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There’s hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.

fields.Evolution: **Kilowattrel** evolves from **Wattrel** starting from level 25.

356_Dusclops.name: Dusclops
356_Dusclops.description: There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the bandages, never to return. I’ve been too scared to verify.

fields.Evolution: **Dusclops** evolves from **Duskull** starting from level 37 and evolves to **Dusknoir** when traded while holding a Reaper Cloth.

942_Maschiff.name: Maschiff
942_Maschiff.description: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.

fields.Evolution: **Maschiff** evolves to **Mabosstiff** starting from level 30.

357_Tropius.name: Tropius
357_Tropius.description: Delicious fruits grew out from around its neck because it always ate the same kind of fruit.

358_Chimecho.name: Chimecho
358_Chimecho.description: Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind within its body.

fields.Evolution: **Chimecho** evolves from **Chingling** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the nighttime.

943_Mabosstiff.name: Mabosstiff
943_Mabosstiff.description: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.

fields.Evolution: **Mabosstiff** evolves from **Maschiff** starting from level 30.

359_Absol.name: Absol
359_Absol.description: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.

944_Shroodle.name: Shroodle
944_Shroodle.description: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.

fields.Evolution: **Shroodle** evolves to **Grafaiai** starting from level 28.

359_Mega Absol.name: Mega Absol
359_Mega Absol.description: It converts the energy from Mega Evolution into an intimidating aura. Fainthearted people expire from shock at the sight of it.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Absol** transforms from **Absol** when given a Mega Evolution.

945_Grafaiai.name: Grafaiai
945_Grafaiai.description: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.

fields.Evolution: **Grafaiai** evolves from **Shroodle** starting from level 28.

360_Wynaut.name: Wynaut
360_Wynaut.description: They grow strong by pushing up against one another en masse. They love eating sweet fruit.

fields.Evolution: **Wynaut** evolves to **Wobbuffet** starting from level 15.

946_Bramblin.name: Bramblin
946_Bramblin.description: Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.

fields.Evolution: **Bramblin** evolves to **Brambleghast** somehow.

361_Snorunt.name: Snorunt
361_Snorunt.description: It is said that a home visited by a Snorunt will prosper. It can withstand cold of −150 degrees Fahrenheit.

fields.Evolution: **Snorunt** evolves to **Glalie** starting from level 42 and evolves to **Froslass** using a Dawn Stone.

947_Brambleghast.name: Brambleghast
947_Brambleghast.description: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokémon will bury an entire town.

fields.Evolution: **Brambleghast** evolves from **Bramblin** somehow.

362_Glalie.name: Glalie
362_Glalie.description: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.

fields.Evolution: **Glalie** evolves from **Snorunt** starting from level 42.

948_Toedscool.name: Toedscool
948_Toedscool.description: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

fields.Evolution: **Toedscool** evolves to **Toedscruel** starting from level 30.

362_Mega Glalie.name: Mega Glalie
362_Mega Glalie.description: The power of Mega Evolution was so strong that it smashed Glalie’s jaw. Its inability to eat very well leaves Glalie irritated.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Glalie** transforms from **Glalie** when given a Mega Evolution.

949_Toedscruel.name: Toedscruel
949_Toedscruel.description: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

fields.Evolution: **Toedscruel** evolves from **Toedscool** starting from level 30.

363_Spheal.name: Spheal
363_Spheal.description: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.

fields.Evolution: **Spheal** evolves to **Sealeo** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Walrein** starting from level 44.

950_Klawf.name: Klawf
950_Klawf.description: This Pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.

951_Capsakid.name: Capsakid
951_Capsakid.description: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.

fields.Evolution: **Capsakid** evolves to **Scovillain** using a Fire Stone.

364_Sealeo.name: Sealeo
364_Sealeo.description: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.

fields.Evolution: **Sealeo** evolves from **Spheal** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Walrein** starting from level 44.

365_Walrein.name: Walrein
365_Walrein.description: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.

fields.Evolution: **Walrein** evolves from **Sealeo** starting from level 44, which evolves from **Spheal** starting from level 32.

952_Scovillain.name: Scovillain
952_Scovillain.description: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

fields.Evolution: **Scovillain** evolves from **Capsakid** using a Fire Stone.

953_Rellor.name: Rellor
953_Rellor.description: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.

fields.Evolution: **Rellor** evolves to **Rabsca** somehow.

366_Clamperl.name: Clamperl
366_Clamperl.description: It makes a single pearl during its lifetime. The pearl is said to amplify psychic power.

fields.Evolution: **Clamperl** evolves to **Huntail** when traded while holding a Deep Sea Tooth and evolves to **Gorebyss** when traded while holding a Deep Sea Scale.

954_Rabsca.name: Rabsca
954_Rabsca.description: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.

fields.Evolution: **Rabsca** evolves from **Rellor** somehow.

367_Huntail.name: Huntail
367_Huntail.description: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

fields.Evolution: **Huntail** evolves from **Clamperl** when traded while holding a Deep Sea Tooth.

955_Flittle.name: Flittle
955_Flittle.description: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

fields.Evolution: **Flittle** evolves to **Espathra** starting from level 35.

368_Gorebyss.name: Gorebyss
368_Gorebyss.description: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.

fields.Evolution: **Gorebyss** evolves from **Clamperl** when traded while holding a Deep Sea Scale.

956_Espathra.name: Espathra
956_Espathra.description: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

fields.Evolution: **Espathra** evolves from **Flittle** starting from level 35.

369_Relicanth.name: Relicanth
369_Relicanth.description: This rare Pokémon was discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

957_Tinkatink.name: Tinkatink
957_Tinkatink.description: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it’s satisfied with the result.

fields.Evolution: **Tinkatink** evolves to **Tinkatuff** starting from level 24, which evolves to **Tinkaton** starting from level 38.

370_Luvdisc.name: Luvdisc
370_Luvdisc.description: During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.

371_Bagon.name: Bagon
371_Bagon.description: Its belief that it will be able to fly one day is apparently the influence of information carried in its genes.

fields.Evolution: **Bagon** evolves to **Shelgon** starting from level 30, which evolves to **Salamence** starting from level 50.

958_Tinkatuff.name: Tinkatuff
958_Tinkatuff.description: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other’s hammers by smashing them together.

fields.Evolution: **Tinkatuff** evolves from **Tinkatink** starting from level 24 and evolves to **Tinkaton** starting from level 38.

959_Tinkaton.name: Tinkaton
959_Tinkaton.description: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.

fields.Evolution: **Tinkaton** evolves from **Tinkatuff** starting from level 38, which evolves from **Tinkatink** starting from level 24.

372_Shelgon.name: Shelgon
372_Shelgon.description: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.

fields.Evolution: **Shelgon** evolves from **Bagon** starting from level 30 and evolves to **Salamence** starting from level 50.

960_Wiglett.name: Wiglett
960_Wiglett.description: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.

fields.Evolution: **Wiglett** evolves to **Wugtrio** starting from level 26.

373_Salamence.name: Salamence
373_Salamence.description: It becomes uncontrollable if it is enraged. It destroys everything with shredding claws and fire.

fields.Evolution: **Salamence** evolves from **Shelgon** starting from level 50, which evolves from **Bagon** starting from level 30.

961_Wugtrio.name: Wugtrio
961_Wugtrio.description: A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.

fields.Evolution: **Wugtrio** evolves from **Wiglett** starting from level 26.

373_Mega Salamence.name: Mega Salamence
373_Mega Salamence.description: It puts its forelegs inside its shell to streamline itself for flight. Salamence flies at high speeds over all kinds of topographical features.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Salamence** transforms from **Salamence** when given a Mega Evolution.

962_Bombirdier.name: Bombirdier
962_Bombirdier.description: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.

374_Beldum.name: Beldum
374_Beldum.description: They converse with one another by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

fields.Evolution: **Beldum** evolves to **Metang** starting from level 20, which evolves to **Metagross** starting from level 45.

963_Finizen.name: Finizen
963_Finizen.description: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.

fields.Evolution: **Finizen** evolves to **Palafin** starting from level 38.

375_Metang.name: Metang
375_Metang.description: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.

fields.Evolution: **Metang** evolves from **Beldum** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Metagross** starting from level 45.

964_Palafin.name: Palafin
964_Palafin.description: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.

fields.Evolution: **Palafin** evolves from **Finizen** starting from level 38.

376_Metagross.name: Metagross
376_Metagross.description: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

fields.Evolution: **Metagross** evolves from **Metang** starting from level 45, which evolves from **Beldum** starting from level 20.

964_Hero Palafin.name: Hero Palafin
964_Hero Palafin.description: This hero of the ocean swims at a speed of 50 knots and saves drowning people and Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Hero Palafin** transforms from **Palafin** when given a Transformation.

376_Mega Metagross.name: Mega Metagross
376_Mega Metagross.description: When it knows it can’t win, it digs the claws on its legs into its opponent and starts the countdown to a big explosion.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Metagross** transforms from **Metagross** when given a Mega Evolution.

965_Varoom.name: Varoom
965_Varoom.description: The steel section is Varoom’s actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.

fields.Evolution: **Varoom** evolves to **Revavroom** starting from level 40.

377_Regirock.name: Regirock
377_Regirock.description: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, Regirock attaches rocks to repair itself.

966_Revavroom.name: Revavroom
966_Revavroom.description: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.

fields.Evolution: **Revavroom** evolves from **Varoom** starting from level 40.

378_Regice.name: Regice
378_Regice.description: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of −328 degrees Fahrenheit.

967_Cyclizar.name: Cyclizar
967_Cyclizar.description: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The rider’s body heat warms Cyclizar’s back and lifts the Pokémon’s spirit.

379_Registeel.name: Registeel
379_Registeel.description: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.

fields.Evolution: **Battle Cyclizar** transforms from **Cyclizar** when given a Transformation.

380_Latias.name: Latias
380_Latias.description: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

fields.Evolution: **Ride Cyclizar** transforms from **Cyclizar** when given a Transformation.
**Mega Latias** transforms from **Latias** when given a Mega Evolution.

968_Orthworm.name: Orthworm
968_Orthworm.description: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.

381_Latios.name: Latios
381_Latios.description: It is a highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its forelegs in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

969_Glimmet.name: Glimmet
969_Glimmet.description: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

fields.Evolution: **Glimmet** evolves to **Glimmora** starting from level 35.
**Mega Latios** transforms from **Latios** when given a Mega Evolution.

970_Glimmora.name: Glimmora
970_Glimmora.description: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.

fields.Evolution: **Glimmora** evolves from **Glimmet** starting from level 35.

382_Kyogre.name: Kyogre
382_Kyogre.description: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

971_Greavard.name: Greavard
971_Greavard.description: This friendly Pokémon doesn’t like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.

fields.Evolution: **Greavard** evolves to **Houndstone** starting from level 30 in the nighttime.
**Primal Kyogre** transforms from **Kyogre** when given a Mega Evolution.

ja: ゲンシカイキのすがた

972_Houndstone.name: Houndstone
972_Houndstone.description: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn’t like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.

fields.Evolution: **Houndstone** evolves from **Greavard** starting from level 30 in the nighttime.

383_Groudon.name: Groudon
383_Groudon.description: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.

973_Flamigo.name: Flamigo
973_Flamigo.description: Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as “synchronizing,” an entire flock of these Pokémon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.

fields.Evolution: **Primal Groudon** transforms from **Groudon** when given a Mega Evolution.

ja: ゲンシカイキのすがた

974_Cetoddle.name: Cetoddle
974_Cetoddle.description: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

fields.Evolution: **Cetoddle** evolves to **Cetitan** using a Ice Stone.

384_Rayquaza.name: Rayquaza
384_Rayquaza.description: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

975_Cetitan.name: Cetitan
975_Cetitan.description: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

fields.Evolution: **Cetitan** evolves from **Cetoddle** using a Ice Stone.
**Mega Rayquaza** transforms from **Rayquaza** when given a Mega Evolution.

976_Veluza.name: Veluza
976_Veluza.description: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.

385_Jirachi.name: Jirachi
385_Jirachi.description: It is said to wake up for just seven days every 1,000 years and use its power to grant any wish.

977_Dondozo.name: Dondozo
977_Dondozo.description: It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.

386_Deoxys.name: Deoxys
386_Deoxys.description: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteorite underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

978_Tatsugiri.name: Tatsugiri
978_Tatsugiri.description: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.

978_Droopy Tatsugiri.name: Droopy Tatsugiri
978_Droopy Tatsugiri.description: This Pokémon tricks its opponents by playing dead. It is small and weak, but it uses its smarts to survive.

ja: ディフェンスフォルム

978_Stretchy Tatsugiri.name: Stretchy Tatsugiri
978_Stretchy Tatsugiri.description: It’s one of the most intelligent dragon Pokémon. It camouflages itself by inflating its throat sac.

979_Annihilape.name: Annihilape
979_Annihilape.description: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.

fields.Evolution: **Annihilape** evolves from **Primeape** somehow, which evolves from **Mankey** starting from level 28.

387_Turtwig.name: Turtwig
387_Turtwig.description: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.

fields.Evolution: **Turtwig** evolves to **Grotle** starting from level 18, which evolves to **Torterra** starting from level 32.

980_Clodsire.name: Clodsire
980_Clodsire.description: It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.

fields.Evolution: **Clodsire** evolves from **Paldean Wooper** starting from level 20.

388_Grotle.name: Grotle
388_Grotle.description: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.

fields.Evolution: **Grotle** evolves from **Turtwig** starting from level 18 and evolves to **Torterra** starting from level 32.

981_Farigiraf.name: Farigiraf
981_Farigiraf.description: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.

fields.Evolution: **Farigiraf** evolves from **Girafarig** starting from level 32.

389_Torterra.name: Torterra
389_Torterra.description: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.

fields.Evolution: **Torterra** evolves from **Grotle** starting from level 32, which evolves from **Turtwig** starting from level 18.

982_Dudunsparce.name: Dudunsparce
982_Dudunsparce.description: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.

fields.Evolution: **Dudunsparce** evolves from **Dunsparce** starting from level 32.

390_Chimchar.name: Chimchar
390_Chimchar.description: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name “Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.

fields.Evolution: **Chimchar** evolves to **Monferno** starting from level 14, which evolves to **Infernape** starting from level 36.

982_Three-Segment Dudunsparce.name: Three-Segment Dudunsparce
982_Three-Segment Dudunsparce.description: A recent study uncovered that the number of segments a Dudunsparce’s body has is determined by the Pokémon’s genes.

fields.Evolution: **Three-Segment Dudunsparce** evolves from **Dunsparce** starting from level 32.

391_Monferno.name: Monferno
391_Monferno.description: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.

fields.Evolution: **Monferno** evolves from **Chimchar** starting from level 14 and evolves to **Infernape** starting from level 36.

983_Kingambit.name: Kingambit
983_Kingambit.description: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it’s not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.

fields.Evolution: **Kingambit** evolves from **Bisharp** when leveled up while holding a Leader's Crest, which evolves from **Pawniard** starting from level 52.

392_Infernape.name: Infernape
392_Infernape.description: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.

fields.Evolution: **Infernape** evolves from **Monferno** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Chimchar** starting from level 14.

984_Great Tusk.name: Great Tusk
984_Great Tusk.description: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.

393_Piplup.name: Piplup
393_Piplup.description: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It’s an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it’s also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.

fields.Evolution: **Piplup** evolves to **Prinplup** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Empoleon** starting from level 36.

985_Scream Tail.name: Scream Tail
985_Scream Tail.description: It resembles a mysterious Pokémon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.

394_Prinplup.name: Prinplup
394_Prinplup.description: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.

fields.Evolution: **Prinplup** evolves from **Piplup** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Empoleon** starting from level 36.

986_Brute Bonnet.name: Brute Bonnet
986_Brute Bonnet.description: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.

395_Empoleon.name: Empoleon
395_Empoleon.description: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.

fields.Evolution: **Empoleon** evolves from **Prinplup** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Piplup** starting from level 16.

987_Flutter Mane.name: Flutter Mane
987_Flutter Mane.description: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.

396_Starly.name: Starly
396_Starly.description: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

fields.Evolution: **Starly** evolves to **Staravia** starting from level 14, which evolves to **Staraptor** starting from level 34.

988_Slither Wing.name: Slither Wing
988_Slither Wing.description: This Pokémon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.

397_Staravia.name: Staravia
397_Staravia.description: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

fields.Evolution: **Staravia** evolves from **Starly** starting from level 14 and evolves to **Staraptor** starting from level 34.

989_Sandy Shocks.name: Sandy Shocks
989_Sandy Shocks.description: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.

398_Staraptor.name: Staraptor
398_Staraptor.description: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

fields.Evolution: **Staraptor** evolves from **Staravia** starting from level 34, which evolves from **Starly** starting from level 14.

990_Iron Treads.name: Iron Treads
990_Iron Treads.description: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.

399_Bidoof.name: Bidoof
399_Bidoof.description: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.

fields.Evolution: **Bidoof** evolves to **Bibarel** starting from level 15.

991_Iron Bundle.name: Iron Bundle
991_Iron Bundle.description: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.

400_Bibarel.name: Bibarel
400_Bibarel.description: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.

fields.Evolution: **Bibarel** evolves from **Bidoof** starting from level 15.

992_Iron Hands.name: Iron Hands
992_Iron Hands.description: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.

401_Kricketot.name: Kricketot
401_Kricketot.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

fields.Evolution: **Kricketot** evolves to **Kricketune** starting from level 10.

993_Iron Jugulis.name: Iron Jugulis
993_Iron Jugulis.description: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.

402_Kricketune.name: Kricketune
402_Kricketune.description: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Kricketune** evolves from **Kricketot** starting from level 10.

994_Iron Moth.name: Iron Moth
994_Iron Moth.description: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.

403_Shinx.name: Shinx
403_Shinx.description: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it’s in trouble.

fields.Evolution: **Shinx** evolves to **Luxio** starting from level 15, which evolves to **Luxray** starting from level 30.

995_Iron Thorns.name: Iron Thorns
995_Iron Thorns.description: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.

404_Luxio.name: Luxio
404_Luxio.description: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.

fields.Evolution: **Luxio** evolves from **Shinx** starting from level 15 and evolves to **Luxray** starting from level 30.

996_Frigibax.name: Frigibax
996_Frigibax.description: This Pokémon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.

fields.Evolution: **Frigibax** evolves to **Arctibax** starting from level 35, which evolves to **Baxcalibur** starting from level 54.

405_Luxray.name: Luxray
405_Luxray.description: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.

fields.Evolution: **Luxray** evolves from **Luxio** starting from level 30, which evolves from **Shinx** starting from level 15.

997_Arctibax.name: Arctibax
997_Arctibax.description: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibax’s strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.

fields.Evolution: **Arctibax** evolves from **Frigibax** starting from level 35 and evolves to **Baxcalibur** starting from level 54.

406_Budew.name: Budew
406_Budew.description: When the sun’s light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon’s head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.

fields.Evolution: **Budew** evolves to **Roselia** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime, which evolves to **Roserade** using a Shiny Stone.

998_Baxcalibur.name: Baxcalibur
998_Baxcalibur.description: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.

fields.Evolution: **Baxcalibur** evolves from **Arctibax** starting from level 54, which evolves from **Frigibax** starting from level 35.

407_Roserade.name: Roserade
407_Roserade.description: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.

fields.Evolution: **Roserade** evolves from **Roselia** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **Budew** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime.

999_Gimmighoul.name: Gimmighoul
999_Gimmighoul.description: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Gimmighoul** evolves to **Gholdengo** when leveled up while holding a Gimmighoul Coin.

408_Cranidos.name: Cranidos
408_Cranidos.description: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.

fields.Evolution: **Cranidos** evolves to **Rampardos** starting from level 30.

999_Roaming Gimmighoul.name: Roaming Gimmighoul
999_Roaming Gimmighoul.description: It wanders around, carrying an old coin on its back. It survives by draining the life-force from humans who try to pick up its coin.

fields.Evolution: **Roaming Gimmighoul** transforms from **Gimmighoul** when given a Transformation and evolves to **Gholdengo** when leveled up while holding a Gimmighoul Coin.

409_Rampardos.name: Rampardos
409_Rampardos.description: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

fields.Evolution: **Rampardos** evolves from **Cranidos** starting from level 30.

1000_Gholdengo.name: Gholdengo
1000_Gholdengo.description: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.

fields.Evolution: **Gholdengo** evolves from **Gimmighoul** when leveled up while holding a Gimmighoul Coin.

410_Shieldon.name: Shieldon
410_Shieldon.description: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.

fields.Evolution: **Shieldon** evolves to **Bastiodon** starting from level 30.

1001_Wo-Chien.name: Wo-Chien
1001_Wo-Chien.description: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

411_Bastiodon.name: Bastiodon
411_Bastiodon.description: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.

fields.Evolution: **Bastiodon** evolves from **Shieldon** starting from level 30.

1002_Chien-Pao.name: Chien-Pao
1002_Chien-Pao.description: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

1003_Ting-Lu.name: Ting-Lu
1003_Ting-Lu.description: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.

412_Burmy.name: Burmy
412_Burmy.description: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.

fields.Evolution: **Burmy** evolves to **Wormadam** starting from level 20 as Female and evolves to **Mothim** starting from level 20 as Male.

412_Sandy Burmy.name: Sandy Burmy
412_Sandy Burmy.description: It creates a cloak by weaving together sand, mud, and silk it has spat out. This earthen cloak is ruined by wind and rain, so the Pokémon hides away in caves and other such places.

fields.Evolution: **Sandy Burmy** evolves to **Sandy Wormadam** starting from level 20 as Female and evolves to **Mothim** starting from level 20 as Male.

1004_Chi-Yu.name: Chi-Yu
1004_Chi-Yu.description: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.

1005_Roaring Moon.name: Roaring Moon
1005_Roaring Moon.description: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.

412_Trash Burmy.name: Trash Burmy
412_Trash Burmy.description: When confronted by a lack of other materials, Burmy will create its cloak using dust and refuse. The cloak seems to be more comfortable than one would think.

fields.Evolution: **Trash Burmy** evolves to **Trash Wormadam** starting from level 20 as Female and evolves to **Mothim** starting from level 20 as Male.

413_Wormadam.name: Wormadam
413_Wormadam.description: The cloak—fashioned from plant matter—has merged with the Pokémon and is now part of the body, like fur or skin. I suspect this fusion is an effect of the energy involved in evolution.

fields.Evolution: **Wormadam** evolves from **Burmy** starting from level 20 as Female.

1006_Iron Valiant.name: Iron Valiant
1006_Iron Valiant.description: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.

1007_Koraidon.name: Koraidon
1007_Koraidon.description: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.

413_Sandy Wormadam.name: Sandy Wormadam
413_Sandy Wormadam.description: Its earthen skin is reasonably hard—it has no problem repelling a Starly’s pecking, at least.

fields.Evolution: **Sandy Wormadam** evolves from **Sandy Burmy** starting from level 20 as Female.
**Sprinting Build Koraidon** transforms from **Koraidon** when given a Transformation.

413_Trash Wormadam.name: Trash Wormadam
413_Trash Wormadam.description: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokémon to evade the detection of predators.

fields.Evolution: **Trash Wormadam** evolves from **Trash Burmy** starting from level 20 as Female.
**Gliding Build Koraidon** transforms from **Koraidon** when given a Transformation.

414_Mothim.name: Mothim
414_Mothim.description: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.

fields.Evolution: **Mothim** evolves from **Burmy** starting from level 20 as Male.

1008_Miraidon.name: Miraidon
1008_Miraidon.description: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.

415_Combee.name: Combee
415_Combee.description: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers nectar from flowers to please Vespiquen.

fields.Evolution: **Combee** evolves to **Vespiquen** starting from level 21 as Female.
**Drive Mode Miraidon** transforms from **Miraidon** when given a Transformation.

416_Vespiquen.name: Vespiquen
416_Vespiquen.description: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.

fields.Evolution: **Vespiquen** evolves from **Combee** starting from level 21 as Female.
**Glide Mode Miraidon** transforms from **Miraidon** when given a Transformation.

417_Pachirisu.name: Pachirisu
417_Pachirisu.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

1009_Walking Wake.name: Walking Wake
1009_Walking Wake.description: It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.

418_Buizel.name: Buizel
418_Buizel.description: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

fields.Evolution: **Buizel** evolves to **Floatzel** starting from level 26.

1010_Iron Leaves.name: Iron Leaves
1010_Iron Leaves.description: According to the few eyewitness accounts that exist, it used its shining blades to julienne large trees and boulders.

419_Floatzel.name: Floatzel
419_Floatzel.description: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and help fishers carry what they caught.

fields.Evolution: **Floatzel** evolves from **Buizel** starting from level 26.

1011_Dipplin.name: Dipplin
1011_Dipplin.description: The head and tail appear to belong to two separate creatures; both help each other out from within their shared apple. Dipplin coat their apples with syrup produced within their bodies. The layers of fragrant syrup beguile opponents.​

fields.Evolution: **Dipplin** evolves from **Applin** using a Syrupy Apple and evolves to **Hydrapple** when leveled up.

420_Cherubi.name: Cherubi
420_Cherubi.description: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.

fields.Evolution: **Cherubi** evolves to **Cherrim** starting from level 25 in the nighttime and evolves to **Sunshine Cherrim** starting from level 25 in the daytime.

1012_Poltchageist.name: Poltchageist
1012_Poltchageist.description: Poltchageist has a swirl pattern not unlike Sinistea's - but unlike Sinistea, its swirl is not a weakness. After a target is sprinkled with some of Poltchageist's powdery body or eats food dusted with it, Poltchageist drains their life-force and absorbs it as energy.​

fields.Evolution: **Poltchageist** evolves to **Sinistcha** using a Unremarkable Teacup.

421_Cherrim.name: Cherrim
421_Cherrim.description: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim’s folded petals.

fields.Evolution: **Cherrim** evolves from **Cherubi** starting from level 25 in the nighttime.

1013_Sinistcha.name: Sinistcha
1013_Sinistcha.description: It prefers cool, dark places, such as the back of a shelf or the space beneath a home's floorboards. It wanders in search of prey after sunset.

fields.Evolution: **Sinistcha** evolves from **Poltchageist** using a Unremarkable Teacup.

421_Sunshine Cherrim.name: Sunshine Cherrim
421_Sunshine Cherrim.description: Cheerfully active on sunny days. Immediately closes its petals and becomes immobile once the sun becomes hidden, however.

fields.Evolution: **Sunshine Cherrim** evolves from **Cherubi** starting from level 25 in the daytime.

1014_Okidogi.name: Okidogi
1014_Okidogi.description: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.

422_Shellos.name: Shellos
422_Shellos.description: It oozes a purple fluid to deter enemies. Apparently, there are more West Sea Shellos now than there were in the past.

fields.Evolution: **Shellos** evolves to **Gastrodon** starting from level 30.

1015_Munkidori.name: Munkidori
1015_Munkidori.description: Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.

422_East Sea Shellos.name: East Sea Shellos
422_East Sea Shellos.description: This Pokémon can often be seen along seashores. It's capable of spending a limited amount of time on land.

fields.Evolution: **East Sea Shellos** evolves to **East Sea Gastrodon** starting from level 30.

1016_Fezandipiti.name: Fezandipiti
1016_Fezandipiti.description: Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokémon.

423_Gastrodon.name: Gastrodon
423_Gastrodon.description: It appears on beaches where the waters are shallow. Once it catches prey, it will slowly melt them with its mucus before slurping them up.

fields.Evolution: **Gastrodon** evolves from **Shellos** starting from level 30.

1017_Ogerpon.name: Ogerpon
1017_Ogerpon.description: This mischief-loving Pokémon is full of curiosity. It battles by drawing out the type-based energy contained within its masks.

423_East Sea Gastrodon.name: East Sea Gastrodon
423_East Sea Gastrodon.description: Fishers say that they didn't see many of these Pokémon in the past, but this form of Gastrodon is now increasing in number.

fields.Evolution: **East Sea Gastrodon** evolves from **East Sea Shellos** starting from level 30.

1017_Wellspring Mask Ogerpon.name: Wellspring Mask Ogerpon
1017_Wellspring Mask Ogerpon.description: In this form, it draws on the power of water. It attacks unrelentingly with kicks and ivy strikes.

fields.Evolution: **Wellspring Mask Ogerpon** transforms from **Ogerpon** when given a Wellspring Mask.

424_Ambipom.name: Ambipom
424_Ambipom.description: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.

fields.Evolution: **Ambipom** evolves from **Aipom** when leveled up while knowing Double Hit.

1017_Hearthflame Mask Ogerpon.name: Hearthflame Mask Ogerpon
1017_Hearthflame Mask Ogerpon.description: In this form, it draws on the power of fire. It spears its enemies with thorn-covered ivy.

fields.Evolution: **Hearthflame Mask Ogerpon** transforms from **Ogerpon** when given a Hearthflame Mask.

425_Drifloon.name: Drifloon
425_Drifloon.description: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “signpost for wandering spirits.”

fields.Evolution: **Drifloon** evolves to **Drifblim** starting from level 28.

1017_Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon.name: Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon
1017_Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon.description: In this form, it draws on the power of stone. Its body is rock-solid, protecting it from all manner of attacks.

fields.Evolution: **Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon** transforms from **Ogerpon** when given a Cornerstone Mask.

426_Drifblim.name: Drifblim
426_Drifblim.description: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can’t be a fixed destination.

fields.Evolution: **Drifblim** evolves from **Drifloon** starting from level 28.

1018_Archaludon.name: Archaludon
1018_Archaludon.description: It digs holes on mountains, searching for food. It’s so durable that being caught in a cave-in won’t faze it.

fields.Evolution: **Archaludon** evolves from **Duraludon** using a Metal Alloy.

427_Buneary.name: Buneary
427_Buneary.description: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.

fields.Evolution: **Buneary** evolves to **Lopunny** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

1019_Hydrapple.name: Hydrapple
1019_Hydrapple.description: These capricious syrpents have banded together. On the rare occasion that their moods align, their true power is unleashed.

fields.Evolution: **Hydrapple** evolves from **Dipplin** when leveled up, which evolves from **Applin** using a Syrupy Apple.

428_Lopunny.name: Lopunny
428_Lopunny.description: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.

fields.Evolution: **Lopunny** evolves from **Buneary** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

1020_Gouging Fire.name: Gouging Fire
1020_Gouging Fire.description: It resembles an eerie Pokémon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokémon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.

1021_Raging Bolt.name: Raging Bolt
1021_Raging Bolt.description: It bears resemblance to a Pokémon that became a hot topic for a short while after a paranormal magazine touted it as Raikou's ancestor.

428_Mega Lopunny.name: Mega Lopunny
428_Mega Lopunny.description: Mega Evolution awakens its combative instincts. It has shed any fur that got in the way of its attacks.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Lopunny** transforms from **Lopunny** when given a Mega Evolution.

429_Mismagius.name: Mismagius
429_Mismagius.description: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

fields.Evolution: **Mismagius** evolves from **Misdreavus** using a Dusk Stone.

1022_Iron Boulder.name: Iron Boulder
1022_Iron Boulder.description: It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.

1023_Iron Crown.name: Iron Crown
1023_Iron Crown.description: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.

430_Honchkrow.name: Honchkrow
430_Honchkrow.description: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.

fields.Evolution: **Honchkrow** evolves from **Murkrow** using a Dusk Stone.

431_Glameow.name: Glameow
431_Glameow.description: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.

fields.Evolution: **Glameow** evolves to **Purugly** starting from level 38.

1024_Terapagos.name: Terapagos
1024_Terapagos.description: It’s thought that this Pokémon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.

1024_Terastal Terapagos.name: Terastal Terapagos
1024_Terastal Terapagos.description: The shell is made of crystallized Terastal energy. When struck by a move, this shell absorbs the move’s energy and transfers it to Terapagos.

fields.Evolution: **Terastal Terapagos** transforms from **Terapagos** when given a Transformation.

432_Purugly.name: Purugly
432_Purugly.description: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.

fields.Evolution: **Purugly** evolves from **Glameow** starting from level 38.

1025_Pecharunt.name: Pecharunt
1025_Pecharunt.description: Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokémon.

433_Chingling.name: Chingling
433_Chingling.description: This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.

fields.Evolution: **Chingling** evolves to **Chimecho** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the nighttime.

434_Stunky.name: Stunky
434_Stunky.description: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.

fields.Evolution: **Stunky** evolves to **Skuntank** starting from level 34.

435_Skuntank.name: Skuntank
435_Skuntank.description: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.

fields.Evolution: **Skuntank** evolves from **Stunky** starting from level 34.

436_Bronzor.name: Bronzor
436_Bronzor.description: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.

fields.Evolution: **Bronzor** evolves to **Bronzong** starting from level 33.

437_Bronzong.name: Bronzong
437_Bronzong.description: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

fields.Evolution: **Bronzong** evolves from **Bronzor** starting from level 33.

438_Bonsly.name: Bonsly
438_Bonsly.description: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.

fields.Evolution: **Bonsly** evolves to **Sudowoodo** when leveled up while knowing Mimic.

439_Mime Jr..name: Mime Jr.
439_Mime Jr..description: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.

fields.Evolution: **Mime Jr.** evolves to **Mr. Mime** when leveled up while knowing Mimic.

440_Happiny.name: Happiny
440_Happiny.description: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered by how curly its hair looks.

fields.Evolution: **Happiny** evolves to **Chansey** when leveled up while holding a Oval Stone in the daytime, which evolves to **Blissey** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

441_Chatot.name: Chatot
441_Chatot.description: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.

442_Spiritomb.name: Spiritomb
442_Spiritomb.description: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.

443_Gible.name: Gible
443_Gible.description: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

fields.Evolution: **Gible** evolves to **Gabite** starting from level 24, which evolves to **Garchomp** starting from level 48.

444_Gabite.name: Gabite
444_Gabite.description: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

fields.Evolution: **Gabite** evolves from **Gible** starting from level 24 and evolves to **Garchomp** starting from level 48.

445_Garchomp.name: Garchomp
445_Garchomp.description: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

fields.Evolution: **Garchomp** evolves from **Gabite** starting from level 48, which evolves from **Gible** starting from level 24.

445_Mega Garchomp.name: Mega Garchomp
445_Mega Garchomp.description: Its disposition is more vicious than before its Mega Evolution. Garchomp carves its opponents up with the scythes on both arms.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Garchomp** transforms from **Garchomp** when given a Mega Evolution.

446_Munchlax.name: Munchlax
446_Munchlax.description: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.

fields.Evolution: **Munchlax** evolves to **Snorlax** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

447_Riolu.name: Riolu
447_Riolu.description: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions, such as joy and rage, in the form of waves.

fields.Evolution: **Riolu** evolves to **Lucario** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime.

448_Lucario.name: Lucario
448_Lucario.description: A well-trained one can use its aura to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

fields.Evolution: **Lucario** evolves from **Riolu** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet in the daytime.

448_Mega Lucario.name: Mega Lucario
448_Mega Lucario.description: Bathed in explosive energy, its combative instincts have awakened. For its enemies, it has no mercy whatsoever.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Lucario** transforms from **Lucario** when given a Mega Evolution.

449_Hippopotas.name: Hippopotas
449_Hippopotas.description: It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.

fields.Evolution: **Hippopotas** evolves to **Hippowdon** starting from level 34.

450_Hippowdon.name: Hippowdon
450_Hippowdon.description: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.

fields.Evolution: **Hippowdon** evolves from **Hippopotas** starting from level 34.

451_Skorupi.name: Skorupi
451_Skorupi.description: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.

fields.Evolution: **Skorupi** evolves to **Drapion** starting from level 40.

452_Drapion.name: Drapion
452_Drapion.description: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.

fields.Evolution: **Drapion** evolves from **Skorupi** starting from level 40.

453_Croagunk.name: Croagunk
453_Croagunk.description: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.

fields.Evolution: **Croagunk** evolves to **Toxicroak** starting from level 37.

454_Toxicroak.name: Toxicroak
454_Toxicroak.description: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

fields.Evolution: **Toxicroak** evolves from **Croagunk** starting from level 37.

455_Carnivine.name: Carnivine
455_Carnivine.description: Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.

456_Finneon.name: Finneon
456_Finneon.description: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.

fields.Evolution: **Finneon** evolves to **Lumineon** starting from level 31.

457_Lumineon.name: Lumineon
457_Lumineon.description: Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.

fields.Evolution: **Lumineon** evolves from **Finneon** starting from level 31.

458_Mantyke.name: Mantyke
458_Mantyke.description: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.

fields.Evolution: **Mantyke** evolves to **Mantine** when leveled up.

459_Snover.name: Snover
459_Snover.description: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

fields.Evolution: **Snover** evolves to **Abomasnow** starting from level 40.

460_Abomasnow.name: Abomasnow
460_Abomasnow.description: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

fields.Evolution: **Abomasnow** evolves from **Snover** starting from level 40.
**Mega Abomasnow** transforms from **Abomasnow** when given a Mega Evolution.

461_Weavile.name: Weavile
461_Weavile.description: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

fields.Evolution: **Weavile** evolves from **Sneasel** when leveled up while holding a Razor Claw in the nighttime.

462_Magnezone.name: Magnezone
462_Magnezone.description: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed Magneton’s molecular structure, turning it into Magnezone.

fields.Evolution: **Magnezone** evolves from **Magneton** using a Thunder Stone, which evolves from **Magnemite** starting from level 30.

463_Lickilicky.name: Lickilicky
463_Lickilicky.description: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky’s height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.

fields.Evolution: **Lickilicky** evolves from **Lickitung** when leveled up while knowing Rollout.

464_Rhyperior.name: Rhyperior
464_Rhyperior.description: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

fields.Evolution: **Rhyperior** evolves from **Rhydon** when traded while holding a Protector, which evolves from **Rhyhorn** starting from level 42.

465_Tangrowth.name: Tangrowth
465_Tangrowth.description: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.

fields.Evolution: **Tangrowth** evolves from **Tangela** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power.

466_Electivire.name: Electivire
466_Electivire.description: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.

fields.Evolution: **Electivire** evolves from **Electabuzz** when traded while holding a Electirizer, which evolves from **Elekid** starting from level 30.

467_Magmortar.name: Magmortar
467_Magmortar.description: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.

fields.Evolution: **Magmortar** evolves from **Magmar** when traded while holding a Magmarizer, which evolves from **Magby** starting from level 30.

468_Togekiss.name: Togekiss
468_Togekiss.description: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.

fields.Evolution: **Togekiss** evolves from **Togetic** using a Shiny Stone, which evolves from **Togepi** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

469_Yanmega.name: Yanmega
469_Yanmega.description: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey’s most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.

fields.Evolution: **Yanmega** evolves from **Yanma** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power.

470_Leafeon.name: Leafeon
470_Leafeon.description: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.

fields.Evolution: **Leafeon** evolves from **Eevee** using a Leaf Stone.

471_Glaceon.name: Glaceon
471_Glaceon.description: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

fields.Evolution: **Glaceon** evolves from **Eevee** using a Ice Stone.

472_Gliscor.name: Gliscor
472_Gliscor.description: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.

fields.Evolution: **Gliscor** evolves from **Gligar** when leveled up while holding a Razor Fang in the nighttime.

473_Mamoswine.name: Mamoswine
473_Mamoswine.description: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui’s frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine’s constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

fields.Evolution: **Mamoswine** evolves from **Piloswine** when leveled up while knowing Ancient Power, which evolves from **Swinub** starting from level 33.

474_Porygon-Z.name: Porygon-Z
474_Porygon-Z.description: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon’s offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.

fields.Evolution: **Porygon-Z** evolves from **Porygon2** when traded while holding a Dubious Disc, which evolves from **Porygon** when traded while holding a Upgrade.

475_Gallade.name: Gallade
475_Gallade.description: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

fields.Evolution: **Gallade** evolves from **Kirlia** using a Dawn Stone, which evolves from **Ralts** starting from level 20.
**Mega Gallade** transforms from **Gallade** when given a Mega Evolution.

476_Probopass.name: Probopass
476_Probopass.description: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

fields.Evolution: **Probopass** evolves from **Nosepass** using a Thunder Stone.

477_Dusknoir.name: Dusknoir
477_Dusknoir.description: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.

fields.Evolution: **Dusknoir** evolves from **Dusclops** when traded while holding a Reaper Cloth, which evolves from **Duskull** starting from level 37.

478_Froslass.name: Froslass
478_Froslass.description: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

fields.Evolution: **Froslass** evolves from **Snorunt** using a Dawn Stone.

479_Rotom.name: Rotom
479_Rotom.description: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

479_Heat Rotom.name: Heat Rotom
479_Heat Rotom.description: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven. It will sear the surrounding area with its burning heat, then smile in delight.

fields.Evolution: **Heat Rotom** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Wash Rotom.name: Wash Rotom
479_Wash Rotom.description: The model of washing machine that Rotom can inspirit has been discontinued, so these appliances are now traded at high prices.

fields.Evolution: **Wash Rotom** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Frost Rotom.name: Frost Rotom
479_Frost Rotom.description: The special motor within the refrigerator is the key to bringing about Rotom’s change in form.

fields.Evolution: **Frost Rotom** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Fan Rotom.name: Fan Rotom
