479_Fan Rotom.description: There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.

fields.Evolution: **Fan Rotom** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Mow Rotom.name: Mow Rotom
479_Mow Rotom.description: This Rotom has possessed a lawn mower. It will mow down grass and flowers, then swagger around with pride at its accomplishments.

fields.Evolution: **Mow Rotom** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Rotom Pokédex.name: Rotom Pokédex
479_Rotom Pokédex.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

fields.Evolution: **Rotom Pokédex** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Rotom Phone.name: Rotom Phone
479_Rotom Phone.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

fields.Evolution: **Rotom Phone** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

479_Rotom Drone.name: Rotom Drone
479_Rotom Drone.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

fields.Evolution: **Rotom Drone** transforms from **Rotom** when given a Rotom Catalog.

480_Uxie.name: Uxie
480_Uxie.description: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.

481_Mesprit.name: Mesprit
481_Mesprit.description: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.

482_Azelf.name: Azelf
482_Azelf.description: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.

483_Dialga.name: Dialga
483_Dialga.description: This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.

483_Origin Dialga.name: Origin Dialga
483_Origin Dialga.description: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.

fields.Evolution: **Origin Dialga** transforms from **Dialga** when given a Adamant Crystal.

484_Palkia.name: Palkia
484_Palkia.description: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.

484_Origin Palkia.name: Origin Palkia
484_Origin Palkia.description: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia’s strategy for gaining Arceus’s powers.

fields.Evolution: **Origin Palkia** transforms from **Palkia** when given a Lustrous Globe.

485_Heatran.name: Heatran
485_Heatran.description: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.

486_Regigigas.name: Regigigas
486_Regigigas.description: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.

487_Giratina.name: Giratina
487_Giratina.description: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.

487_Origin Giratina.name: Origin Giratina
487_Origin Giratina.description: Giratina loses its legs upon changing into this form. I believe this Pokémon must hail from a world where the heavens and the earth are as one, though I have no way of proving it.

fields.Evolution: **Origin Giratina** transforms from **Giratina** when given a Griseous Orb.

488_Cresselia.name: Cresselia
488_Cresselia.description: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.

489_Phione.name: Phione
489_Phione.description: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.

490_Manaphy.name: Manaphy
490_Manaphy.description: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui’s coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.

491_Darkrai.name: Darkrai
491_Darkrai.description: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village’s inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.

492_Shaymin.name: Shaymin
492_Shaymin.description: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.

492_Sky Shaymin.name: Sky Shaymin
492_Sky Shaymin.description: Upon taking in the scent of a particular rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light, and its tiny body transforms. I took a whiff of the flower myself, but alas, my body remained unchanged.

fields.Evolution: **Sky Shaymin** transforms from **Shaymin** when given a Gracidea.

493_Arceus.name: Arceus
493_Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

493_Bug Arceus.name: Bug Arceus
493_Bug Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Bug Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Dark Arceus.name: Dark Arceus
493_Dark Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Dark Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Dragon Arceus.name: Dragon Arceus
493_Dragon Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Dragon Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Electric Arceus.name: Electric Arceus
493_Electric Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Electric Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Fighting Arceus.name: Fighting Arceus
493_Fighting Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Fighting Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Fire Arceus.name: Fire Arceus
493_Fire Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Fire Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Flying Arceus.name: Flying Arceus
493_Flying Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Flying Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Ghost Arceus.name: Ghost Arceus
493_Ghost Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Ghost Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Grass Arceus.name: Grass Arceus
493_Grass Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Grass Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Ground Arceus.name: Ground Arceus
493_Ground Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Ground Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Ice Arceus.name: Ice Arceus
493_Ice Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Ice Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Poison Arceus.name: Poison Arceus
493_Poison Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Poison Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Psychic Arceus.name: Psychic Arceus
493_Psychic Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Psychic Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Rock Arceus.name: Rock Arceus
493_Rock Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Rock Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Steel Arceus.name: Steel Arceus
493_Steel Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Steel Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Water Arceus.name: Water Arceus
493_Water Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Water Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

493_Fairy Arceus.name: Fairy Arceus
493_Fairy Arceus.description: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

fields.Evolution: **Fairy Arceus** transforms from **Arceus** when given a Plate.

494_Victini.name: Victini
494_Victini.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

495_Snivy.name: Snivy
495_Snivy.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

fields.Evolution: **Snivy** evolves to **Servine** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Serperior** starting from level 36.

496_Servine.name: Servine
496_Servine.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

fields.Evolution: **Servine** evolves from **Snivy** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Serperior** starting from level 36.

497_Serperior.name: Serperior
497_Serperior.description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

fields.Evolution: **Serperior** evolves from **Servine** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Snivy** starting from level 17.

498_Tepig.name: Tepig
498_Tepig.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

fields.Evolution: **Tepig** evolves to **Pignite** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Emboar** starting from level 36.

499_Pignite.name: Pignite
499_Pignite.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

fields.Evolution: **Pignite** evolves from **Tepig** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Emboar** starting from level 36.

500_Emboar.name: Emboar
500_Emboar.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

fields.Evolution: **Emboar** evolves from **Pignite** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Tepig** starting from level 17.

501_Oshawott.name: Oshawott
501_Oshawott.description: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I’ve conferred upon this shell the name “scalchop.”

fields.Evolution: **Oshawott** evolves to **Dewott** starting from level 17, which evolves to **Samurott** starting from level 36.

502_Dewott.name: Dewott
502_Dewott.description: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.

fields.Evolution: **Dewott** evolves from **Oshawott** starting from level 17 and evolves to **Samurott** starting from level 36.

503_Samurott.name: Samurott
503_Samurott.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

fields.Evolution: **Samurott** evolves from **Dewott** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Oshawott** starting from level 17.

503_Hisuian Samurott.name: Hisuian Samurott
503_Hisuian Samurott.description: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

504_Patrat.name: Patrat
504_Patrat.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

fields.Evolution: **Patrat** evolves to **Watchog** starting from level 20.

505_Watchog.name: Watchog
505_Watchog.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

fields.Evolution: **Watchog** evolves from **Patrat** starting from level 20.

506_Lillipup.name: Lillipup
506_Lillipup.description: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

fields.Evolution: **Lillipup** evolves to **Herdier** starting from level 16, which evolves to **Stoutland** starting from level 32.

507_Herdier.name: Herdier
507_Herdier.description: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

fields.Evolution: **Herdier** evolves from **Lillipup** starting from level 16 and evolves to **Stoutland** starting from level 32.

508_Stoutland.name: Stoutland
508_Stoutland.description: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.

fields.Evolution: **Stoutland** evolves from **Herdier** starting from level 32, which evolves from **Lillipup** starting from level 16.

509_Purrloin.name: Purrloin
509_Purrloin.description: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

fields.Evolution: **Purrloin** evolves to **Liepard** starting from level 20.

510_Liepard.name: Liepard
510_Liepard.description: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.

fields.Evolution: **Liepard** evolves from **Purrloin** starting from level 20.

511_Pansage.name: Pansage
511_Pansage.description: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

fields.Evolution: **Pansage** evolves to **Simisage** using a Leaf Stone.

512_Simisage.name: Simisage
512_Simisage.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

fields.Evolution: **Simisage** evolves from **Pansage** using a Leaf Stone.

719_Spring Blooming Diancie.name: Spring Blooming Diancie
719_Spring Blooming Diancie.description: It can instantly create many flowers by shaking its head to throw out seeds from the big flower on its head.

513_Pansear.name: Pansear
513_Pansear.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

fields.Evolution: **Pansear** evolves to **Simisear** using a Fire Stone.

514_Simisear.name: Simisear
514_Simisear.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

fields.Evolution: **Simisear** evolves from **Pansear** using a Fire Stone.

795_Flower Pheromosa.name: Flower Pheromosa
795_Flower Pheromosa.description: Although it's alien to this world, It's enjoying the sunny fashion for this Spring.

515_Panpour.name: Panpour
515_Panpour.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

fields.Evolution: **Panpour** evolves to **Simipour** using a Water Stone.

516_Simipour.name: Simipour
516_Simipour.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

fields.Evolution: **Simipour** evolves from **Panpour** using a Water Stone.

517_Munna.name: Munna
517_Munna.description: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.

fields.Evolution: **Munna** evolves to **Musharna** using a Moon Stone.

518_Musharna.name: Musharna
518_Musharna.description: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

fields.Evolution: **Musharna** evolves from **Munna** using a Moon Stone.

151_Pride Mew.name: Pride Mew
151_Pride Mew.description: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon and being neither male nor female at heart.

519_Pidove.name: Pidove
519_Pidove.description: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.

fields.Evolution: **Pidove** evolves to **Tranquill** starting from level 21, which evolves to **Unfezant** starting from level 32.

520_Tranquill.name: Tranquill
520_Tranquill.description: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.

fields.Evolution: **Tranquill** evolves from **Pidove** starting from level 21 and evolves to **Unfezant** starting from level 32.

521_Unfezant.name: Unfezant
521_Unfezant.description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

fields.Evolution: **Unfezant** evolves from **Tranquill** starting from level 32, which evolves from **Pidove** starting from level 21.

522_Blitzle.name: Blitzle
522_Blitzle.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

fields.Evolution: **Blitzle** evolves to **Zebstrika** starting from level 27.

523_Zebstrika.name: Zebstrika
523_Zebstrika.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

fields.Evolution: **Zebstrika** evolves from **Blitzle** starting from level 27.

524_Roggenrola.name: Roggenrola
524_Roggenrola.description: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.

fields.Evolution: **Roggenrola** evolves to **Boldore** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Gigalith** when traded.

525_Boldore.name: Boldore
525_Boldore.description: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.

fields.Evolution: **Boldore** evolves from **Roggenrola** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Gigalith** when traded.

526_Gigalith.name: Gigalith
526_Gigalith.description: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.

fields.Evolution: **Gigalith** evolves from **Boldore** when traded, which evolves from **Roggenrola** starting from level 25.

527_Woobat.name: Woobat
527_Woobat.description: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Woobat** evolves to **Swoobat** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

493_Pride Arceus.name: Pride Arceus
493_Pride Arceus.description: It is said to have emerged from a rainbow in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.

528_Swoobat.name: Swoobat
528_Swoobat.description: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

fields.Evolution: **Swoobat** evolves from **Woobat** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

529_Drilbur.name: Drilbur
529_Drilbur.description: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

fields.Evolution: **Drilbur** evolves to **Excadrill** starting from level 31.

530_Excadrill.name: Excadrill
530_Excadrill.description: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

fields.Evolution: **Excadrill** evolves from **Drilbur** starting from level 31.

531_Audino.name: Audino
531_Audino.description: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.

fields.Evolution: **Mega Audino** transforms from **Audino** when given a Mega Evolution.

532_Timburr.name: Timburr
532_Timburr.description: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

fields.Evolution: **Timburr** evolves to **Gurdurr** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Conkeldurr** when traded.

533_Gurdurr.name: Gurdurr
533_Gurdurr.description: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

fields.Evolution: **Gurdurr** evolves from **Timburr** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Conkeldurr** when traded.

534_Conkeldurr.name: Conkeldurr
534_Conkeldurr.description: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

fields.Evolution: **Conkeldurr** evolves from **Gurdurr** when traded, which evolves from **Timburr** starting from level 25.

535_Tympole.name: Tympole
535_Tympole.description: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

fields.Evolution: **Tympole** evolves to **Palpitoad** starting from level 25, which evolves to **Seismitoad** starting from level 36.

536_Palpitoad.name: Palpitoad
536_Palpitoad.description: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

fields.Evolution: **Palpitoad** evolves from **Tympole** starting from level 25 and evolves to **Seismitoad** starting from level 36.

537_Seismitoad.name: Seismitoad
537_Seismitoad.description: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

fields.Evolution: **Seismitoad** evolves from **Palpitoad** starting from level 36, which evolves from **Tympole** starting from level 25.

538_Throh.name: Throh
538_Throh.description: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.

539_Sawk.name: Sawk
539_Sawk.description: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

540_Sewaddle.name: Sewaddle
540_Sewaddle.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

fields.Evolution: **Sewaddle** evolves to **Swadloon** starting from level 20, which evolves to **Leavanny** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

541_Swadloon.name: Swadloon
541_Swadloon.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

fields.Evolution: **Swadloon** evolves from **Sewaddle** starting from level 20 and evolves to **Leavanny** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet.

542_Leavanny.name: Leavanny
542_Leavanny.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

fields.Evolution: **Leavanny** evolves from **Swadloon** when leveled up while holding a Friendship Bracelet, which evolves from **Sewaddle** starting from level 20.

543_Venipede.name: Venipede
543_Venipede.description: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.

fields.Evolution: **Venipede** evolves to **Whirlipede** starting from level 22, which evolves to **Scolipede** starting from level 30.

544_Whirlipede.name: Whirlipede
544_Whirlipede.description: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.

fields.Evolution: **Whirlipede** evolves from **Venipede** starting from level 22 and evolves to **Scolipede** starting from level 30.

545_Scolipede.name: Scolipede
545_Scolipede.description: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.

fields.Evolution: **Scolipede** evolves from **Whirlipede** starting from level 30, which evolves from **Venipede** starting from level 22.

546_Cottonee.name: Cottonee
546_Cottonee.description: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.

fields.Evolution: **Cottonee** evolves to **Whimsicott** using a Sun Stone.

547_Whimsicott.name: Whimsicott
547_Whimsicott.description: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

fields.Evolution: **Whimsicott** evolves from **Cottonee** using a Sun Stone.

548_Petilil.name: Petilil
548_Petilil.description: If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.

fields.Evolution: **Petilil** evolves to **Lilligant** using a Sun Stone.

549_Lilligant.name: Lilligant
549_Lilligant.description: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.

fields.Evolution: **Lilligant** evolves from **Petilil** using a Sun Stone.

549_Hisuian Lilligant.name: Hisuian Lilligant
549_Hisuian Lilligant.description: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

550_Basculin.name: Basculin
550_Basculin.description: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.

550_Blue-Striped Basculin.name: Blue-Striped Basculin
550_Blue-Striped Basculin.description: The power of its jaws is immense—enough to leave teeth marks in iron sheets. Its personality is also extremely vicious.

550_White-Striped Basculin.name: White-Striped Basculin
550_White-Striped Basculin.description: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

fields.Evolution: **White-Striped Basculin** evolves to **Basculegion** starting from level 29.

551_Sandile.name: Sandile
551_Sandile.description: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.

fields.Evolution: **Sandile** evolves to **Krokorok** starting from level 29, which evolves to **Krookodile** starting from level 40.

552_Krokorok.name: Krokorok
552_Krokorok.description: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.

fields.Evolution: **Krokorok** evolves from **Sandile** starting from level 29 and evolves to **Krookodile** starting from level 40.

554_Darumaka.name: Darumaka
554_Darumaka.description: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.

fields.Evolution: **Darumaka** evolves to **Darmanitan** starting from level 35.

553_Krookodile.name: Krookodile
553_Krookodile.description: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.

fields.Evolution: **Krookodile** evolves from **Krokorok** starting from level 40, which evolves from **Sandile** starting from level 29.

554_Galarian Darumaka.name: Galarian Darumaka
554_Galarian Darumaka.description: The colder they get, the more energetic they are. They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Darumaka** evolves to **Galarian Darmanitan** using a Ice Stone.

555_Darmanitan.name: Darmanitan
555_Darmanitan.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

fields.Evolution: **Darmanitan** evolves from **Darumaka** starting from level 35.

555_Galarian Zen Darmanitan.name: Galarian Zen Darmanitan
555_Galarian Zen Darmanitan.description: Darmanitan takes this form when enraged. It won’t stop spewing flames until its rage has settled, even if its body starts to melt.

555_Galarian Darmanitan.name: Galarian Darmanitan
555_Galarian Darmanitan.description: Though it has a gentle disposition, it’s also very strong. It will quickly freeze the snowball on its head before going for a headbutt.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Darmanitan** evolves from **Galarian Darumaka** using a Ice Stone.

556_Maractus.name: Maractus
556_Maractus.description: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

557_Dwebble.name: Dwebble
557_Dwebble.description: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

fields.Evolution: **Dwebble** evolves to **Crustle** starting from level 34.

789_Fireworks Cosmog.name: Fireworks Cosmog
789_Fireworks Cosmog.description: Its body is gaseous and frail. During the Holiday celebrations, it grows fast as it collects all the firework dust from the atmosphere.

558_Crustle.name: Crustle
558_Crustle.description: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

fields.Evolution: **Crustle** evolves from **Dwebble** starting from level 34.

559_Scraggy.name: Scraggy
559_Scraggy.description: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

fields.Evolution: **Scraggy** evolves to **Scrafty** starting from level 39.

560_Scrafty.name: Scrafty
560_Scrafty.description: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

fields.Evolution: **Scrafty** evolves from **Scraggy** starting from level 39.

561_Sigilyph.name: Sigilyph
561_Sigilyph.description: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

562_Galarian Yamask.name: Galarian Yamask
562_Galarian Yamask.description: It’s said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.

fields.Evolution: **Galarian Yamask** evolves to **Runerigus** somehow.

562_Yamask.name: Yamask
562_Yamask.description: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

fields.Evolution: **Yamask** evolves to **Cofagrigus** starting from level 34.

563_Cofagrigus.name: Cofagrigus
563_Cofagrigus.description: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

fields.Evolution: **Cofagrigus** evolves from **Yamask** starting from level 34.

564_Tirtouga.name: Tirtouga
564_Tirtouga.description: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.

fields.Evolution: **Tirtouga** evolves to **Carracosta** starting from level 37.

565_Carracosta.name: Carracosta
565_Carracosta.description: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.

fields.Evolution: **Carracosta** evolves from **Tirtouga** starting from level 37.

566_Archen.name: Archen
566_Archen.description: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Archen** evolves to **Archeops** starting from level 37.

567_Archeops.name: Archeops
567_Archeops.description: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.

fields.Evolution: **Archeops** evolves from **Archen** starting from level 37.

568_Trubbish.name: Trubbish
568_Trubbish.description: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

fields.Evolution: **Trubbish** evolves to **Garbodor** starting from level 36.

569_Garbodor.name: Garbodor
569_Garbodor.description: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

fields.Evolution: **Garbodor** evolves from **Trubbish** starting from level 36.

569_Gigantamax Garbodor.name: Gigantamax Garbodor
569_Gigantamax Garbodor.description: It sprays toxic gas from its mouth and fingers. If the gas engulfs you, the toxins will seep in all the way down to your bones.

570_Zorua.name: Zorua
570_Zorua.description: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Zorua** evolves to **Zoroark** starting from level 30.

570_Hisuian Zorua.name: Hisuian Zorua
570_Hisuian Zorua.description: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Zorua** evolves to **Hisuian Zoroark** starting from level 30.

571_Zoroark.name: Zoroark
571_Zoroark.description: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

fields.Evolution: **Zoroark** evolves from **Zorua** starting from level 30.

571_Hisuian Zoroark.name: Hisuian Zoroark
571_Hisuian Zoroark.description: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.

fields.Evolution: **Hisuian Zoroark** evolves from **Hisuian Zorua** starting from level 30.

572_Minccino.name: Minccino
572_Minccino.description: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.

fields.Evolution: **Minccino** evolves to **Cinccino** using a Shiny Stone.

573_Cinccino.name: Cinccino
573_Cinccino.description: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.

fields.Evolution: **Cinccino** evolves from **Minccino** using a Shiny Stone.

574_Gothita.name: Gothita
574_Gothita.description: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.

fields.Evolution: **Gothita** evolves to **Gothorita** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Gothitelle** starting from level 41.

575_Gothorita.name: Gothorita
575_Gothorita.description: Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokémon came from outer space.

fields.Evolution: **Gothorita** evolves from **Gothita** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Gothitelle** starting from level 41.

576_Gothitelle.name: Gothitelle
576_Gothitelle.description: It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.

fields.Evolution: **Gothitelle** evolves from **Gothorita** starting from level 41, which evolves from **Gothita** starting from level 32.

577_Solosis.name: Solosis
577_Solosis.description: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.

fields.Evolution: **Solosis** evolves to **Duosion** starting from level 32, which evolves to **Reuniclus** starting from level 41.

578_Duosion.name: Duosion
578_Duosion.description: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.

fields.Evolution: **Duosion** evolves from **Solosis** starting from level 32 and evolves to **Reuniclus** starting from level 41.

579_Reuniclus.name: Reuniclus
579_Reuniclus.description: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

fields.Evolution: **Reuniclus** evolves from **Duosion** starting from level 41, which evolves from **Solosis** starting from level 32.

580_Ducklett.name: Ducklett
580_Ducklett.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

fields.Evolution: **Ducklett** evolves to **Swanna** starting from level 35.

581_Swanna.name: Swanna
581_Swanna.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

fields.Evolution: **Swanna** evolves from **Ducklett** starting from level 35.

582_Vanillite.name: Vanillite
582_Vanillite.description: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

fields.Evolution: **Vanillite** evolves to **Vanillish** starting from level 35, which evolves to **Vanilluxe** starting from level 47.

583_Vanillish.name: Vanillish
583_Vanillish.description: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Vanillish** evolves from **Vanillite** starting from level 35 and evolves to **Vanilluxe** starting from level 47.

584_Vanilluxe.name: Vanilluxe
584_Vanilluxe.description: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

fields.Evolution: **Vanilluxe** evolves from **Vanillish** starting from level 47, which evolves from **Vanillite** starting from level 35.

1004_Gradient Chi-Yu.name: Gradient Chi-Yu
1004_Gradient Chi-Yu.description: It controls the colours of flames burning at over 3,000 degrees Celsius. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.

146_Olympic Flame Moltres.name: Olympic Flame Moltres
146_Olympic Flame Moltres.description: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Moltres is the perfect Pokémon to carry the Olympic Flame into the stadium.

585_Deerling.name: Deerling
585_Deerling.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

fields.Evolution: **Deerling** evolves to **Sawsbuck** starting from level 34.

585_Summer Deerling.name: Summer Deerling
585_Summer Deerling.description: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. When a distinct grassy smell starts to waft from one, you know that summer has begun.

fields.Evolution: **Summer Deerling** evolves to **Summer Sawsbuck** starting from level 34.

585_Autumn Deerling.name: Autumn Deerling
585_Autumn Deerling.description: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.

fields.Evolution: **Autumn Deerling** evolves to **Autumn Sawsbuck** starting from level 34.

585_Winter Deerling.name: Winter Deerling
585_Winter Deerling.description: This Pokémon will playfully headbutt those it gets along well with. It has antlers hidden under its flower, so the headbutts are a little painful.

fields.Evolution: **Winter Deerling** evolves to **Winter Sawsbuck** starting from level 34.

586_Sawsbuck.name: Sawsbuck
586_Sawsbuck.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

fields.Evolution: **Sawsbuck** evolves from **Deerling** starting from level 34.

586_Summer Sawsbuck.name: Summer Sawsbuck
586_Summer Sawsbuck.description: This Pokémon's leaves can be made into a black tea, the taste of which varies depending on the region of origin. Paldea's is especially aromatic.

fields.Evolution: **Summer Sawsbuck** evolves from **Summer Deerling** starting from level 34.

586_Autumn Sawsbuck.name: Autumn Sawsbuck
586_Autumn Sawsbuck.description: Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are known for having very short tempers. The males fight each other incessantly.

fields.Evolution: **Autumn Sawsbuck** evolves from **Autumn Deerling** starting from level 34.

586_Winter Sawsbuck.name: Winter Sawsbuck
586_Winter Sawsbuck.description: Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.

fields.Evolution: **Winter Sawsbuck** evolves from **Winter Deerling** starting from level 34.

587_Emolga.name: Emolga
587_Emolga.description: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.

588_Karrablast.name: Karrablast
588_Karrablast.description: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.

fields.Evolution: **Karrablast** evolves to **Escavalier** when traded.

589_Escavalier.name: Escavalier
589_Escavalier.description: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

fields.Evolution: **Escavalier** evolves from **Karrablast** when traded.

590_Foongus.name: Foongus
590_Foongus.description: This Pokémon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.

fields.Evolution: **Foongus** evolves to **Amoonguss** starting from level 39.

591_Amoonguss.name: Amoonguss
591_Amoonguss.description: Amoonguss mimics Poké Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokémon.

fields.Evolution: **Amoonguss** evolves from **Foongus** starting from level 39.

592_Frillish.name: Frillish
592_Frillish.description: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

fields.Evolution: **Frillish** evolves to **Jellicent** starting from level 40.

593_Jellicent.name: Jellicent
593_Jellicent.description: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It’s rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

fields.Evolution: **Jellicent** evolves from **Frillish** starting from level 40.

594_Alomomola.name: Alomomola
594_Alomomola.description: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.

595_Joltik.name: Joltik
595_Joltik.description: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

fields.Evolution: **Joltik** evolves to **Galvantula** starting from level 36.

596_Galvantula.name: Galvantula
596_Galvantula.description: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

fields.Evolution: **Galvantula** evolves from **Joltik** starting from level 36.

597_Ferroseed.name: Ferroseed
597_Ferroseed.description: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.

fields.Evolution: **Ferroseed** evolves to **Ferrothorn** starting from level 40.

598_Ferrothorn.name: Ferrothorn
598_Ferrothorn.description: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

fields.Evolution: **Ferrothorn** evolves from **Ferroseed** starting from level 40.

599_Klink.name: Klink
599_Klink.description: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.

fields.Evolution: **Klink** evolves to **Klang** starting from level 38, which evolves to **Klinklang** starting from level 49.

600_Klang.name: Klang
600_Klang.description: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

fields.Evolution: **Klang** evolves from **Klink** starting from level 38 and evolves to **Klinklang** starting from level 49.

601_Klinklang.name: Klinklang
601_Klinklang.description: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.

fields.Evolution: **Klinklang** evolves from **Klang** starting from level 49, which evolves from **Klink** starting from level 38.

602_Tynamo.name: Tynamo
602_Tynamo.description: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

fields.Evolution: **Tynamo** evolves to **Eelektrik** starting from level 39, which evolves to **Eelektross** using a Thunder Stone.

603_Eelektrik.name: Eelektrik
603_Eelektrik.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

fields.Evolution: **Eelektrik** evolves from **Tynamo** starting from level 39 and evolves to **Eelektross** using a Thunder Stone.

604_Eelektross.name: Eelektross
604_Eelektross.description: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.

fields.Evolution: **Eelektross** evolves from **Eelektrik** using a Thunder Stone, which evolves from **Tynamo** starting from level 39.

491_Error Darkrai.name: Error Darkrai
491_Error Darkrai.description: In a world dominated by AI, a powerful Darkrai is trapped in a decaying virtual Pokémon battle system. Twisted by data corruption, it moves between reality and broken digital realms, dragging victims into a fractured dreamscape.

493_Glitched Beta Arceus.name: Glitched Beta Arceus
493_Glitched Beta Arceus.description: In an alternate universe, Glitched Beta Arceus emerged from equations which it bends to shape the world in bits and bytes.

806_Corrupted Blacephalon.name: Corrupted Blacephalon
806_Corrupted Blacephalon.description: An error caused by corrupted ultra wormholes makes its explosions stronger than any before it.

893_Druid Zarude.name: Druid Zarude
893_Druid Zarude.description: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a grove with others of its kind. It’s focused on the health of the forest and sees it as its purpose to keep the forest alive.
